Subject: [sfraves] || MAY DAY! Saturday, May 1st 2004! $5 PRESALES | ALL AGES! .bsp.

Liquidvinyldjs.com is very proud to present..


MAY DAY!
Saturday, May 1st 2004
8:00pm - 4:00am
500 Person Capacity
1 ROOM VIRGIN LOCATION - Centrally located in the Bay Area!
ALL RESPONSIBLE AGES WELCOME!


With MAY DAY!, we would like to celebrate the beginnings of Summer with a 
very intimate 1 room experience! Join us as we kick the summer of just right 
in a brand new location, close to everyone here in the Bay Area!


DJ's for the night:


|| DJ LUNA-C
[Kniteforce North American Tour || KFA/Kniteforce, UK] - SPECIAL BIRTHDAY 
SET!!
We are very proud to bring DJ LUNA-C to the Bay for his special Birthday 
Set. This will be the last stop on his very exclusive Kniteforce North 
American Tour, and this night just happens to be on his birthday! He's 
coming prepared to showcase a very special set exclusive to us here in San 
Francisco, which is sure to absolutely blow you away. If you've seen LUNA-C 
at any of our past events, you know he will completely take the roof off the 
place and have you moving, from the first record to the last! Please allow 
us to wish our good friend a very Happy Birthday here in the Bay!

|| CLOUDSKIPPER vs. THE NICE GUYS
[Raw Elements/Kniteforce/Liquidvinyldjs.com vs. Liquidvinyldjs.com/K-12] - 
3X6 INSANITY SET!
In what is sure to be one of the more talked about sets this year, 
Cloudskipper faces off against The Nice Guys. Relatively little is known 
about The Nice Guys, except, well, they're nice. In any case, be prepared 
for in your face up front hardcore, a lot of unreleased music, as well as 
onstage antics that can only be described as pure madness!

|| DJ TRONIC
[Resistance Recordings/Liquidvinyldjs.com/CHR]
In preparation for his anticipated European tour, Tronic's set is going to 
be chalked full of brand new hard hittin material! This will be his last 
local appearance before he heads off to Europe for 2 weeks, so be ready for 
the Hard Beats!

|| MAJERE
[Elektrosorcery, DJMajere.com] - SPECIAL TRANCECORE/FREEFORM SET!
In a rare appearance playing trancecore/freeform, Majere is taking a bit of 
a step back into his roots. Expect a set of fast and hard mind melting 
music, which can only be appreciated by those ready to move!

|| THE DOCTOR & MC FADER
[Liquidvinyldjs.com/Bayraves.com || Gravitycrew.com/Emceeds]
Quite possibly one of the best DnB/Jungle DJ's in Northern California, The 
Doctor has become a household name. You can catch him almost every weekend 
droppin those hard hittin tracks all over! In tow is the MC called Fader, in 
which really needs no introduction. These two go together like steak and 
eggs, like butter on toast, like.. well you get the idea!

|| DJ J-MARR
[Liquidvinyldjs.com/Bayraves.com] - FAREWELL SET!
The man, the myth, the legend. Need we say more? Known from up and down the 
West Coast for not only his music, but also his energetic charisma, J-Marr 
is a legend in the scene. This will be his last set behind the decks, ending 
a tenure other DJ's can only dream about. Be there to witness J-Marr rocking 
in his usual manner, for the last time!

|| CARLOS ALFONZO vs. RECLIPSE
[Resistance Recordings/Soop Recordings vs. D&A Music/Bayraves]
The battle of the BBQ Iron Chef Carlos and the Maddest Mad DJ around, this 
will be a treat to all those who appreciated hard techno... and we do mean 
HARD. These two will come out swingin' with pure dancefloor driven 
material.. get ready to rock!

|| LEON COOK vs. PETER GO-ZANIA!
[Hardscience/Logik Pro Audio]
These two have been rapidly rising among the Hardcore faithful here in the 
Bay, and with their crowd rockin performances and talent behind the decks, 
it's really no wonder why. Expect a set full of freeform and upfront 
Hardcore material only these guys bring to the table.

|| DJ DMS
[Oakland Bounce/Dream Crew]


>From the same people who brought you HAPPY TOGETHER 1 & 2, OVERLOAD 1, 2, & 
3, SUMMER ROCKIN, and GET UP!. MAY DAY will be an extremely special night to 
us, where we are celebrating the coming of summer, as well as our good 
friend LUNA-C's birthday. If you've loved the vibe and sharing of the music 
we've had at past events, this will be no different!!


MAY DAY SOUND PROVIDED BY: HARDSCIENCE
MAY DAY VISUALS & LASERS PROVIDED BY: STIMULIGHTS.COM


VERY LIMITED $5 Presale Tickets will go on sale Wednesday, March 31st at the 
following locations:

SKILLS DJ WORKSHOP  |    BERKELEY   |  510.704.9876
SOLID GROOVES       |  SANTA CLARA  |  408.248.6399
FREQUENCY 8         | SAN FRANCISCO |  415.221.4142
STRAIGHT HITS       |    FREMONT    |  510.745.7843
IN THA MIX          |   SACRAMENTO  |  916.442.0499
ONLINE              |  http://www.groovetickets.com

Once those $5 Presales sell out, they will go to $10. Once those $10 tickets 
sell out, we will have tickets at the door for $15! All of our previous 
events have sold out, and we don't expect this to be different! Make sure 
you get a presale ticket for guaranteed entry!

Giveaways from most of the DJ's playing! CD's, Vinyl, T-Shirts, maybe even 
some dishes! ;)

If you've enjoyed our events in the past, this will be no different! Don't 
miss out on MAY DAY!! Thank you and we appreciate your support!


For more information:

(415) 820-1454

http://www.liquidvinyldjs.com


We look forward to seeing you all there for MAY DAY!

Date: Thu, 1 Apr 2004 11:08:48 EST
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org, oldschool@hyperreal.org, nyc-raves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] American and Canadian Officials Bust Drug Ring..  bummer dude!

-------------------------------1080835728
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

WASHINGTON (March 31) - A U.S.-Canadian drug trafficking ring believed 
responsible for 15 percent of all the Ecstasy smuggled into America has been wiped 
out, authorities said Wednesday. They announced arrests and criminal charges 
against 170 people.
At its height, the ring distributed 1 million Ecstasy tablets per month in 
the two countries and laundered $5 million a month using travel agencies and 
bank transfers in the United States and Vietnam, officials said.
Drug Enforcement Administration chief Karen Tandy said the two-year 
investigation culminated in the arrests of nearly the entire trafficking operation, 
from leaders to couriers.
''We wiped out this entire organization,'' Tandy said at a news conference.
Ecstasy, or MDMA, is a synthetic controlled substance known originally as a 
''club drug'' because of its popularity at gatherings called ''raves'' and 
dance clubs. It has spread to high schools and colleges, with an estimated 3.2 
million people using the drug in 2002, according to the DEA.
It was once thought of as a harmless drug. But research has found that 
prolonged, heavy use of Ecstasy can cause confusion, depression, anxiety, aggressive 
and impulsive behavior, and memory loss, according to the National Institute 
on Drug Abuse.
Its popularity has caught the attention of an increasing range of criminal 
enterprises, largely because of the big profits. Pills sold at about $4 apiece 
wholesale in the operation typically cost $15 to $20 each on the street.
The organization targeted by U.S. and Canadian authorities consisted largely 
of people with Asian backgrounds, according to court documents. The alleged 
ringleaders were Ze Wai Wong, 46, a Chinese citizen, and Mai Phuong Le, 38, a 
Vietnamese citizen. Wong was arrested in Toronto and Le in Ottawa.
They operated three labs in Canada, which were discovered and dismantled in 
August, authorities said. The pills often were smuggled across the U.S. border 
or inside Canada in compartments within vehicle gas tanks, making the drugs 
hard to detect, particularly for drug-sniffing dogs.
The Supreme Court on Tuesday unanimously ruled that government agents have 
broad authority to search and even dismantle vehicle gas tanks to combat 
smuggling at U.S. borders.
The ring also used hidden gas tank compartments to transport cash. In one 
instance, the search of a vehicle headed for Canada in Burlington, Vt., yielded 
$750,000 in U.S. currency concealed in the compartment.
Authorities said the Wong-Le organization differs from previous Ecstasy 
trafficking groups because it is the first known to have manufactured the pills on 
a large scale in North America. The main sources of Ecstasy previously have 
been the Netherlands and Belgium.
These methods, said Deputy Attorney General James Comey, are ''a signal to us 
that, as we feared, the profits available in Ecstasy are attracting new 
traffickers and new ways of trafficking.''
U.S. and Canadian charging documents accuse Wong of leading a drug 
distribution ring in 18 U.S. cities and Canada and contend that Le orchestrated the 
laundering of drug money for the operation. They and the others are charged with a 
lengthy list of counts including conspiracy to distribute Ecstasy and 
operating a continuing criminal enterprise.
The organization also trafficked in Canadian-grown marijuana, known as ''BC 
Bud,'' and was involved in identity theft and other criminal enterprises, 
officials said. Raf Souccar, drug chief for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, said 
eight marijuana-growing operations were shut down Wednesday in the Ottawa 
area.
Of those charged in arrest warrants, about 145 had been arrested as of 
Wednesday afternoon. Arrest and search warrants were executed in 16 American cities, 
with Canadian authorities serving 50 arrest warrants in Ottawa, Toronto and 
Montreal.
Arrests were made in these U.S. cities: Houston; Los Angeles; San Francisco; 
Oakland, Calif.; San Jose, Calif.; Jacksonville, Fla.; New Orleans; Baton 
Rouge, La.; Mobile, Ala.; New York; Boston; Atlanta; Alexandria, Va.; Des Moines, 
Iowa; Minneapolis and Salt Lake City.

-------------------------------1080835728--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Breakbeats tonight @ Shadow Lounge - FREE!

in truely blatant self promotion form i bring thee....

Free Breakbeats!  Tonight!  Shadowlounge (lounge, lounge, lounge....*echo 
echo*)!!

With absolutely no previous notice, no flyers plastering the cars of the SF 
streets, not even a mention in the SF Weekly, and no big name DJs with 
British accents!

um...so check it out.  tonight!

Shadow Lounge
9th and Folsom, SF
Free, no cover
21+

DJs:
Aaron Jae (www.aaronjae.com, Evil Breaks)
M.O.D. (do i have to mention that he plays breaks?)
DJ Bam (hey, that's me! i love you all.)

with guests for the month:
8th - Donna Matrix (flailing your backside with a whiplash of dirty breaks)a
15th - Doubleday (with his birthday on the 16th, i'm going to throw a pie in 
his face at midnight)
22nd - Vega (he's from Sactown, but we hear he's an alright guy!)
29th - Greg J (i don't hesitate to use the term "old school" to refer to 
him...and i mean that in a good way)

come on out and toss back a drink with me.  it's free!  (well, the drinks 
aren't free...)  it all kicks off tonight!

and keep your ears open and eyes peeled for future dates with your local 
breakbeat slingin' cowboys and cowgirls.  yeeeeee haaaaa!!!!!!

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Subject: Jam Master Jay Tribute

This Friday a worthy event, dont miss it. party with a mission.

Project Pangea, NextAid, Hip Hop Film Fest & friends present a celebration =
of all aspects of Hip Hop culture in honor of the late Jam Master Jay.

=A0
The event opens up from 7-9pm with a Hip Hop Film Fest, curated and moderat=
ed by Kevin Epps (Dir. Straight Outta Hunters Point).=A0

Content for the main event includes an exclusive pre-recorded video present=
ation by
Chuck D (Public Enemy) and live performances by
GrandWizzard Theodore (Inventor of the Scratch),
Radio Active (Michael Franti & Spearhead),

DJs Pam the Funkstress (The Coup),
Toph One, Polywog, Marz, Relm,
Jay Slim and Pone,

Indian/Hip Hop fusion by blacKMahal Soundset,

Beatbox presentation by Felonious,

Coed Bboy Exhibition by Flavor Group,

Knowledge Lounge moderated by One Mic=92s Adisa Banjoko,

Video art by DJ Pioneer Stefan G and Dax Presents,

Live Art Battle with Abe & Twick, MC L*Roneous,

Spoken Word from Deep Dickollective,

a silent auction with photos by Henry Chalfant (Style Wars), and more.

=A0
All proceeds will help buy music instruments for underprivileged children t=
hrough The Jam Master Jay Foundation for Music, NextAid and potentially I.S=
=2E 192 (the middle school that Jay attended in Hollis, Queens).

Friday, April 2nd, 7pm-2am.=A0 Mezzanine, 444 Jessie @ Mint.

The eFlyer is posted online at http://mrbrown.c.topica.com/maab6f5aa5Dara5w=
REZb/
=A0
=A0The Press Release is posted online at http://mrbrown.c.topica.com/maab6f=
5aa5Dasa5wREZb/

=A0Online ticket sales will be at www.acteva.com/go/pangea

X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2600.0000
In-Reply-To: <1996D4764E078B40AEA443099972D7096ABBA2@US-TRILLIUM.columbia.csc>
Importance: Normal
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 01 Apr 2004 22:32:35.0082 (UTC) FILETIME=[3ABC06A0:01C41839]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] [NRR]Dihydrogen Monoxide

------=_NextPart_000_0002_01C417F6.2C485CB0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

For those of you who don't know, Dihydrogen Monoxide is the #1
unregulated chemical released by thousands of factories in the US each
year, and the EPA has refused to do anything to regulate it.  It causes
thousands of deaths in the US alone each year.  The gas form can cause
burns, and lengthy exposure to the solid form can cause lethargy,
numbness of the limbs, and eventually death.  However, the liquid form
is the most dangerous, and accidental ingestion of it is what causes the
most deaths.  If you want to learn more, you can go to this website:
http://www.netreach.net/~rjones/no_dhmo.html or do a google searchfor
Dihydrogen Monoxide.  I've found tons of useful information on the web.
Let's help ban this chemical once and for all!

 

Jason


------=_NextPart_000_0002_01C417F6.2C485CB0--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [NRR]Dihydrogen Monoxide

-------------------------------1080865275
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Ravers should note that, while ingestion of this chemical in moderate amounts 
is a good thing when exercising/sweating/dancing, ingesting too much can 
result in death. The condition is known as "hyponatremia" and means there is not 
enough salt in the blood. So, go ahead and pay your $2 or $3 per "dose" of this 
chemical, but use some sense when putting this chemical into your body -- 
don't overdo it! 

It does have a useful purpose after parties as well:  its characteristics as 
a solvent help remove "raver funk" from the skin. It's also good to take some 
along with 5-HTP, helping one to recover from a hard weekend of partying. 

-------------------------------1080865275--

Ravers should note that, while ingestion of this chemical in moderate
amounts is a good thing when exercising/sweating/dancing, ingesting too
much can result in death. The condition is known as "hyponatremia" and
means there is not enough salt in the blood. So, go ahead and pay your
$2 or $3 per "dose" of this chemical, but use some sense when putting
this chemical into your body -- don't overdo it! 

 

It does have a useful purpose after parties as well:  its
characteristics as a solvent help remove "raver funk" from the skin.
It's also good to take some along with 5-HTP, helping one to recover
from a hard weekend of partying.

to be finished off by a 4-foot glitter ball... But I have survived and I'm
still here, although my back is aching like anything. It caught my ear,
which is really sore as well."

Jason <djjasonphilips@hotmail.com> wrote:
For those of you who don't know, Dihydrogen Monoxide is the #1
unregulated chemical released by thousands of factories in the US each
year, and the EPA has refused to do anything to regulate it. It causes
thousands of deaths in the US alone each year. The gas form can cause
burns, and lengthy exposure to the solid form can cause lethargy,
numbness of the limbs, and eventually death. However, the liquid form
is the most dangerous, and accidental ingestion of it is what causes the
most deaths. If you want to learn more, you can go to this website:
http://www.netreach.net/~rjones/no_dhmo.html or do a google searchfor
Dihydrogen Monoxide. I've found tons of useful information on the web.
Let's help ban this chemical once and for all!



Jason

Jason wrote:
For those of you who don't know, Dihydrogen Monoxide is the #1
unregulated chemical released by thousands of factories in the US each
year, and the EPA has refused to do anything to regulate it. It causes
thousands of deaths in the US alone each year. The gas form can cause
burns, and lengthy exposure to the solid form can cause lethargy,
numbness of the limbs, and eventually death. However, the liquid form
is the most dangerous, and accidental ingestion of it is what causes the
most deaths. If you want to learn more, you can go to this website:
http://www.netreach.net/~rjones/no_dhmo.html or do a google searchfor
Dihydrogen Monoxide. I've found tons of useful information on the web.
Let's help ban this chemical once and for all!

Hello everyone!

I am starting a new email discussion group and would like to invite you to be a part of this. We will be talking about whatever you feel like sharing. Personally, I plan to include discussion regarding events in San Francisco and the bay area, artistic people and happenings, political view points, and things of high or low importance but with good entertainment or knowledge value. Please join us as we share and grow through the bonds we create.

WOW. WOW. WOW.

Did anyone just watch the ABC report on ecstasy? I think that is the most 
positive news broadcast I have *ever* seen. I think they touched on *alot* of 
what all of us have said at one time or another. I can't even remember the last 
time I took E and I am not actively taking *any* drugs nowadays, but I'm still 
very happy about that report, particularly about the finger pointing at the 
government. Given the climate of today with all the government foot soldiers in 
the media, I am pretty amazed at what this report touched on, especially 
pointing out that the faulty reports like the ones they published only undermines 
our trust in them and to what degree we'll listen to them in the future... boy 
who cried wolf syndrome, so to speak.

Way to go. Who ever though ABC, a Christian run broadcasting company, would 
produce and air this? I am so relieved, in fact, that I just signed back on to 
SFR after being absent for forever to discuss this. : )

Also, does anyone else find that there's nothing like a news broadcast about 
how bad ecstasy and raves are that makes you want to go out and take a pill 
again? ; )

heart,
Alida

--part1_1ec.1cdb68c0.2d9e6b5d_boundary--

I just got done watching the thing...

.... and HOLY FUCKING SHIT!!!!  That's something I never thought I'd 
see coming from a major network, and CERTAINLY nothing I though I'd see 
from ABC (which had a series of ecstasy scare-story specials in prime 
time, a while back).

I think they went way too light on that doctor at Johns Hopkins who got 
caught falsifying his research.  But other that that, it was everything 
short of calling the government a bunch of bullshit-spewing liars!  And 
I guess with bush's FCC on the rampage these days, you really can't get 
away with saying such things explicitly.

I especially like the way he ended the show: saying that even if 
credible research showing that there IS permanent and long-term brain 
damage DOES show up in the future, that no one will believe them, after 
all the lies they've told so far.  Too true, too true.  Methinks that 
far too many people have forgotten the tale of "The Boy Who Cried Wolf"


cya,
john

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Peter Jennings' Ecstasy Story....

	I just watched it too, and I agree it was a major breakthrough. 
Especially helpful was the interviews with older, articulate people who 
have used the drug and had positive experiences. I think maybe John 
Stossel is having an effect on the rest of ABC. I do wish Jennings had 
used some side-by-side comparisons the way Stossel often does. Too many 
people who watch the special will still come away with impressions like 
"people have died from Ecstasy" or "Ecstasy poses unknown risks." 
Comparing Ecstasy to various legal substances and activities which are 
more deadly, or pose equally unknown risks, would have helped put 
legitimate concerns in proper perspective. I also felt the show made 
Alexander Shulgin come across a bit like Dr. Frankenstein, out there 
tampering alone in his lab with all kinds of dangerous chemicals and 
heedless of the consequences, when in fact he is a very careful and 
conscientious scientist. Still, kudos to ABC for ripping a big hole in 
the government's lying propaganda.

					<<< Starchild >>>

Truth be told, ecstacy, pure MDMA, was created as an anti-depressant. It makes you feel good, therefore the government must do what they can to convince us not to use it. They wouldn't want us taking away from their "legal" anti-depressants in the big money making pharmaceutical industry. It's funny how they never mention the side effects of Paxil when they are about 1000 times worse than anything ecstacy, pure MDMA, can do to people. Such as:
 
"Frequent - Paxil - Seroxat (Paroxetine) Side Effects

Body as a Whole: Malaise (a vague feeling of bodily discomfort), pain. Cardiovascular: Hypertension, syncope (a sudden loss of strength, a temporary suspension of consciousness due to cerebral anemia), tachycardia (excessive rapidity in the action of the heart). Dermatological: Pruritus (Intense itching) Gastrointestinal: Nausea and vomiting. Metabolic and Nutritional: Weight gain, weight loss. Nervous System: Central Nervous System stimulation, concentration impaired, depression, emotional lability (emotional instability), vertigo (a hallucination of movement; a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient or as if he himself were revolving in space). Respiratory: Cough increased, rhinitis (inflammation of the mucus membrane of the nose). " 
 
Taken from http://www.prozactruth.com/paxil.htm.
 
"Legal" anti-depressants have MUCH worse side effects and severe withdrawal symptoms. Paxil is even warned of driving some users to suicide due to their absolute dependence on this "legal" drug that is regularly pushed by your trusted family doctors. 
 
Does anyone see anything wrong with this picture? Our government doesn't want the street drug competition and that is why their efforts regarding the "War on Drugs" rages on. If you ever pay attention to the side effects of the most commonly prescribed FDA approved drugs, you will clearly see the governments concern for our helath is NOT their number one priority. The bottom line, as always, is big business, big $$. 
 
Check out this article posted today on Yahoo news regarding a drug bust and "the dangers of ecstacy". http://news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story&u=/ap/20040331/ap_on_re_us/us_canada_ecstasy
 
How many times can they tell the same lies when no one is believing them anymore? Seems to carry over into many aspects...


LittleEtoile@aol.com wrote:

WOW. WOW. WOW.

Did anyone just watch the ABC report on ecstasy? I think that is the most 
positive news broadcast I have *ever* seen. I think they touched on *alot* of 
what all of us have said at one time or another. I can't even remember the last 
time I took E and I am not actively taking *any* drugs nowadays, but I'm still 
very happy about that report, particularly about the finger pointing at the 
government. Given the climate of today with all the government foot soldiers in 
the media, I am pretty amazed at what this report touched on, especially 
pointing out that the faulty reports like the ones they published only undermines 
our trust in them and to what degree we'll listen to them in the future... boy 
who cried wolf syndrome, so to speak.

Way to go. Who ever though ABC, a Christian run broadcasting company, would 
produce and air this? I am so relieved, in fact, that I just signed back on to 
SFR after being absent for forever to discuss this. : )

Also, does anyone else find that there's nothing like a news broadcast about 
how bad ecstasy and raves are that makes you want to go out and take a pill 
again? ; )

heart,
Alida

military victory..."

I was thinking the same exact thing re: SSRI's etc. during the show as well. 
I mean hell, we don't really know the long term side effects of those drugs 
either! And I was just talking to a woman the other day about when she went of 
prozac after being on it for a few years and how severe the withdraws were. She 
said she had never been so miserable in her life and that she had every 
possible horrible side effect all at once for three months. Yes, of course, 
everyone reacts differently... not everyone has those side effects, nor does everyone 
feel depressed the day after taking E.... but I've heard of far more people 
having unbearable side effects from legal antidepressants and anxiety 
medications, and more importantly having their day to day *life* dramatically impacted 
by it, then I do with ecstasy users. I don't think there has been anyone who 
was driven to kill while they were on ecstasy, yet there are many controversial 
murder/suicide cases involving people that were recently places on 
antidepressants/anxiety medications prior to the deaths.

I have to wonder though, and I'm sure there is a reason that I just don't 
know about.... if MDMA was developed as an antidepressant, yadda yadda, and it's 
making all this money on the streets and so many people are taking it, etc... 
why not legalize it and get the pharmaceutical companies in on it so they can 
become even *more* profitable (*vomit*)? I'm going to take a stab and say that 
it is because MDMA generally actually makes people bond, feel loving and 
compassionate, it is conscious altering, etc. rather than just making the person 
numb and passive? Brave New World anyone?

heart,
Alida

NOW BOOKING for MAY, JUNE & JULY-tell your friend who is an artist, to show 
their art! All Art Crews welcome, more unique the better...

painters, photographers, visualists, belly dancers,

mimes, freaks, s&m wonders, human curiosities,

human oddities, fetishes, insect-eaters, fire-eaters,

albinos, painted indians, dwarfs, midgets, giants, human catarpillars,

break-dancers (roboter/poppers,wavers), circus sideshows,

burning man themes, light shows, rappers, screamers,

performance artists (no drummers please),

puppet acts, ventriloquists, invisible disappearing acts,

body parts in clear jars, lion faced men, bearded ladies,

mule-faced women, dog faced boys, jewelry makers, clowns,

balloon twisters, jugglers, chinese acrobatic sex acts,

magicians, one-acts, fairies, zombies, goths, face/body painters,

human pin heads, girl fly, boy bug, superheros,

installation artists, quasimodos, contortionists,

thrill acts, fortune tellers,

heavily tattooed people,

sword swallowing,

unicyclers & stilt walkers (only out front of the club),

and any elephant men are welcome to apply ,

and oh top less DJs are most highly welcomed-
.et cetera.just raw material for the best freak show is San Francisco

contact above email address for more details,
send website and a little about your art/creative process
and how many people you plan on inviting to your opening.

The club's curator will review and concider your work and be back in-touch 
with you quickly via e-mail to book you. The curator can't book just anyone, 
only the people he/or she feels will do their best.

MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: localhost.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Surprised? Just a bit!...ecstacy story

Here's a really good article on the history of MDMA:
http://www.a1b2c3.com/drugs/x_01.htm

It notes that the psychiatric/psychotherapeutic use of MDMA started
in the mid 1970's. Interesting point to note that the US commissioned
research in the 1950's in pursuit of a truth serum for the Army's
chemical warefare...later proving not suitable for that purpose.

<que cera cera>

Highlights:

"...A MAPS History of MDMA

MDMA was first synthesized in 1912. It was patented in Germany by the
Merck Company in 1914. At that time it was not the subject of human
research.

Merck stumbled across MDMA when they tried to synthesize Hydrastinin, a
vasoconstrictive and styptic medicine.

MDMA was an unplanned by-product of this synthesis. As usual, the process
of its synthesis was patented.

It can not be reconstructed to what extent Merck tested MDMA and what the
results of such testing were, but it can be excluded with certainty that
MDMA was ever considered as an appetite suppressant.

In the 1950s it was briefly researched by the U.S. Government as part of
the CIA's and the Army's chemical warfare investigations, a commissioned
research in 1953/54 on MDA, MDMA and other substances as a truth serum.
They proved to be unsuitable for this purpose.

The results of this research were not published until 1973. The first
reported recreational use was in the 1960s.

In the middle 1970s, it was rediscovered by the psychedelic therapy
community and began to be used as an adjunct to psychotherapy by
psychiatrists and therapists who were familiar with the field of
psychedelic psychotherapy. MAPS published a book, The Secret Chief, about
the leader of this therapy community.

The above info came from MAPS, for more, on The Struggle to Conduct
Research into the Therapeutic Use of MDMA, go to the MAPS Website.

More History of MDMA

In the early 1980s, the drug began to be used non-medically, particularly
in Texas, under the name Ecstasy.

Both the non-medical and therapeutic use of MDMA were made illegal in 1985
despite the Drug Enforcement Administration Administrative Law Judge
Francis Young's recommendation that physicians be permitted to continue to
administer it to their patients.

Soon afterwards its use rapidly spread outside the United States as well.
In Dallas, where alcohol was prohibited at the Southern Methodist
University, students bought legal MDMA as a substitute, paying by credit
card.

The US consumption rose from 10,000 doses in the whole year of 1976 to
30,000 doses a month in 1985. At the same time the Drug Enforcement
Administration (DEA) reported that 30,000 doses a month were being used in
the state of Texas alone.

A 1987 survey revealed that 40% of students on the campus of Stanford
University had used MDMA. In 1985 MDMA was prohibited by the Drug
Enforcement Administration, when it was given the same status as heroin
and LSD..."

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************

much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

>
> Truth be told, ecstacy, pure MDMA, was created as an anti-depressant. It makes you feel good, therefore the government must do what they can to convince us not to use it. They wouldn't want us taking away from their "legal" anti-depressants in the big money making pharmaceutical industry. It's funny how they never mention the side effects of Paxil when they are about 1000 times worse than anything ecstacy, pure MDMA, can do to people. Such as:
>
> "Frequent - Paxil - Seroxat (Paroxetine) Side Effects
>
> Body as a Whole: Malaise (a vague feeling of bodily discomfort), pain. Cardiovascular: Hypertension, syncope (a sudden loss of strength, a temporary suspension of consciousness due to cerebral anemia), tachycardia (excessive rapidity in the action of the heart). Dermatological: Pruritus (Intense itching) Gastrointestinal: Nausea and vomiting. Metabolic and Nutritional: Weight gain, weight loss. Nervous System: Central Nervous System stimulation, concentration impaired, depression, emotional lability (emotional instability), vertigo (a hallucination of movement; a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient or as if he himself were revolving in space). Respiratory: Cough increased, rhinitis (inflammation of the mucus membrane of the nose). "
>
> Taken from http://www.prozactruth.com/paxil.htm.
>
> "Legal" anti-depressants have MUCH worse side effects and severe withdrawal symptoms. Paxil is even warned of driving some users to suicide due to their absolute dependence on this "legal" drug that is regularly pushed by your trusted family doctors.
>
> Does anyone see anything wrong with this picture? Our government doesn't want the street drug competition and that is why their efforts regarding the "War on Drugs" rages on. If you ever pay attention to the side effects of the most commonly prescribed FDA approved drugs, you will clearly see the governments concern for our helath is NOT their number one priority. The bottom line, as always, is big business, big $$.
>
> Check out this article posted today on Yahoo news regarding a drug bust and "the dangers of ecstacy". http://news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story&u=/ap/20040331/ap_on_re_us/us_canada_ecstasy
>

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: 4/3/04 Punch and Slip: A Jungle Juice House Party

Here's the link to the prettier (not pretty, but prettier) version: 
http://www.brproductions.net/BBS1/viewtopic.php?t=5530&sid=51aef3dd417d650fd79c7273a63572af

Othewise, here ya go:

(4/3/2004) Punch and Slip: A Jungle Juice House Party
Featuring The Flank from Santa Cruz, CA


The Deal:
Free House party at my house for anyone who doesn't break shit and can 
respect a house. It's BYOB so come fully stocked (and bring extra for me  ). 
As long as everything goes according to plan there will be open decks for 
those who want to play (see below). We are having a band from Santa Cruz 
come and play as well.

The Catch:
So check it, I'm down to throw a house party this Sat but I don't have any 
sound. If someone has some powered monitors or sound they could contribute, 
you get priority on the time you want to play (except when the band plays, 
see below). PM or email me if you want to play or if you can bring sound (a 
nicer mixer would be cool too). Basically, sound is the necessity at the 
moment.

Other Stuff:
We are having a band come through and play. They are The Flank from Santa 
Cruz. That's right people, a band, you know... with real instruments! They 
will probably play from 12-1 or 1-2, so come early and get your swerve on. 
Other than that, open decks but I'm going to reserve slots for people who 
get in touch with me so that we don't have the same issue we had last time. 
Respectful promoters are welcome to come through, but if you flyer any of 
the cars in the neighborhood I am going to put your face on a milk carton. 
Again, promoters are welcome but you cannot flyer outside of the house, 
period. Remember, cig butts go in the trash, not my front yard or the 
street. Thanks.

I guess that's is... If I work out some sort of time schedule for 
everything, I'll post it.

W3RD ^,
-Joey

PS, If you wanna get your swerve on and you need to crash here, it's cool; 
just bring some blankets or whatever and find a corner to crawl into  .

PPS, Bring stuff for jungle juice

Subject: [sfraves] RR: Thursday Breaks @ Shadow Lounge

Holy effin' ish!!!!

Ok - so maybe I'm a weeeeeeeeeeeee bit biased, because breakbeats OWN that 
azz, but last night was MUCH fun. I got to meet a few folks (Brandon & the 
Greg J - that's his name right? LOL), and I gots ta hear some tasty broken 
beats. There was a pretty decent sized crowd considering it was a Thursday 
and the 1st night of the party too, which was really surprising. The sound 
was pretty decent as well. A little loud to start with, but when the people 
flowed in it evened out nicely.

This party has promise people! I suggest if you like breaks, and you like 
partying in the city on a Thursday night, that you get yer arse down there 
next time around!!! They have some good local talent spinning there, and 
it's FREE for god's sake!!! The drinks aren't even horribly priced, and I 
dunno if it was just me - but they seemed to be on the stiff side, which you 
cannot argue with. For around $5 I got a RedBull  & vodka that was mainly 
vodka.

I'm stoked to go back personally, and if any of you miscreants wanna come 
with me next time, say the word!!!

Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!!!!

Marc(O)

Subject: RE: [sfraves] RR: Thursday Breaks @ Shadow Lounge

word, marco.

for our first night, i was pleasantly surprised with the turnout!  i guess 
some people do like breaks (other than me and marco).  anyhow, to recap the 
night...M.O.D., Aaron Jae and I did some swapping behind the decks for most 
of the eve with the crowd peaking at about midnight.  for a party with no 
flyers and only word getting out on the street this week...really can't 
imagine asking for a better night.  i'd say we had about 40-50 people come 
through there, which was delightful.

lots of friends showed up.  djs Doubleday and Greg J showed up (both of whom 
will be playing later this month), Tim/Antitim and Eva, Mr. Marco popped in 
with a CD of his (thanks!).  heck, even Mike Migurski was there!  when was 
the last time you saw that guy out past 8pm?

next week, our very special guest on the decks is none other than the Donna 
Matrix.  you know her, you love her.  and the vinyl goodies in her bag will 
spank you harder than your daddies backhand.

look for more BSPs from me next week.  special thanks go out to M.O.D. and 
Aaron Jae for rockin' tha jams, Pam for putting it down proper, Adam and the 
Shadow Lounge for providing the space, and all y'all who came out to have a 
good time!  see you next thursday.

>was pretty decent as well. A little loud to start with, but when the people 
>flowed in it evened out nicely.
>
>This party has promise people! I suggest if you like breaks, and you like 
>partying in the city on a Thursday night, that you get yer arse down there 
>next time around!!! They have some good local talent spinning there, and 
>it's FREE for god's sake!!! The drinks aren't even horribly priced, and I 
>dunno if it was just me - but they seemed to be on the stiff side, which 
>you cannot argue with. For around $5 I got a RedBull  & vodka that was 
>mainly vodka.
>
>I'm stoked to go back personally, and if any of you miscreants wanna come 
>with me next time, say the word!!!
>
>Two very enthusiastic thumbs up!!!!
>
>Marc(O)

Karina <karina@hyperreal.org> wrote:
Here's a really good article on the history of MDMA:
http://www.a1b2c3.com/drugs/x_01.htm

It notes that the psychiatric/psychotherapeutic use of MDMA started
in the mid 1970's. Interesting point to note that the US commissioned
research in the 1950's in pursuit of a truth serum for the Army's
chemical warefare...later proving not suitable for that purpose.



Highlights:

"...A MAPS History of MDMA

MDMA was first synthesized in 1912. It was patented in Germany by the
Merck Company in 1914. At that time it was not the subject of human
research.

Merck stumbled across MDMA when they tried to synthesize Hydrastinin, a
vasoconstrictive and styptic medicine.

MDMA was an unplanned by-product of this synthesis. As usual, the process
of its synthesis was patented.

It can not be reconstructed to what extent Merck tested MDMA and what the
results of such testing were, but it can be excluded with certainty that
MDMA was ever considered as an appetite suppressant.

In the 1950s it was briefly researched by the U.S. Government as part of
the CIA's and the Army's chemical warfare investigations, a commissioned
research in 1953/54 on MDA, MDMA and other substances as a truth serum.
They proved to be unsuitable for this purpose.

The results of this research were not published until 1973. The first
reported recreational use was in the 1960s.

In the middle 1970s, it was rediscovered by the psychedelic therapy
community and began to be used as an adjunct to psychotherapy by
psychiatrists and therapists who were familiar with the field of
psychedelic psychotherapy. MAPS published a book, The Secret Chief, about
the leader of this therapy community.

The above info came from MAPS, for more, on The Struggle to Conduct
Research into the Therapeutic Use of MDMA, go to the MAPS Website.

More History of MDMA

In the early 1980s, the drug began to be used non-medically, particularly
in Texas, under the name Ecstasy.

Both the non-medical and therapeutic use of MDMA were made illegal in 1985
despite the Drug Enforcement Administration Administrative Law Judge
Francis Young's recommendation that physicians be permitted to continue to
administer it to their patients.

Soon afterwards its use rapidly spread outside the United States as well.
In Dallas, where alcohol was prohibited at the Southern Methodist
University, students bought legal MDMA as a substitute, paying by credit
card.

The US consumption rose from 10,000 doses in the whole year of 1976 to
30,000 doses a month in 1985. At the same time the Drug Enforcement
Administration (DEA) reported that 30,000 doses a month were being used in
the state of Texas alone.

A 1987 survey revealed that 40% of students on the campus of Stanford
University had used MDMA. In 1985 MDMA was prohibited by the Drug
Enforcement Administration, when it was given the same status as heroin
and LSD..."

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

On Thu, 1 Apr 2004, Heidi wrote:

> Date: Thu, 1 Apr 2004 23:54:13 -0800 (PST)
> From: Heidi 
> To: LittleEtoile@aol.com
> Cc: sfr 
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] Surprised? Just a bit!...ecstacy story
>
> Truth be told, ecstacy, pure MDMA, was created as an anti-depressant. It makes you feel good, therefore the government must do what they can to convince us not to use it. They wouldn't want us taking away from their "legal" anti-depressants in the big money making pharmaceutical industry. It's funny how they never mention the side effects of Paxil when they are about 1000 times worse than anything ecstacy, pure MDMA, can do to people. Such as:
>
> "Frequent - Paxil - Seroxat (Paroxetine) Side Effects
>
> Body as a Whole: Malaise (a vague feeling of bodily discomfort), pain. Cardiovascular: Hypertension, syncope (a sudden loss of strength, a temporary suspension of consciousness due to cerebral anemia), tachycardia (excessive rapidity in the action of the heart). Dermatological: Pruritus (Intense itching) Gastrointestinal: Nausea and vomiting. Metabolic and Nutritional: Weight gain, weight loss. Nervous System: Central Nervous System stimulation, concentration impaired, depression, emotional lability (emotional instability), vertigo (a hallucination of movement; a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient or as if he himself were revolving in space). Respiratory: Cough increased, rhinitis (inflammation of the mucus membrane of the nose). "
>
> Taken from http://www.prozactruth.com/paxil.htm.
>
> "Legal" anti-depressants have MUCH worse side effects and severe withdrawal symptoms. Paxil is even warned of driving some users to suicide due to their absolute dependence on this "legal" drug that is regularly pushed by your trusted family doctors.
>
> Does anyone see anything wrong with this picture? Our government doesn't want the street drug competition and that is why their efforts regarding the "War on Drugs" rages on. If you ever pay attention to the side effects of the most commonly prescribed FDA approved drugs, you will clearly see the governments concern for our helath is NOT their number one priority. The bottom line, as always, is big business, big $$.
>
> Check out this article posted today on Yahoo news regarding a drug bust and "the dangers of ecstacy". http://news.yahoo.com/news?tmpl=story&u=/ap/20040331/ap_on_re_us/us_canada_ecstasy
>
> How many times can they tell the same lies when no one is believing them anymore? Seems to carry over into many aspects...
>
>
> LittleEtoile@aol.com wrote:
>
> WOW. WOW. WOW.
>
> Did anyone just watch the ABC report on ecstasy? I think that is the most
> positive news broadcast I have *ever* seen. I think they touched on *alot* of
> what all of us have said at one time or another. I can't even remember the last
> time I took E and I am not actively taking *any* drugs nowadays, but I'm still
> very happy about that report, particularly about the finger pointing at the
> government. Given the climate of today with all the government foot soldiers in
> the media, I am pretty amazed at what this report touched on, especially
> pointing out that the faulty reports like the ones they published only undermines
> our trust in them and to what degree we'll listen to them in the future... boy
> who cried wolf syndrome, so to speak.
>
> Way to go. Who ever though ABC, a Christian run broadcasting company, would
> produce and air this? I am so relieved, in fact, that I just signed back on to
> SFR after being absent for forever to discuss this. : )
>
> Also, does anyone else find that there's nothing like a news broadcast about
> how bad ecstasy and raves are that makes you want to go out and take a pill

Subject: [sfraves] Live Music Under Attack - Fight for Your Rights (fwd)

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Subject: Live Music Under Attack - Fight for Your Rights


Live Music Under Attack - Fight for Your Rights

Members of Congress think the American people won't stand up for their
rights.  On April 24th we're going to prove them wrong.

Narrow-minded policymakers are working to shut down radio shows, TV
shows, concerts, and other events they don't like. In the last couple of
weeks, the federal government has fined Clear Channel and Infinity
Broadcasting over a million dollars for daring to air radio shows
considered offensive by bureaucrats.  The U.S. House of Representatives
just passed a bill making television stations pay massive fines if they
air television shows Members of Congress find "indecent".  The Justice
Department is using the RAVE Act to scare nightclubs away from playing
certain kinds of music. The entire entertainment industry is under
attack.

Now, Congress is considering legislation that would hold bands, DJs,
bartenders, promoters, venue owners, radio stations and others liable if
a patron uses drugs at a nightclub or concert. If enacted, music lovers
could soon be unable to see their favorite band, DJ or other
entertainment live. The economic impact on the music industry could be
devastating.  (For more detailed information on this legislation see the
link at the bottom of this alert.)

Following the lead of local groups around the country, the Drug Policy
Alliance is making April 24th a Day and Night of Outrage to protest
these proposed laws, raise awareness among voters, and raise money to
stop them. Already, music lovers in Billings (Montana), Denver, Los
Angeles, New York, Santa Fe and Washington DC are planning events.
Without the help of people like you, this legislation could become law.

What you can do

1) Organize a protest. Go to our sign-up form
(http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25494) if you're
willing to take on the responsibility of organizing something in your
area.

2) If you're a musician, consider donating some or all of your income
from that night. You can also convince the venue you're playing at to
donate money. As D:FUSE says, "Artists have a responsibility to raise
money for this campaign to protect live music. Not only can this
legislation shut down the venues we play at, it could even land artists
in jail."  Let us know what you can do to help.

3) If you're a promoter, get musicians and venue owners to donate some
of their proceeds from that night. Promoters in Los Angeles, New York,
and Washington, DC are already getting DJs to play for free that night,
in exchange for the venue giving money to the campaign.  Let us know
about your event.

4) If you're a club owner consider donating a percentage of your
proceeds from that night
(http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25494).
An easy way to help out is to simply add $2 to that night's cover
charge, and donate that money to stop federal legislation that could be
used to shut down your business.

5) Fax your U.S. Representative and tell him or her to oppose this
legislation
(http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25495).

6) Distribute flyers
(http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25496) and
petitions (http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25497)
at music shows, record stores, and festivals.

7) Donate money now
(http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/ctt.asp?u=37373&l=25500)
to help make April 24th a success.

8) Forward this e-mail to musicians, promoters, venue owners, and music
lovers. Encourage them to take action.




http://www.jcthedj.com

-- 
As a wise old buddha said:
"Before enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water.
After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

On Fri, 2 Apr 2004 LittleEtoile@aol.com wrote:
-&e->I was thinking the same exact thing re: SSRI's etc. during the show
-&e->as well.  I mean hell, we don't really know the long term side
-&e->effects of those drugs either! And I was just talking to a woman the
-&e->other day about when she went of prozac after being on it for a few
-&e->years and how severe the withdraws were. She said she had never been
-&e->so miserable in her life and that she had every possible horrible
-&e->side effect all at once for three months. Yes, of course, everyone
-&e->reacts differently... not everyone has those side effects, nor does
-&e->everyone feel depressed the day after taking E.... but I've heard of
-&e->far more people having unbearable side effects from legal
-&e->antidepressants and anxiety medications, and more importantly having
-&e->their day to day *life* dramatically impacted by it, then I do with
-&e->ecstasy users. I don't think there has been anyone who was driven to
-&e->kill while they were on ecstasy, yet there are many controversial
-&e->murder/suicide cases involving people that were recently places on
-&e->antidepressants/anxiety medications prior to the deaths.

Actually, the FDA is currently pushing for far stronger language regarding
the frivolous dosing of people with anti depressants without a complete
psychological profile and counseling through the first couple months.
I've known people who were given a quick handout for mild depression and
ended up in a total tailspin far more severe than their original issue
from the mood changes caused by the stuff.

andyw

if you're in the east bay and considering driving to SF by way of the 
Bay Bridge - DON'T.  take BART...

-philip-


Posted: April 2, 2004 at 3:51 p.m.

SAN FRANCISCO (BCN) -- Officials are continuing their negotiations with 
a man who has been standing on a railing on the westbound side of the 
Bay Bridge near Treasure Island since about 11 a.m. today, according to 
California Highway Patrol Officer Virgil Aguilar.

  Westbound traffic is backed up to Highway 880 and Highway 92 and is 
getting worse by the minute as people aim to avoid the Bay Bridge 
snarl, Aguilar said.

  "It's Friday, people want to go home, and they've been working all 
week. This is causing major delays, especially because there is a 
Giants game tonight at SBC Park," Aguilar said.

  Drivers on the Golden Gate and San Mateo bridges are facing backups 
too.

  At one point, the man appeared to be smoking a cigarette, according to 
Aguilar. Earlier today, Aguilar said he was bleeding at the mouth.

  Also assisting the situation is the U.S. Coast Guard, which has sent 
two boats to the Bay Bridge for "any type of rescue and assistance 
should the man decide not to go back over the rail onto the auto deck," 
Coast Guard Petty Office Gabriel Flesher said.
--Apple-Mail-8--434871751--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Surprised? Just a bit!...ecstacy story

lol.. at the career titles!!

I am curiuos how many people have notable short-term memory loss after doing 
extensive amounts of E.  I know I did, after about 1 year of regular 
(meaning excessive) use of pure molly.  But, I also was able to notice a 
significant recovery of my short term memory after about 6 months to a year 
of abstinance.  I think that is pretty good for it being such a potent 
chemical.  It took me longer to recover my learning disabilities incurred 
from smoking pot, not to mention the psychological addiction if mary-jane 
that I never got from E.

Amazing.. anyone have similliar experience that has stopped taking it after 
prolonged use?


SFR: Ranger

> with a man who has been standing on a railing on the westbound side of 
> the Bay Bridge near Treasure Island since about 11 a.m. today, 
> according to California Highway Patrol Officer Virgil Aguilar.
>
>  Westbound traffic is backed up to Highway 880 and Highway 92 and is 
> getting worse by the minute as people aim to avoid the Bay Bridge 
> snarl, Aguilar said.
>
>  "It's Friday, people want to go home, and they've been working all 
> week. This is causing major delays, especially because there is a 
> Giants game tonight at SBC Park," Aguilar said.
>
>  Drivers on the Golden Gate and San Mateo bridges are facing backups 
> too.
>
>  At one point, the man appeared to be smoking a cigarette, according 
> to Aguilar. Earlier today, Aguilar said he was bleeding at the mouth.
>
>  Also assisting the situation is the U.S. Coast Guard, which has sent 
> two boats to the Bay Bridge for "any type of rescue and assistance 
> should the man decide not to go back over the rail onto the auto 
> deck," Coast Guard Petty Office Gabriel Flesher said.

Friday, April 16, 2004 ** Progression w/ guest JEFFREY ALLEN **

pro=B7gres=B7sion n.
The process of progressing; progress.
Movement from one member of a continuous series to the next.
A continuous series; a sequence.

Mad LOVE to all those who made our Sunday's a success. As intended we have =
secured a new night, at the same location. Our new monthly event will fall =
on the 3rd Friday's of each month. Our Next Event is April 16th, starting @=
 6:00 pm

Same great resident's, all new guest dj's, and that consistent progressive =
napalm that you've come to enjoy, being dropped without hesitation. We are =
putting out a call for the masses to join our party, a temporal community w=
here an attitude of acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the=
 next chapter in our underground movement, with its roots founded on electr=
onic music and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Friday, April 16, 2004 ** Elektrosorcery presents Aries **

Aries subjects are courageous leaders with a genuine concern for those they=
 command, being responsible people, it is rare that they will use their sub=
ordinates to obtain their own objectives as leaders, but occasionally it do=
es happen. They do not make very good followers because they are too "take =
charge". They may be unwilling to obey or submit to directions for which th=
ey can see no reason, or with which they disagree. They are much concerned =
with self, both positively and negatively - self-reliant but also self cent=
ered (sometimes) and concerned with their own personal advancement and phys=
ical satisfaction. Their immense energy makes them aggressive and restless,=
 argumentative occasionally, headstrong, quick tempered, easily offended an=
d capable of holding grudges if they feel themselves affronted.

With Aries DJs: Kid Wicked, SemaJ, Element, Goober, & Jesse Gonzalez.

A Super Special Seekr Space with: Aaron Jae, Allen, David Bu Hau, Cyrus, Sc=
ottO, & Dr. Kipper.

And an Elektrosorcery Summoning Chamber with: Majere, James Dub, The Doctor=
, Nick Nyquil, Pandacon, & Leon Cook.

Friday, April 23, 2004 ** SOMA Sessions: D&B w/DJ FLIGHT + ROHAN **

SOMA Sessions
Drum & Bass Fourth Fridays @ AsiaSF

Friday April 23, 2004

DJ FLIGHT (BBC 1Xtra, Metalheadz - UK)

Nathalie Wright aka DJ Flight's accomplishments speak for themselves; a res=
ident at the legendary Metalheadz Sunday Sessions and at Fabio's Swerve nig=
ht in London, host of her own radio show, "Next Chapter" on BBC's 1Xtra and=
, most recently, a co-producer with Breakage as "Alias" for 31 Records. All=
 this plus a heavy DJ touring schedule showcasing the latest cuts from all =
flavors of upfront D&B adds up to a knockout Bay Area debut.

ROHAN (Bassbin Recordings - Dublin)

At the heart of Ireland's Drum 'n Bass scene lies Bassbin Recordings in Dub=
lin. Co-founded by Rohan and Naphta in 1996, the organization has grown to =
include sublabels, Breakin, Solas and Looney Toonz and is home to such tale=
nts as Beta 2, Zero Tolerance, Equinox and Breakage. SOMA Sessions welcomes=
 the return of the Bassbin don for another rolling set of dubbed-out floor =
smashers.

DJ M

Friday, May 7, 2004 ** Melon : Josh Wink **

Red Melon is proud to finally be able to showcase one of the biggest succes=
s stories in the underground house movement. Ask yourself how many globally=
 respected, underground artist-producer-DJs have turned-down offers to tour=
 with U2, and you will likely draw a short list. Josh Wink is such an artis=
t -- one who is unassuming, yet enjoys a cult following and who places arti=
stic integrity above all else. Owner of Ovum Recordings and remixer of mega=
-talents such as Sting, Depeche Mode and Ladytron, Josh has made only rare =
appearences in San Francisco, so don't miss out.

Supporting Josh will be Dano, Dj and tech house producer from San Francisco=
=2E  After a long winter touring Australia, New Zealand, and Eastern Europe=
, Dano is back in town working in the studio for a few months.  Dano has th=
ree new releases coming out simultaneously on Silicone Soul's Darkroom Dubs=
 imprint, Honchos Music, and Red Melon.  He will be spinning fresh techy gr=
ooves along with red melon biz partner JZ.  No stranger to the Melon experi=
ence, JZ is responsible for some of the most memorable sets in the seven ye=
ars of parties Red Melon has produced.  It will be just like old times!

If you are serious about your Red Melon parties, this Melon is not to be mi=
ssed! Get there before 11:00pm to take advantage of an earlybird cover char=
ge of $10 at San Francisco's newest venue, Mighty, located at 119 Utah St a=
t 15th Street. Mighty is a beautiful renovated warehouse with a touch of te=
chnology and art and the massive sound system that made Club Townsend a San=
 Francisco favorite. All of that plus cheap drinks too! You can't go wrong.=
 Trust us.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] bay bridge troubles

well, maybe he's mentally ill, but in that case he ought to be in a 
hospital, not on the bay bridge ...

but whatever his situation is, or whatever kind of person he is, what 
business does he have backing up a major traffic artery like that?

my point is, i don't think he really wanted to jump in the first place, 
otherwise he would have jumped right away, like that guy who jumped in 
front of a caltrain a few years ago.  this is just a copycat looking 
for attention, and if you want to show him compassion, i'm fine with 
that, but i really don't think that's doing anything to help his 
situation.  what needs to happen is the judge needs to throw the book 
at him.  that way he understands if he's feeling bad to turn to a 
friend or a community center or a suicide hotline.

this is going to happen again in the next year ... mark my words ... 
and you'll never hear about this guy again.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Free, Tonight, Punch and Slip!

for those who are too lazy to look at the prettier version:


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(4/3/2004) Punch and Slip: A Jungle Juice House Party
Featuring The Doctor (dnb) and The Flank (rock) from Santa Cruz, CA

***UPDATE***
Sound has been graciously provided by DJ Resistance. We will now be rockin' 
the neighborhood with some serious bump. DJ's who want to get a time slot 
instead of duke it out should IM or email me soon.


The Deal:
Free House party at my house for anyone who doesn't break shit and can 
respect a house. It's BYOB so come fully stocked (and bring extra for me  ). 
As long as everything goes according to plan there will be open decks for 
those who want to play (see below). We are having a band from Santa Cruz 
come and play as well.

The Catch:
* there is no catch... YAY!

Other Stuff:
We are having a band come through and play. They are The Flank from Santa 
Cruz. That's right people, a band, you know... with real instruments! They 
will probably play from 12-1 or 1-2, so come early and get your swerve on. 
Other than that, open decks but I'm going to reserve slots for people who 
get in touch with me so that we don't have the same issue we had last time. 
Respectful promoters are welcome to come through, but if you flyer any of 
the cars in the neighborhood I am going to put your face on a milk carton. 
Again, promoters are welcome but you cannot flyer outside of the house, 
period. Remember, cig butts go in the trash, not my front yard or the 
street. Thanks.

Timeslots:

9-10: warm up and sound check (get'n crunk time)
10-11: still open if anyone wants to get on it
11-12: Marc (O) (Washington DC) and DeeJayB - Tag team break set.
12-1 DJ Resistance (house with some quick hands)
1-2 The Flank (a kick ass rock band from Santa Cruz)
2-3:30 The Doctor and DJ Arize (Tag team Jungle from two good friends and 
two great drinkers)
3:30-4:30 Joey Frisco (hard house, hard style, hard dance, who the fuck 
knows?)
after 4:30 open decks until everyone passes out or bitches out.

I guess that's is... If I work out some sort of time schedule for 
everything, I'll post it.

W3RD ^,
-Joey

PS, If you wanna get your swerve on and you need to crash here, it's cool; 
just bring some blankets or whatever and find a corner to crawl into  .

PPS, Bring stuff for jungle juice

PPPS, Don't fall asleep/passout with your shoes on or you will lose, period.

DEF is putting on a techno and electro party at Cellspace this Saturday,
April 10th.  We've got a great lineup, plus free food and refreshments,
comfy couches, cyborg-oriented visuals, awesome blacklight banners and
graffiti art, and crisp DEF Audio sound.  Should be a good time.

Love, Chel-C Faith of DEF
www.defsf.com

Here's the BSP:::
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
>From the crew who brought you FUTURE PERFECT and PARADIGM SHIFT,

Saturday, April 10th, 2004

DEF, in association with Techno Truth and Cymbalic, return to bring
you....

>:::::::::::||=||=||=||=||((RoBoT feelings))||=||=||=||=||:::::::::::::::<
a trueschool community reunion of art, techno and electro under one roof

Featuring\\:
*)Top techno DJ talent from the bay area, central, & southwest coast
*)Def graff-art + electro styles from the finest DJs and artists, nu-skool
tooldskool.
*)Free water, chai, coffee, fruit, and refreshments
*)Delectable vegan chow catered & served by Chel-C Faith and Tessa Coils
*)Secure, comfortable, all ages SF location
*)Precision digitally processed audio by DEF Audio
*)Visual stimulus and blacklight art environments by Parallaxia
*)$12 at the door, 7pm-2am
*)Limited capacity, please come early!

[[[West coast techno heroes and electro stars playing 2x4 versus sets]]]

Drumcell (Droid Behavior, LA)  vs. John Massey (Droid Behavior, LA)
Sheztek (Moksha Tribe, SF) vs. Shank (Epiphany, Code, SF)
Chris Jackson (Resource Records, SF) vs. The Rhythmist (DoBox Recordings,
SF)
Ethan (Friends & Family, SF)
Kid Kola (DEF, SF) vs. Disconnect (DEF, SF)
Mykul (Cymbalic, SF) vs. Dirt (Techno Truth, Cymbalic, SF)
GAMMA (Techno Truth, Sac) vs. Mek (Techno Truth, Sac)

(Unfortunately, Forest Green will not be able to appear at Robot Feelings,
as she is leaving a few days earlier than originally planned for her
European tour.  We send our apologies to all the dancers, and of course we
wish Forest the best of luck on her tour.)

Graffiti work exhibited by Skert, Repo, Cola, & Deuce w/ more TBA

B-boys & B-girls welcome. Downrock at your own risk.

Robot Feelings will be located at Cellspace in San Francisco.  Cellspace
is a drug and alcohol free community arts venue. Respect the space and
surrounding neighborhood. Do not flyer cars surrounding the space. No
markers, paint/tips, scribers, etc. allowed inside the venue.  No ins and
outs are allowed after 10pm.  A smoking area will be provided. Please
respect the rules of the venue so that others may congregate there in the
future.

DEF communication hubs:
415.289.6886.
www.defsf.com
def@defsf.com

Online Flyer @
http://www.monkeyview.net/id/724/defevents/robotfeelings/index.vhtml

:::respect the past, celebrate the present, create the future:::



-- 
+++++DEFSF.COM+++++
a west coast techno alliance

well, hey, let's *also* be realistic -- i *can* go overboard and be a 
real jackass and have no compassion when maybe sometimes i *ought* to.  
but i *am* tired of hearing about these things happening over, and 
over, and over.  doesn't it piss (some of) you off?  it makes *my* 
blood boil!   you don't hear about this stuff happening in other 
cities.

things.  anyone?

btw, i was rolling (on the floor laughing, not rolling on ecstacy) when 
i read that 'suicide lane' idea.  did you know that someone actually 
did that on the bay bridge a couple years ago?  on the upper level, 
coming out of treasure island, in the left lane, if you look, there is 
something sort of like a ramp that someone used to successfully launch 
their car over the side into the water.  i think they have since tried 
to block that off, but anyway, your analogy of creating an entire lane 
for activities like that may not be too far off the mark!


-d

(4/3/2004) Punch and Slip:A Jungle Juice House Party
Featuring The Flank from Santa Cruz, CA

***UPDATE***
Sound has been graciously provided by DJ Resistance. We will now be rockin' 
the neighborhood with some serious bump. DJ's who want to get a time slot 
instead of duke it out should IM or email me soon.


The Deal:
Free House party at my house for anyone who doesn't break shit and can 
respect a house. It's BYOB so come fully stocked (and bring extra for me  ). 
As long as everything goes according to plan there will be open decks for 
those who want to play (see below). We are having a band from Santa Cruz 
come and play as well.

The Catch:
* there is no catch... YAY!

Other Stuff:
We are having a band come through and play. They are The Flank from Santa 
Cruz. That's right people, a band, you know... with real instruments! They 
will probably play from 12-1 or 1-2, so come early and get your swerve on. 
Other than that, open decks but I'm going to reserve slots for people who 
get in touch with me so that we don't have the same issue we had last time. 
Respectful promoters are welcome to come through, but if you flyer any of 
the cars in the neighborhood I am going to put your face on a milk carton. 
Again, promoters are welcome but you cannot flyer outside of the house, 
period. Remember, cig butts go in the trash, not my front yard or the 
street. Thanks.

Timeslots:

9-10: warm up and sound check (get'n crunk time)
10-11: Hip Hop Happy Hour w/ John da Bomb (Humboldt)
11-12: Marc (O) (Washington DC) and DeeJayB - Tag team break set.
12-1 DJ Resistance (house with some quick hands)
1-2 The Flank (a kick ass rock band from Santa Cruz)
2-3:30 The Axis (The Doctor w/ DJ Arize aka Stalin w/ Musolini)
3:30-4:30 Joey Frisco (hard house, hard style, hard dance, who the fuck 
knows?)
4:30-5:30 DJ DelRo (house and/or NRG)
5:30-? you?

Directions:

>From the East: Take the Bay Bridge to 101, take 280 south towards daly city, 
keep going until you pass Ocean/Geneva exit, the next exit is Mission. Take 
Mission exit and take your first right around a chevron onto Sagamore, go 
two blocks and turn right on Capitol, go to blocks and turn left on Broad. 
Find parking.

>From The South: take 280 north and exit towards 19th avenue/ Golden Gate 
bridge, Take a right on 19th avenue (you need to be in the far right lane 
and you'll see a little ghetto gas station), follow the train tracks up 19th 
avenue and it will start to snake around, keep following the tracks until 
you get to Broad st. Find Parking.

>From the North: follow highway 1 down to 19th avenue, follow 19th avenue 
until you pass SFSU, get in the far left lane and continue straight accross 
the intersection where the three right lanes turn into 280 south (just 
follow the train tracks), follow the tracks until you get to Broad st, find 
parking.

The address is 243 Broad St, SF, CA 94112. Mapquest that shit if you can't 
figure it out. Peace.

I guess that's is... If I work out some sort of time schedule for 
everything, I'll post it.

W3RD ^,
-Joey

PS, If you wanna get your swerve on and you need to crash here, it's cool; 
just bring some blankets or whatever and find a corner to crawl into  .

PPS, Bring stuff for jungle juice

PPPS, Don't fall asleep/passout with your shoes on or you will lose, period.

Subject: [sfraves] Status of Wicked

--=====================_36803080==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

 From Jeno of the Wicked collective:


"O.K.so as to avoid any speculation, and/or misunderstanding here are the 
facts....

There are no plans to throw a Wicked event again in San Francisco. Not now, 
not ever. There are no plans to do anything relating to Wicked in San 
Francisco, not now, not ever. Hence no more Wicked messageboard.

There will be a Wicked in L.A. on April 17th. This was booked and confirmed 
before the above scenario was discussed, so we decided to go ahead with it.

Markie is continuing to Dj, and is featured as a monthly resident out at 
the Oasis in Oakland once a month on a Sundays for Smartbeat.

Garth and myself are not hanging up our headphones either and will be 
residents at a new party called "The Cosmic Coconut" . It will happen every 
3rd Sunday of the month, at Bambuddha Lounge, from 4pm 'til at least 
midnight, and will begin in May. There will be food, and (depending on the 
weather) the party will be both indoor and out. Musically we will be 
broadening our selection to include just about anything we feel in the mood 
for, especially earlier in the evening. Don't expect anything less than a 
night of pure joyous expression and wickedly experimental moments from the 
pair of us... : )

They are the facts... o.k?

Beyond that I will only say that it's possible though not planned, that we 
will continue to perform as "Wicked" if we are booked together by an 
outside promoter, if it is uncomplicated to do, and seems appropriate. 
Let's just say for now that this is my disclaimer.

Of course none of this may apply if we collectively change our minds. I 
mean, who can predict the future, after all? No doubt it would only take a 
small change to create a big result, but that is not something I can 
conjure up, so I will stick with the facts."




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

The dangerous patriot: "The one who drifts into chauvinism and exhibits 
blind enthusiasm for military actions. He is a defender of militarism and 
its ideals of war and glory. Chauvinism is a proud and bellicose form of 
patriotism . . . which identifies numerous enemies who can only be dealt 
with through military power and which equates the national honor with 
military victory..."
-Marine Corps, Colonel James A. Donovan

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Quick survey for school project...

--part1_14.260b94ee.2da11f80_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hey,
  Here is a quick survey/questionairre I am conducting to gather research for 
my school project.  My project is to design a resource web site for people 
who have a interest in becoming a DJ.  This web site will provide info and tips 
on topics such as equipment needs, setup, places to buy equipment, etc.     

This survey is intended for those who have NO DJing experience, but have an 
interest in learning about DJing and/or becoming a DJ.
IF you are a experienced DJ (1 + years experience), and would like to take 
the survey, please do so.  
BUT when taking the survey, please imagine yourself back BEFORE you were a DJ 
trying to learn the ropes.

Here goes:

1) Do you know anyone who is a DJ?
a) Yes
b) No

2) If you wanted to learn how to DJ, which topics would be helpful to you in 
gaining more information about DJing?
Please check all that apply
a) Basic DJ equipment needs
b) Equipment setup
c) Places to purchase DJ equipment (online stores, national chain stores)
d) Price comparisons for equipment
e) Places to buy records (both online and local)
f) Intrstrucitonal help (tips,exercises on mixing etc.)
g) Reviews on equipment, videos
h) Places for CD/mixtape duplication (to make promo mixtapes/CDs etc)
i) Other (Please list any topics you wish could be covered if not listed 
above)

Please send answers back to my e-mail address.  
Thank you for your time.



--part1_14.260b94ee.2da11f80_boundary--

THE TROUBLE WITH MARIJUANA AND LEGISLATORS
Bruce Mirken, AlterNet

Lawmakers think that supporting medical marijuana is a
radical move that will get them in trouble. It's not, and
it won't.

*In DrugReporter: http://www.alternet.org/drugreporter/


"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <BAY8-F94I9IJsaJbqJG0000017e@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 05 Apr 2004 17:46:29.0655 (UTC) FILETIME=[ECFEBA70:01C41B35]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: movie review "Eternal Sunshine..."

Am I the only one who has seen this flick yet???

I was HIGHLY impressed. The story itself isn't anything groundbreaking 
really, but the format of the movie, the cinematography, and the effects are 
astounding. It was like being in someone else's dream.

I have seen "dream sequences" and movies that were supposed to show what a 
dream is like - but never have I seen one that really captures the feel of 
one like Eternal Sunshine does.

I dunno - maybe it's just me. I loved it though.

I would expound, but it's really a "you have to see it for yourself" type of 
movie.

Anyone else see it? Thoughts? Opinions?

M-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: movie review "Eternal Sunshine..."

I saw it and also thoroughly enjoyed it, as I have all Charlie
Kaufman-penned films (I haven't seen Human Nature yet, though).  Beyond
its trippiness, I felt it was also a good love story; my girlfriend was
crying at the end, and even my heart of stone had melted a bit.  =P

C.

> Am I the only one who has seen this flick yet???
>
> I was HIGHLY impressed. The story itself isn't anything groundbreaking
> really, but the format of the movie, the cinematography, and the effects
> are
> astounding. It was like being in someone else's dream.
>
> I have seen "dream sequences" and movies that were supposed to show what a
> dream is like - but never have I seen one that really captures the feel of
> one like Eternal Sunshine does.
>
> I dunno - maybe it's just me. I loved it though.
>
> I would expound, but it's really a "you have to see it for yourself" type
> of
> movie.
>
> Anyone else see it? Thoughts? Opinions?
>

anti-legalization stories they don't risk losing the money from the
anti-drug ads sponsored by the gov't.

plenty of ads and plenty of news stories.

Subject: [sfraves] Fri 4/23: DJ FLIGHT (BBC 1Xtra, Metalheadz) at SOMA Sessions

SOMA Sessions
Drum 'n Bass Fourth Fridays
AsiaSF, San Francisco
http://www.somasessions.com


Friday April 23, 2004

DJ FLIGHT (BBC 1Xtra, Metalheadz - UK)
Nathalie Wright aka DJ Flight's accomplishments speak
for themselves; a resident at the legendary Metalheadz
Sunday Sessions and at Fabio's Swerve night in London,
host of her own radio show, "Next Chapter" on BBC's
1Xtra and, most recently, a co-producer with Breakage
as "Alias" for 31 Records. All this plus a heavy DJ
touring schedule showcasing the latest cuts from all
flavors of upfront D&B adds up to a knockout Bay Area
debut.

ROHAN (Bassbin Recordings - Ireland)
At the heart of Ireland's Drum 'n Bass scene lies
Bassbin Recordings in Dublin. Co-founded by Rohan and
Naphta in 1996, the organization has grown to include
sublabels, Breakin, Solas and Looney Toonz and is home
to such talents as Beta 2, Zero Tolerance, Equinox and
Breakage. SOMA Sessions welcomes the return of the
Bassbin don for another rolling set of dubbed-out
floor smashers.

Resident Support:
SOUND:BOY (SOMA Sessions, Hemisphere, Brass Tax)
DJ M (SOMA Sessions, Faultline, Freebeats)

** Discount $8 presale tickets available now at
http://www.somasessions.com **

Tickets:  $8 presale
Hours:  10:30pm - 3am
Entry:  21+ with photo ID
Bar:  $3 drink specials all night

AsiaSF
201 Ninth Street at Howard St
San Francisco, California 94103
AsiaSF serves 3-Star Cal-Asian cuisine in a festive
and stylish atmosphere.  For Sunday through Thursday
dinner reservations, please call 415.255.ASIA(2742)
from 1pm to 8pm or visit http://www.asiasf.com.

SOMA branding & print design by Ryan @ Citizen-7
http://www.citizen-7.com/


NEXT MONTH - Friday May 28, 2004
- OLD SKOOL JUNGLE NIGHT -
