>From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
>To: O§by Jamz <osby@hellokitty.com>
>CC: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Any good SPAM (that canned meat thingie) 
>recepies?
>Date: Wed, 7 Apr 2004 14:57:05 -0700 (PDT)
>
>
>Here ya go Osby (most of you might not know this, but my favorite thing
>ever is cooking weird stuff with whatever is in the pantry/fridge):
>
>SpamFry (serves 2-3)
>--------------------
>1 can of spam
>1 brick of firm tofu
>8 green onions
>1 cup of rice
>2 tbsp of peanut oil
>sesame seeds
>crushed cashews
>some nori flakes (or just a quarter sheet of nori held over a burner till
>it changes color and ripped into little shreds)
>
>
>dry press tofu (best done with a brick).
>start yer rice.
>when rice has about 10-15 minutes left on it...
>cut up tofu into 1/4" thick pieces
>blot with a paper towel.
>cut spam into 1/4" thick pieces
>heat up oil in frying pan on medium high heat (make sure the pan is big
>enough to keep all ingredients flat in one layer)
>when the oil's hot... (if you're not sure throw a grain of rice in
>there... it should dance but not burn)
>fry up your tofu + spam
>cook till spam is starting to brown and tofu starts to skin (about 2-3
>minutes a side if you got the oil right)
>drain oil from above crap (best to just rest it on paper towel and turn
>once).
>with still hot pan, pour off the remaining oil and sear the green onions
>(crank up the heat and cook until you get some dark lines on the onions).
>
>serving:
>top with spam with nori, the tofu with crushed cashews and the green
>onions with sesame... served over rice in funky pattern (you can skip soy
>sauce for this one cause the spam is so salty as is... try a Tonkatsu
>sauce instead!).  goes perfect with a dry tasting beer (saporro, kirin)
>and a dessert of green tea ice cream and some dark chocolate shavings.
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------------------------
>To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
>For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>

I agree with Apollo and I was thinking similarly when I wrote the message.

I like the idea of "looking for character and talent first in others" &
"learning much from people who have "poor" language skills."

I had a delayed reaction to various comments about Warren after thinking
about him yesterday so I just expressed what I felt inside.

On a side note, the colorful language of Texas has a good example of poor
grammar:
"It won't take but a minute."
People actually say this every day in the South, along with the usual
greetings like y'all (you all), which I can't seem to avoid saying myself. I
guess it is true that you can't take the South out of the boy.

Greg

<<"The king's English, correct or current language of good
       speakers; pure English. --Shak."

Moi, I look for character and talent first in others.  I've learned much
from people who have "poor" language skills.  Right now, for example, I'm
communicating with some very talented DJs and producers from back in
seventies NYC before revising House Music 101.  Some of these guys have
real problems with writing.  We've had to move from emails to the
telephone.  If, for example, I got my tits in a ringer over Barry's all
caps emails, with horrid grammar and spelling, I would learn nothing new.>>

Ah, that should be tits in a "wringer:)"  Although tits in a ringer has
something to it.  You know, when I was a small boy my mother got her tits
in a wringer.  We had to call a doctor.  Remember it vividly.

Love,

Apollo

----

Because Robots have feelings too:

The DEF posse is throwing another tekno shindig
on Saturday the 10th... It's going to be rockin,
come check it out!


++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

>>From the crew who brought you FUTURE PERFECT and
PARADIGM SHIFT,

Saturday, April 10th, 2004

DEF, in association with Techno Truth and
Cymbalic, return to bring you....

>:::((RoBoT feelings)):::<
a trueschool community reunion of art, techno and
electro under one roof

Featuring\\:
*)Top techno DJ talent from the bay area,
central, & southwest coast
*)Def graff-art + electro styles from the finest
DJs and artists, nu-skool
tooldskool.
*)Free water, chai, coffee, fruit, and
refreshments
*)Delectable vegan chow catered & served by Chel-
C Faith and Tessa Coils
*)Secure, comfortable, all ages SF location
*)Precision digitally processed audio by DEF Audio
*)Visual stimulus and blacklight art environments
by Parallaxia
*)$12 at the door, 7pm-2am
*)Limited capacity, please come early!

[[[West coast techno heroes and electro stars
playing 2x4 versus sets]]]

Drumcell (Droid Behavior, LA)  vs. John Massey
(Droid Behavior, LA)
Sheztek (Moksha Tribe, SF) vs. Shank (Epiphany,
Code, SF)
Chris Jackson (Resource Records, SF) vs. The
Rhythmist (DoBox Recordings,
SF)
Ethan (Friends & Family, SF)
Kid Kola (DEF, SF) vs. Disconnect (DEF, SF)
Mykul (Cymbalic, SF) vs. Dirt (Techno Truth,
Cymbalic, SF)
GAMMA (Techno Truth, Sac) vs. Mek (Techno Truth,
Sac)

Graffiti work exhibited by Skert, Repo, Cola, &
Deuce w/ more TBA

B-boys & B-girls welcome. Downrock at your own
risk.

Robot Feelings will be located at Cellspace in San Francisco.  Cellspace
is a drug and alcohol free community arts venue. Respect the space and
surrounding neighborhood. Do not flyer cars surrounding the space. No
markers, paint/tips, scribers, etc. allowed inside the venue.  No ins and
outs are allowed after 10pm.  A smoking area will be provided. Please
respect the rules of the venue so that others may congregate there in the
future.

DEF communication hubs:
415.289.6886.
www.defsf.com
def@defsf.com

http://www.monkeyview.net/id/724/defevents/robotfe
elings/index.vhtml

create the future:::

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  Antoine de Saint-Exupery's Plane Found

--=====================_3506902==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Antoine de Saint-Exupery is one of my favorite authors.  Most people know 
"The Little Prince,"  but he also wrote some excellent books about the 
experience of flying.  His last flight was in a P-38 during WWII.  He and 
his aircraft, a recon model, disappeared in 1944.  The plane has been found.

Love,

Apollo


By Angela Doland
ASSOCIATED PRESS

1:08 p.m. April 7, 2004

PARIS – It was one of French aviation's enduring mysteries: Antoine de 
Saint-Exupery, the pilot and author of the beloved tale "The Little 
Prince," took off on a World War II spy mission for the Allies and was 
never seen again.

After 60 years, officials have confirmed that the twisted wreckage of a 
Lockheed Lightning P-38, found on the Mediterranean seabed not far from the 
rugged cliffs of Provence, belonged to Saint-Exupery, Air Force Capt. 
Frederic Solano said Wednesday.

In France, the discovery is akin to solving the mystery of where Amelia 
Earhart's plane went down in the Pacific Ocean in 1937.

"This was our holy grail," said Philippe Castellano, president of an 
association of aviation buffs who helped authorities identify the debris. 
"We never even imagined this."

It was a stunning revelation: Teams have been searching up and down the 
coast for decades, and many experts believed the plane was probably too far 
out to sea to be recovered.

Clues to the crash started coming together in 1998, when a bracelet bearing 
Saint-Exupery's name turned up in a fisherman's net near Marseille. Some 
reports said the find was a fake.

"For six years, people had their doubts," said the fisherman, Jean-Claude 
Bianco. "People claimed I made it myself."

But Bianco's discovery jogged the memory of a local scuba diver, who first 
saw the plane debris nestled in the ocean bed in the 1980s.

The diver, Luc Vanrell, pored over records of downed planes. By 2000, he 
was convinced he had found the right one. But it took time to get 
permission from France's Culture Ministry to have the pieces brought up for 
analysis.

The plane, smashed into hundreds of pieces, lies 100 to 300 feet below the 
surface, less than three miles from the coast between Marseille and Cassis. 
The key find was a tail piece bearing a tiny serial number, 2734 L – the 
same as Saint-Exupery's, Castellano said.

A piece of the puzzle remains unanswered: the cause of the crash. Theories 
have ranged from hostile gunfire to suicide. The debris has so far yielded 
no clues.

"It's impossible to say if he was shot down, if he lost consciousness, or 
if he had a mechanical accident," said Patrick Grandjean of the national 
Department of Subaquatic and Submarine Archaeological Research.

Famous for his bravery, Saint-Exupery was selected for the dangerous 
mission of collecting data on German troop movements in the Rhone River 
Valley. His plane vanished in the night on July 31, 1944, when he was 44.

He has become one of France's most admired figures, in part because of "The 
Little Prince," a tender fable about a prince from an asteroid who explores 
the planets and then falls to earth. Saint-Exupery's other works, which 
largely deal with his aviation experiences, include "Wind, Sand and Stars" 
and "Flight to Arras," about a doomed reconnaissance mission.

Until the euro currency was introduced in 2002, the novelist's image 
appeared on the nation's 50-franc note. In Lyon, Saint-Exupery's hometown, 
the international airport is named after him.

Castellano, president of the Aero-ReL.I.C. organization that helped 
identify the plane, said some Saint-Exupery fans resisted the efforts. They 
wanted to keep the mystery alive.

"In the end, I think everyone is satisfied," he said. "We didn't find a 
body, so the myth surrounding his disappearance will live on."




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_3506902==.ALT--

not only do i PWN a copy of the SPAM cookbook (you may begin
worshipping now without pause), i also PWN a stylish SPAM t-shirt.

oh yeah.  and, the icing on the SPAM is that i have never once
actually eaten SPAM.  i've thrown it at walls, helped a friend make a
sculpture, and once even gave a freshly empty can to a friend (as a
joke) to collect money from people while camping out to buy
lollapalooza 2 tickets.

my friend, being a little shy of "total hallucinogenic bliss", thought
my idea was a fine one, and 8 hours later he had amassed about $10 in
greasy, SPAM-slime covered change and small bills.

ah, SPAM.  :)

osby: i'll bring the book for you on saturday (if you're going...
which you are, correct?).  i can't bear to part with it, but i'll let
you peruse it's papery goodness.

shane

ps- i have no idea, btw, how i actually came to possess the SPAM
cookbook.

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 08 Apr 2004 05:13:02.0692 (UTC) FILETIME=[2AC8DA40:01C41D28]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] RE: NRR:  the whole damn grammar thing!

i've found that the new st. martin's handbook (certainly no longer uhm, new) 
has been helpful in all grammatical issues for those who struggle.  its 
cheaper than a class (i'm sure you can find it used at any bookstore), and 
it is organized in a way that makes navigation through its chapters 
incredibly simple.  it covers everything from subject-verb agreement to MLA 
and APA documentation.  i've had it for years now and don't know what i'd do 
without it!

<3,
kali


>From: Nathan Seven <scosol@yahoo.com>
>To: Steve Osteen <SOsteen@pinnaclesys.com>, JonnyR@aol.com,  
>innocentchild@hotmail.com, gregvp@comcast.net, sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: [sfraves] NRR effect/affect RE: [sfraves] SRR: *especially TRANCE* 
>Defending my friend, Warren
>Date: Wed, 7 Apr 2004 13:19:33 -0700 (PDT)
>
>Your "grammer"?
>
>Sorry- I had to :P
>
>I love nothing more than seeing someone bitching about
>someone else's "grammer"-
>It seems to happen at least once a day on /.
>
>As to your question, someone please correct me if this
>is incorrect because I'm not a professional-
>
>But "affect" and "effect" differ mainly by their use
>as nouns and verbs.
>"effect" is always(*) a noun.
>"affect" is always(*) a verb.
>Correct: "I'm feeling that blunt's effects""
>Correct: "Man, that 40 is affecting my judgement!"
>
>(*) The only exception I've seen to this is the phrase
>"to effect change"
>(Meaning- "to bring about change")
>I think it's that way because it's describing the
>condition of change (noun).
>If that phrase meant "to change change" (change used
>first as verb, then as noun- which makes no sense)
>then it would be written as "to affect change"-
>Tho, lots of people write that too, so maybe its
>interchangable.
>
>--- Steve Osteen <SOsteen@pinnaclesys.com> wrote:
> > This reminds me of a grammer issue that I had to do
> > lots of research to figure out since no one seems to
> > really know:
> >
> > What is the correct usages of "effect" vs. "affect".
> >
> > Effect is not for human use. Affect is for when a
> > chemical affects you and you feel the effects. Got
> > it?
> >
> > "affect" is a verb and "effect" is a noun.
> >
> > My grammer is really good until I take too much
> > cough syrup, I'm sure many other users of this list
> > have similar problems.
> >
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: JonnyR@aol.com [mailto:JonnyR@aol.com]
> > Sent: Wednesday, April 07, 2004 11:27 AM
> > To: innocentchild@hotmail.com; gregvp@comcast.net;
> > sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: *especially TRANCE*
> > Defending my friend,
> > Warren
> >
> >
> > Hi, as usual in a debate, I feel that everybody is
> > write ... oops, "right"
> > :)  ... to some degree. Like Greg, I make my living
> > editing the mistakes that
> > other people make when writing, so in a way I have a
> > vested interest in the
> > continued misuse and abuse of the English language
> > by so many people.
> >
> > I think what we're witnessing is the fallout from
> > the "Hooked on Phonics"
> > phenomenon. In the past, many kids who were not
> > solid in language skills felt
> > awkward about expressing themselves. Phonics
> > encouraged them to go ahead and
> > write, with less emphasis on correct spelling and
> > other emphases of older methods.
> > That's great, up to a point -- eventually kids
> > should learn how to spell
> > correctly because, as Ryan says, people will not
> > take them seriously if their
> > language is severely mangled.  We see with some SFR
> > members an exuberance about
> > self-expression that would be welcome, except that
> > the spelling and grammatical
> > choices do indeed make the brain hurt at times.
> >
> > It's all a matter of degree. I don't think that the
> > population, in general,
> > spells as well as in the past. Many of the posts on
> > SFR contain spelling or
> > grammatical mistakes, but if they are below a
> > certain threshhold, readibility is
> > not threatened. Very many posts contain words that
> > pass a spellchecker but are
> > in fact the "wrong word," such as "their" vs.
> > "they're." The spelling of many
> > words is only a guess; for example, "feening" (as in
> > desiring something) is
> > really spelled "fiending" (as in "drug fiend"). A
> > common mistake, even found in
> > many publications, is the word "phased" (meaning
> > affected) when it really
> > should be "fazed." Even the best grammarians will
> > leave in small mistakes and
> > uncapitalized letters, knowing that they are
> > communicating well enough to be
> > understood, especially in the informal realm of
> > online media.
> >
> > I recommend to everyone not to be too reliant on
> > spellchecking. Spellcheckers
> > are the front-line soldiers in the war against bad
> > English but they're not
> > the whole solution. For those who really have a lot
> > of difficulty with written
> > language, I recommend classes at a local community
> > college or a similar
> > program. Your ability to communicate really does
> > affect your chances of success in
> > life.
> >
> > I have not yet met Warren in person but he seems to
> > be a very sincere and
> > warm person who has only the best intentions. In a
> > way, I'm reminded of a
> > friend's younger brother who is always eager and
> > wants to tag along all the time. You
> > might get annoyed that he can't communicate in a
> > more polished way, but you
> > can't really get mad at him for being himself.
> >
> > that's my Too Sense     :)
> > John
> >
> >

>From: "kali lux" <pretty_kali@hotmail.com>

>Sent: Wednesday, April 07, 2004 10:13 PM
>Subject: [sfraves] RE: NRR: the whole damn grammar thing!
>
>
> > i've found that the new st. martin's handbook (certainly no longer uhm, 
>new)
> > has been helpful in all grammatical issues for those who struggle.  its
> > cheaper than a class (i'm sure you can find it used at any bookstore), 
>and
> > it is organized in a way that makes navigation through its chapters
> > incredibly simple.  it covers everything from subject-verb agreement to 
>MLA
> > and APA documentation.  i've had it for years now and don't know what 
>i'd do
> > without it!
> >
> > <3,
> > kali
> >
> >
> > >From: Nathan Seven <scosol@yahoo.com>
> > >To: Steve Osteen <SOsteen@pinnaclesys.com>, JonnyR@aol.com,
> > >innocentchild@hotmail.com, gregvp@comcast.net, sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > >Subject: [sfraves] NRR effect/affect RE: [sfraves] SRR: *especially 
>TRANCE*
> > >Defending my friend, Warren
> > >Date: Wed, 7 Apr 2004 13:19:33 -0700 (PDT)
> > >
> > >Your "grammer"?
> > >
> > >Sorry- I had to :P
> > >
> > >I love nothing more than seeing someone bitching about
> > >someone else's "grammer"-
> > >It seems to happen at least once a day on /.
> > >
> > >As to your question, someone please correct me if this
> > >is incorrect because I'm not a professional-
> > >
> > >But "affect" and "effect" differ mainly by their use
> > >as nouns and verbs.
> > >"effect" is always(*) a noun.
> > >"affect" is always(*) a verb.
> > >Correct: "I'm feeling that blunt's effects""
> > >Correct: "Man, that 40 is affecting my judgement!"
> > >
> > >(*) The only exception I've seen to this is the phrase
> > >"to effect change"
> > >(Meaning- "to bring about change")
> > >I think it's that way because it's describing the
> > >condition of change (noun).
> > >If that phrase meant "to change change" (change used
> > >first as verb, then as noun- which makes no sense)
> > >then it would be written as "to affect change"-
> > >Tho, lots of people write that too, so maybe its
> > >interchangable.
> > >
> > >--- Steve Osteen <SOsteen@pinnaclesys.com> wrote:
> > > > This reminds me of a grammer issue that I had to do
> > > > lots of research to figure out since no one seems to
> > > > really know:
> > > >
> > > > What is the correct usages of "effect" vs. "affect".
> > > >
> > > > Effect is not for human use. Affect is for when a
> > > > chemical affects you and you feel the effects. Got
> > > > it?
> > > >
> > > > "affect" is a verb and "effect" is a noun.
> > > >
> > > > My grammer is really good until I take too much
> > > > cough syrup, I'm sure many other users of this list
> > > > have similar problems.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: JonnyR@aol.com [mailto:JonnyR@aol.com]
> > > > Sent: Wednesday, April 07, 2004 11:27 AM
> > > > To: innocentchild@hotmail.com; gregvp@comcast.net;
> > > > sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > > > Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: *especially TRANCE*
> > > > Defending my friend,
> > > > Warren
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Hi, as usual in a debate, I feel that everybody is
> > > > write ... oops, "right"
> > > > :)  ... to some degree. Like Greg, I make my living
> > > > editing the mistakes that
> > > > other people make when writing, so in a way I have a
> > > > vested interest in the
> > > > continued misuse and abuse of the English language
> > > > by so many people.
> > > >
> > > > I think what we're witnessing is the fallout from
> > > > the "Hooked on Phonics"
> > > > phenomenon. In the past, many kids who were not
> > > > solid in language skills felt
> > > > awkward about expressing themselves. Phonics
> > > > encouraged them to go ahead and
> > > > write, with less emphasis on correct spelling and
> > > > other emphases of older methods.
> > > > That's great, up to a point -- eventually kids
> > > > should learn how to spell
> > > > correctly because, as Ryan says, people will not
> > > > take them seriously if their
> > > > language is severely mangled.  We see with some SFR
> > > > members an exuberance about
> > > > self-expression that would be welcome, except that
> > > > the spelling and grammatical
> > > > choices do indeed make the brain hurt at times.
> > > >
> > > > It's all a matter of degree. I don't think that the
> > > > population, in general,
> > > > spells as well as in the past. Many of the posts on
> > > > SFR contain spelling or
> > > > grammatical mistakes, but if they are below a
> > > > certain threshhold, readibility is
> > > > not threatened. Very many posts contain words that
> > > > pass a spellchecker but are
> > > > in fact the "wrong word," such as "their" vs.
> > > > "they're." The spelling of many
> > > > words is only a guess; for example, "feening" (as in
> > > > desiring something) is
> > > > really spelled "fiending" (as in "drug fiend"). A
> > > > common mistake, even found in
> > > > many publications, is the word "phased" (meaning
> > > > affected) when it really
> > > > should be "fazed." Even the best grammarians will
> > > > leave in small mistakes and
> > > > uncapitalized letters, knowing that they are
> > > > communicating well enough to be
> > > > understood, especially in the informal realm of
> > > > online media.
> > > >
> > > > I recommend to everyone not to be too reliant on
> > > > spellchecking. Spellcheckers
> > > > are the front-line soldiers in the war against bad
> > > > English but they're not
> > > > the whole solution. For those who really have a lot
> > > > of difficulty with written
> > > > language, I recommend classes at a local community
> > > > college or a similar
> > > > program. Your ability to communicate really does
> > > > affect your chances of success in
> > > > life.
> > > >
> > > > I have not yet met Warren in person but he seems to
> > > > be a very sincere and
> > > > warm person who has only the best intentions. In a
> > > > way, I'm reminded of a
> > > > friend's younger brother who is always eager and
> > > > wants to tag along all the time. You
> > > > might get annoyed that he can't communicate in a
> > > > more polished way, but you
> > > > can't really get mad at him for being himself.
> > > >
> > > > that's my Too Sense     :)
> > > > John
> > > >
> > > >
> > >---------------------------------------------------------------------

> > > > sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Rotation &@ Luna Lounge tonight

The DEA (dance everywhere association) presents a special pre-easter 
Rotation at the Luna Lounge this Thursday April 8th.

Your guides for the evening will be:

8-10 Helios vs. Random (Phoenix Family) - Live
7-8 Squarefade (DEA)
6-7 Aes Dana (Ultimae Records - France)
5-6 Maer (Ambient Airlines, Dub Beautiful, Upinyah)

Artwork by Sooz
UV decor by Psybertribe (Nik)
Easter egg hunt by Gwyn

So get out of work and come early to enjoy some chillout time with a 
local favorite Maer, and a special out of town guest Aes Dana from 
Ultimae Records. The shift into trance will debut our latest addition 
to the DEA family - Squarefade. Our headliners, Helios and Random, are 
planning a set in the spirit of that famous night at the Sol System on 
the playa.

21+ ID required

Free before 6pm - $5 after
Great inexpensive Mexican food served until 8pm

Located at the Luna Lounge on 1192 Folsom in  San Francisco CA

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Is there anywhere for techno?

I didn't say I cant find techno going on. The most important part of what 
I'm asking is the party part of it. Not the techno part.

>>Is there anywhere to find a really dope techno party?

These days, just finding someone playing techno is not enough. After all 
these years, I'm no longer willing to use my time going out unless there's a 
good chance that a party will be something special. I want it all.

Shit, even if it's only a few times a year... That would be cool.

I look, harder than you know.

Here in america we're as lucky to have such a bright, smart, enlightened 
president to lead us to the promise land. Here are a few quotes to remember him by 
in the future.



"Mars is essentially in the same orbit... Mars is somewhat the same distance 
from the Sun, which is very important. We have seen pictures where there are 
canals, we believe, and water. If there is water, that means there is oxygen. 
If oxygen, that means we can breathe."  -GWB

"Natural gas is hemispheric. I like to call it hemispheric in nature because 
it is a product that we can find in our neighborhoods." Dec. 20, 2000 

"The Holocaust was an obscene period in our nation's history. I mean in this 
century's history. But we all lived in this century. I didn't live in this 
century." GW Bush,
" I believe we are on an irreversible trend toward more freedom and 
democracy, but that could change." 
"One word sums up probably the responsibility of any Governor, and that one 
word is 'to be prepared'." 
"Verbosity leads to unclear, inarticulate things." 
" I have made good judgments in the past. I have made good judgments in the 
future." 
"The future will be better tomorrow." 
"We're going to have the best educated American people in the world." 
"People that are really very weird can get into sensitive positions and have 
a tremendous impact on history." 
"I stand by all the misstatements that I've made." GW Bush, Jr. to Sam 
Donaldson 
"We have a firm commitment to NATO, we are a part of NATO. We have a firm 
commitment to Europe. We are a part of Europe." ... 
"Public speaking is very easy." ... 
"I am not part of the problem. I am a Republican"
"A low voter turnout is an indication of fewer people going to the polls." 
"When I have been asked who caused the riots and the killing in LA, my answer 
has been direct & simple: Who is to blame for the riots? The rioters are to 
blame. Who is to blame for the killings? The killers are to blame. 
"Illegitimacy is something we should talk about in terms of not having it." 
"We are ready for any unforeseen event that may or may not occur."
"For NASA, space is still a high priority."
"Quite frankly, teachers are the only profession that teach our children."
"The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that George Bush 
may or may not make." ...Gov GW Bush, Jr.
"We're all capable of mistakes, but I do not care to enlighten you on the 
mistakes we may or may not have made." 
"It isn't pollution that's harming the environment. It's the impurities in 
our air and water that are doing it."

-------------------------------1081451350--

modified productions presents:
thirteen

have plans that end early. we will have plenty of seating and chill areas!

element [modified] spinning progressive house
thomas kent [modified/ill behavior] spinning progressive tech
garrett ryan [construction/quench] spinning tech house
iLL.D [raw heaven/thought crime] spinning house
nick nyquil [g recordings] vs kris kent [ill behavior] spinning breaks

virgin local indoor ug venue
12am-6am+
only $3 at the door
*thumping* sound by modified
uv/decor by modified
sony playstation games on the visual screen

did, so please be prepared accordingly.

will happen :)

Subject: RE: [sfraves] BSP: DON'T MISS Li Sasaki RIGHT NOW on An Epiphany Of

Li is playing at next month's huggermugger (may 16th) in tag team
formation with his old buddy me.  For those who remember those nights (we
sure as fuck don't) AndyW and Li came from a time when it was important
for DJs to be multidisciplinarians, and be like twice as wasted as the
kids sitting in the middle of the dancefloor huffing vicks, ducking UFOs
and planting trees in the linoleum.

HuggerMugger goes down every third Saturday at Lit 9-2am (at the lovely
intersection of 6th and Mission).  Top Shelf DJing and premium cat shaving
services with a techno flavor.  Please make a note of it.

I<3Li!
andyw

Hey,

Not to bring down everyone's sunny day, but life calls. I received a =
huge amount of support from the SFR family in regards to my Friend =
Eugene who was murdered in SF...I was sent this doc in an email from his =
family, for anyone that is interested.=20

START
--
Eugene Gorenman
His zest and passion for life will be missed terribly and will never be =
forgotten.
=20
At the age of 26 he lost his life to a senseless act of violence on =
March 29th 2004.  Eugene contributed a lot to the community, was a good =
and loyal friend to many of us and touched the lives of everyone he met.

Now, it is our chance as a community to support Eugene's family through =
this difficult time and help them find the truth about what happened to =
their son.=20

Friends and loved ones of Eugene Gorenman have set up a support fund at =
Wells Fargo Bank to help the family deal with their terrible loss. The =
funds that are raised will be a tremendous aid to the family at this =
horrible time in their lives.  Your support will bring closure to their =
lives and help us all carry on Zhenya's legacy.

This is your chance to honor Zhenya, lend a hand to the family=20
and fight for justice

Please send your contributions to the:
Gorenman Family
P.O. BOX 3010
Walnut Creek, CA 94598
Please make checks payable to the "Gorenman Family"=20
Transfer funds or make a deposit to:   Acct #:  9091258088
         =20
Your support is greatly appreciated.
If you have any questions or comments, please send e-mails to =
supporteugene@cs.com

From: Starchild <sfdreamer@earthlink.net>

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.553)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Bushism

	I think we're already in "promise land." We get there before every 
election. It's the "promised land" that never seems to arrive. 
Meanwhile, Bush has clearly said a lot of ridiculous things, but I 
don't think this quote belongs on the list:

"When I have been asked who caused the riots and the killing in LA, my 
answer has been direct & simple: Who is to blame for the riots? The 
rioters are to blame. Who is to blame for the killings? The killers are 
to blame."

	Nothing dumb about that. The rioters and killers *were* the ones to 
blame for the riots and killings in L.A. Maybe whoever put that list 
together is mocking him for his answer because the people asking the 
question were looking for a detailed response parcelling out blame to 
different ethnic groups, people causing racial tensions, institutions 
like the LAPD,  etc. But sometimes when you get into all that, you lose 
the most important point, which is that individuals are responsible for 
their own actions. He could hardly have said it any better.

Groove on,
						<<< Starchild >>>

DEF:SF is indeed doing a party this weekend.  I'll be there for sure:)

Here's the BSP:::
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 From the crew who brought you FUTURE PERFECT and PARADIGM SHIFT,

Saturday, April 10th, 2004

DEF, in association with Techno Truth and Cymbalic, return to bring
you....

 >:::::::::::||=||=||=||=||((RoBoT feelings))||=||=||=||=||:::::::::::::::<

a trueschool community reunion of art, techno and electro under one roof

Featuring\\:
*)Top techno DJ talent from the bay area, central, & southwest coast
*)Def graff-art + electro styles from the finest DJs and artists, nu-skool
tooldskool.
*)Free water, chai, coffee, fruit, and refreshments
*)Delectable vegan chow catered & served by Chel-C Faith and Tessa Coils
*)Secure, comfortable, all ages SF location
*)Precision digitally processed audio by DEF Audio
*)Visual stimulus and blacklight art environments by Parallaxia
*)$12 at the door, 7pm-2am
*)Limited capacity, please come early!

[[[West coast techno heroes and electro stars playing 2x4 versus sets]]]

Drumcell (Droid Behavior, LA)  vs. John Massey (Droid Behavior, LA)
Sheztek (Moksha Tribe, SF) vs. Shank (Epiphany, Code, SF)
Chris Jackson (Resource Records, SF) vs. The Rhythmist (DoBox Recordings,
SF)
Ethan (Friends & Family, SF)
Kid Kola (DEF, SF) vs. Disconnect (DEF, SF)
Mykul (Cymbalic, SF) vs. Dirt (Techno Truth, Cymbalic, SF)
GAMMA (Techno Truth, Sac) vs. Mek (Techno Truth, Sac)

(Unfortunately, Forest Green will not be able to appear at Robot Feelings,
as she is leaving a few days earlier than originally planned for her
European tour.  We send our apologies to all the dancers, and of course we
wish Forest the best of luck on her tour.)

Graffiti work exhibited by Skert, Repo, Cola, & Deuce w/ more TBA

B-boys & B-girls welcome. Downrock at your own risk.

Robot Feelings will be located at Cellspace in San Francisco.  Cellspace
is a drug and alcohol free community arts venue. Respect the space and
surrounding neighborhood. Do not flyer cars surrounding the space. No
markers, paint/tips, scribers, etc. allowed inside the venue.  No ins and
outs are allowed after 10pm.  A smoking area will be provided. Please
respect the rules of the venue so that others may congregate there in the
future.

DEF communication hubs:
415.289.6886.
www.defsf.com
def@defsf.com

Online Flyer @
http://www.monkeyview.net/id/724/defevents/robotfeelings/index.vhtml

:::respect the past, celebrate the present, create the future:::




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 5481 invoked by uid 1103); 8 Apr 2004 22:48:43 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 5467 invoked from network); 8 Apr 2004 22:48:43 -0000
Message-ID: <4075D6E7.4040507@itsa.ucsf.edu>
Date: Thu, 08 Apr 2004 15:49:11 -0700
From: Ben Hunrichs <bensh@itsa.ucsf.edu>
User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird 0.5 (Windows/20040207)
X-Accept-Language: en-us, en
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
References: <C67E7846-89AB-11D8-B26C-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
In-Reply-To: <C67E7846-89AB-11D8-B26C-003065DA480A@earthlink.net>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Bushism

That's a pretty good point. And perhaps the quote doesn't belong on the 
list, because it is not an obvious inanity.  You shouldn't ignore the 
fact that with that statement he sidesteps some important issues. 
Of course, an individual involved in a crime is responsible for his or 
her crime, and no one else is.  And a riot is really nothing else than a 
bunch of individuals committing individual crimes.  The fact that it 
happened on such a large scale, however, indicates that there is 
something more going on.  Something acting on the level of communities 
and society.  Bush's statement points out the obvious and simple in 
order to not deal with the some uncomfortable realities and underlying 
causes.  I think the fact that the most putatively powerful man in the 
country is _avoiding_ the discussion is just as messed up the fact that 
he often comes across as an idiot. 
No, scratch that.  I think it's more messed up.  And I think that when 
he says stupid shit, he often does so in order to avoid real discussion 
on those matters too.  By being imprecise he can't be held to anything 
he says.  I can't be bothered to go out and actually find a quote, but 
several times I've come across statements made by him which are quite 
inflammatory, but very imprecisely worded.  It's always followed by a 
more reasonable statement from an aide, saying what the president "meant 
to say".  It's all just rhetoric, and depending on your p.o.v., you 
either eat it up or it disgusts you.

ben

waving shaka all over the place.

After enlightenment, freak the funk and drink plenty of water."

"Opinions are my own only, and do not necessarily represent those of
KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Bushism

Ya know...  I'm all for ragging on president Duh, when he displays his 
idiocy himself.  But several of those are fake (Well, not exactly fake, 
but not spoken by the shrub.).  The ones about the holocause being an 
"obscene period in our nation's history" and "impurities in the air and 
water" in particular, I remember being part of a list of Dan 
Quayle-isms that used to circulate in the BBS scene, back during the 
time of george the first.

And a quick google for "Dan Quayle quotes" does actually come up with 
lists containing many of these.


cya,
john


On Apr 8, 2004, at 12:09 PM, WingNutt635@aol.com wrote:

> Here in america we're as lucky to have such a bright, smart, 
> enlightened
> president to lead us to the promise land. Here are a few quotes to 
> remember him by
> in the future.
>
>
>
> "Mars is essentially in the same orbit... Mars is somewhat the same 
> distance
> from the Sun, which is very important. We have seen pictures where 
> there are
> canals, we believe, and water. If there is water, that means there is 
> oxygen.
> If oxygen, that means we can breathe."  -GWB
>
> "Natural gas is hemispheric. I like to call it hemispheric in nature 
> because
> it is a product that we can find in our neighborhoods." Dec. 20, 2000
>
> "The Holocaust was an obscene period in our nation's history. I mean 
> in this
> century's history. But we all lived in this century. I didn't live in 
> this
> century." GW Bush,
> " I believe we are on an irreversible trend toward more freedom and
> democracy, but that could change."
> "One word sums up probably the responsibility of any Governor, and 
> that one
> word is 'to be prepared'."
> "Verbosity leads to unclear, inarticulate things."
> " I have made good judgments in the past. I have made good judgments 
> in the
> future."
> "The future will be better tomorrow."
> "We're going to have the best educated American people in the world."
> "People that are really very weird can get into sensitive positions 
> and have
> a tremendous impact on history."
> "I stand by all the misstatements that I've made." GW Bush, Jr. to Sam
> Donaldson
> "We have a firm commitment to NATO, we are a part of NATO. We have a 
> firm
> commitment to Europe. We are a part of Europe." ...
> "Public speaking is very easy." ...
> "I am not part of the problem. I am a Republican"
> "A low voter turnout is an indication of fewer people going to the 
> polls."
> "When I have been asked who caused the riots and the killing in LA, my 
> answer
> has been direct & simple: Who is to blame for the riots? The rioters 
> are to
> blame. Who is to blame for the killings? The killers are to blame.
> "Illegitimacy is something we should talk about in terms of not having 
> it."
> "We are ready for any unforeseen event that may or may not occur."
> "For NASA, space is still a high priority."
> "Quite frankly, teachers are the only profession that teach our 
> children."
> "The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that 
> George Bush
> may or may not make." ...Gov GW Bush, Jr.
> "We're all capable of mistakes, but I do not care to enlighten you on 
> the
> mistakes we may or may not have made."
> "It isn't pollution that's harming the environment. It's the 
> impurities in
> our air and water that are doing it."

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Bushism


> That's a pretty good point. And perhaps the quote doesn't belong on the
> list, because it is not an obvious inanity.  You shouldn't ignore the
> fact that with that statement he sidesteps some important issues.
> Of course, an individual involved in a crime is responsible for his or
> her crime, and no one else is.  And a riot is really nothing else than a
> bunch of individuals committing individual crimes.  The fact that it
> happened on such a large scale, however, indicates that there is
> something more going on.  Something acting on the level of communities
> and society.  Bush's statement points out the obvious and simple in
> order to not deal with the some uncomfortable realities and underlying
> causes.  I think the fact that the most putatively powerful man in the
> country is _avoiding_ the discussion is just as messed up the fact that
> he often comes across as an idiot.
> No, scratch that.  I think it's more messed up.  And I think that when
> he says stupid shit, he often does so in order to avoid real discussion
> on those matters too.  By being imprecise he can't be held to anything
> he says.  I can't be bothered to go out and actually find a quote, but
> several times I've come across statements made by him which are quite
> inflammatory, but very imprecisely worded.  It's always followed by a
> more reasonable statement from an aide, saying what the president "meant
> to say".  It's all just rhetoric, and depending on your p.o.v., you
> either eat it up or it disgusts you.
>
> ben
>
> Starchild wrote:
>
> >     I think we're already in "promise land." We get there before every
> > election. It's the "promised land" that never seems to arrive.
> > Meanwhile, Bush has clearly said a lot of ridiculous things, but I
> > don't think this quote belongs on the list:
> >
> > "When I have been asked who caused the riots and the killing in LA, my
> > answer has been direct & simple: Who is to blame for the riots? The
> > rioters are to blame. Who is to blame for the killings? The killers
> > are to blame."
> >
> >     Nothing dumb about that. The rioters and killers *were* the ones
> > to blame for the riots and killings in L.A. Maybe whoever put that
> > list together is mocking him for his answer because the people asking
> > the question were looking for a detailed response parcelling out blame
> > to different ethnic groups, people causing racial tensions,
> > institutions like the LAPD,  etc. But sometimes when you get into all
> > that, you lose the most important point, which is that individuals are
> > responsible for their own actions. He could hardly have said it any
> > better.
> >
> > Groove on,
> >                         <<< Starchild >>>
> >

>From the crew who brought you FUTURE PERFECT and PARADIGM SHIFT,

                        Saturday, April 10th, 2004
  
DEF, in association with Techno Truth and Cymbalic, return to bring you....
              

>:::::::::::||=||=||=||=||((RoBoT feelings))||=||=||=||=||:::::::::::::::<
a trueschool community reunion of art, techno and electro under one roof

Featuring\\:
*)Top techno DJ talent from the bay area, central, & southwest coast
*)Def graff-art + electro styles from the finest DJs and artists, nu-skool to 
oldskool.
*)Free water, chai, coffee, fruit, and refreshments
*)Delectable vegan chow catered & served by Chel-C Faith and Tessa Coils
*)Secure, comfortable, all ages SF location
*)Precision digitally processed audio by DEF Audio
*)Visual stimulus and blacklight art environments by Parallaxia
*)$12 at the door, 7pm-2am
*)Limited capacity, please come early!



[[[West coast techno heroes and electro stars playing 2x4 versus sets]]]

Drumcell (Droid Behavior, LA)  vs. John Massey (Droid Behavior, LA)
Sheztek (Moksha Tribe, SF) vs. Shank (Epiphany, Code, SF)
Chris Jackson (Resource Records, SF) vs. The Rhythmist (DoBox Recordings, SF)
Ethan (Friends & Family, SF)
Kid Kola (DEF, SF) vs. Disconnect (DEF, SF)
Mykul (Cymbalic, SF) vs. Dirt (Techno Truth, Cymbalic, SF)
GAMMA (Techno Truth, Sac) vs. Mek (Techno Truth, Sac)


Graffiti work exhibited by, Skert, Repo, Cola, & Deuce w/ more TBA

B-boys & B-girls welcome. Downrock at your own risk. 


Robot Feelings will be located at Cellspace in San Francisco.  Cellspace is a 
drug and alcohol free community arts venue. Respect the space and surrounding 
neighborhood. Do not flyer cars surrounding the space. No markers, 
paint/tips, scribers, etc. allowed inside the venue.  No ins and outs are allowed after 
10pm.  A smoking area will be provided. Please respect the rules of the venue 
so that others may congregate there in the future.

hey look no further,   

this saturday april 10th the DEF KRU, Techno-Truth, and Cymbalic come wreckin 
w/
>>RoBoT feelings<< 
   the party's sort of an homage to the early moral values of the south bronx 
hip hop culture. when chaos was breakin loose they created art, community, 
and unity. i feel alot of important steps in the moral structure of raves were bo
rrowed from afrika bambaata's zulu nation. when planet rock was released it 
eluded to the zulu nation ethic as one planet one nation one world under a 
groove (as suggested by the parliament lyric).  the techno and electro music 
genres are an evolution of that concept and have taken it to the next level. our 
current scene often fails to show respect for its roots even though the obvious 
signs are there, technics sl1200s, flyer designers trying to get over with 
flyers, djs & promotional outfits gathered together like graff crews, and dancers 
adopting styles through emotion and advancing them through personal 
expression.. 

robot feelings is all about that. take out your agression, -your hard 
thoughts and the people breakin on you and break on the floor. show love unity and 
respect and break on noone else. 

robot feelings should be pretty off the hook. hope you all can show love and 
support for your scene.
the full BSP should be posted to the list somewhere around here...
in the odd event that it is not please seek the knowledge and apply.
DEF communication hubs:
415.289.6886.
www.defsf.com
def@defsf.com

Online Flyer @ 
http://www.monkeyview.net/id/724/defevents/robotfeelings/index.vhtml

From sfraves-return-111736-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Fri Apr 09 17:02:56 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-111736-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 50531 invoked by uid 1103); 9 Apr 2004 17:02:53 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 50516 invoked from network); 9 Apr 2004 17:02:53 -0000
From: JonnyR@aol.com
Message-ID: <102.4237b8b8.2da83136@aol.com>
Date: Fri, 9 Apr 2004 13:02:46 EDT
To: SFRaves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="-----------------------------1081530166"
X-Mailer: 9.0 for Windows sub 5107
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: favorite Italian dishes, anyone?

-------------------------------1081530166
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

ok, Spam has had its day in the sun. Sounds like Marco can cook up a mean 
plate of pasta with meatballs ... anybody have favorite Italian recipes to share? 

I don't have the amounts with me so this will just sketch it out. It's a 
Chicago-style stuffed pizza with Italian sausage. 
Warm up some milk in the microwave. Mix in two packets of yeast and some 
sugar, along with some cornmeal. Let it sit. Put about five cups of flour in a big 
bowl with a little vegetable oil and salt. Then mix in the yeast mixture and 
knead the dough for about five minutes. Set it aside to rise (covered, in a 
warm place). 
After an hour or so, pound the dough down and knead it some more. Then, split 
it so about 40% is in one ball and 60% in the other. Knead each ball some 
more. Roll (hehe ... I used a raver word) the bigger ball with a rolling pin so 
it's bigger than the pizza pan. (This works best in a deep dish pan, with high 
sides.)
Crumble up some Italian sausage and fry it up in a pan. Shred a whole bunch 
of raw spinach in a food processor. Shred a whole lot of mozzarella. Mix the 
spinach and mozzarella and spread it over the dough, and then throw in the 
cooked sausage along with some more mozzarella and spinach. 
Roll out the smaller piece of dough and lay it over the spinach. Crimp the 
edges of the two layers of dough together so they're locked. Then, press the 
edges of the dough and fold them over to make a rounded edge crust. Poke some 
holes in the top layer of dough with a fork. 
Spread some more cheese on top, along with some diced Roma tomatoes that have 
been well drained. (It's really good if you let the tomatoes simmer first, 
with a bunch of Italian herbs like oregano and basil. It shouldn't be watery or 
the crust will get soggy) Sprinkle on a bunch of parmesan. Maybe some black 
olives ... fresh garlic ... whatever. 
**If done right, the pizza will weigh a lot, so be careful handling it when 
it's hot.**
Put in an oven that's preheated to 450 degrees F. Put on a rack below the 
middle of the oven for 20 minutes, then move to a rack right at the middle for 
... oh, this depends on the oven, but probably about 25 minutes longer. When 
done, the crust should look golden, and any cheese that's exposed should be 
getting brown. 
Take it out of the oven and let it sit for at least five minutes before 
cutting and serving. If it's too thick for a pizza cutter, use a butcher knife.  :) 
 
I made this pizza for a friend who's  a chef -- with a slight change of beef 
tri-tip (marinated in merlot) instead of sausage -- and he said it was the 
best pizza he's ever had. 

This pizza is a lot of work and takes a while to make but it's really filling 
and tastes great. 
Mangia, mangia... 

-------------------------------1081530166--

Message-ID: <20040409181507.27509.qmail@web42002.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Fri, 9 Apr 2004 11:15:07 -0700 (PDT)
From: can ya hang <ellerockit@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <102.4237b8b8.2da83136@aol.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="0-1829801615-1081534507=:26241"

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: favorite Italian dishes, anyone?

--0-1829801615-1081534507=:26241
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

spaghettios ! 

JonnyR@aol.com wrote:ok, Spam has had its day in the sun. Sounds like Marco can cook up a mean 
plate of pasta with meatballs ... anybody have favorite Italian recipes to share? 

I don't have the amounts with me so this will just sketch it out. It's a 
Chicago-style stuffed pizza with Italian sausage. 
Warm up some milk in the microwave. Mix in two packets of yeast and some 
sugar, along with some cornmeal. Let it sit. Put about five cups of flour in a big 
bowl with a little vegetable oil and salt. Then mix in the yeast mixture and 
knead the dough for about five minutes. Set it aside to rise (covered, in a 
warm place). 
After an hour or so, pound the dough down and knead it some more. Then, split 
it so about 40% is in one ball and 60% in the other. Knead each ball some 
more. Roll (hehe ... I used a raver word) the bigger ball with a rolling pin so 
it's bigger than the pizza pan. (This works best in a deep dish pan, with high 
sides.)
Crumble up some Italian sausage and fry it up in a pan. Shred a whole bunch 
of raw spinach in a food processor. Shred a whole lot of mozzarella. Mix the 
spinach and mozzarella and spread it over the dough, and then throw in the 
cooked sausage along with some more mozzarella and spinach. 
Roll out the smaller piece of dough and lay it over the spinach. Crimp the 
edges of the two layers of dough together so they're locked. Then, press the 
edges of the dough and fold them over to make a rounded edge crust. Poke some 
holes in the top layer of dough with a fork. 
Spread some more cheese on top, along with some diced Roma tomatoes that have 
been well drained. (It's really good if you let the tomatoes simmer first, 
with a bunch of Italian herbs like oregano and basil. It shouldn't be watery or 
the crust will get soggy) Sprinkle on a bunch of parmesan. Maybe some black 
olives ... fresh garlic ... whatever. 
**If done right, the pizza will weigh a lot, so be careful handling it when 
it's hot.**
Put in an oven that's preheated to 450 degrees F. Put on a rack below the 
middle of the oven for 20 minutes, then move to a rack right at the middle for 
... oh, this depends on the oven, but probably about 25 minutes longer. When 
done, the crust should look golden, and any cheese that's exposed should be 
getting brown. 
Take it out of the oven and let it sit for at least five minutes before 
cutting and serving. If it's too thick for a pizza cutter, use a butcher knife. :) 

I made this pizza for a friend who's a chef -- with a slight change of beef 
tri-tip (marinated in merlot) instead of sausage -- and he said it was the 
best pizza he's ever had. 

This pizza is a lot of work and takes a while to make but it's really filling 
and tastes great. 
Mangia, mangia... 



---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?

--0-1829801615-1081534507=:26241--

Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR: really stupid computer/list question

After you select "reply", look at the addresses that are in the "To:" and
"Cc:" fields. That is who your message will be sent to when you select
"send". sfraves@hyperreal.org is the address that will deliver your
message to everyone who is subscribed to the list.

Subject: [sfraves] SFR Calendar: 04.09.04


Yield and overcome;
Bend and be straight;
Empty and be full;
Wear out and be new;
Have little and gain;
Have much and be confused...

Therefore wise men embrace the one
And set an example to all.
Not putting on a display,
They shine forth.
Not justifying themselves,
They are distinguished.
Not boasting;
They receive recognition.
Not bragging;
They never falter.
They do not quarrel,
So no one quarrels with them.
Therefore the ANCIENTS say, "Yield and Overcome..."
Is that an empty saying?

Be really whole,
and all things will come to you...
*Tao Te Ching 22*

ent **

Mystic Wonderland by Reaction Entertainment
GREENHOUSE (HOUSE)=ADHosted by Kontrast Recordings: HATIRAS [Blow Media/IHR=
/hatiras.com-Toronto]-Hatiras, one of house music's top artists, is best kn=
own for his work on IHR, Defected, his smash hit Spaced Invader and his Arr=
ival album. 2004 saw the launch of Hatiras' very own record label Blow Medi=
a. This event will celebrate that launch with a special set featuring loads=
 of exclusives and plenty of label giveaways - so don't miss it! STEVE SMOO=
TH [IHR/Moody Recordings/Motus/stevesmooth.com-Chicago]-Chicago's Steve Smo=
oth has quickly made his mark in the house and dance music community. He is=

 releases, and a bonafide hit with "Release" on IHR & "Get Naked" on Motus,=

e masses. ANGEL ALANIS [A Squared Muzik/angelalanis.com=ADChicago], DAVE AR=

rnal/Kontrast/Just Say Agency/highcaliberchicago.com-Chicago], C.I.A. [DJFr=

e "RockTheDiscotech") [undergroundmusic.com-SF].

rdings/John-B.com-MIMI, UK]-One of the most respected and known drum and ba=
ss producer today, John B has used the world around him to better the sound=

nd Up all Night, John B has mashed up dance floors all over the world from =
Singapore to Australia. FREAKY FLOW w/ MC FLIPSIDE (=8CThe Envy=B9 CD Relea=

cutting edge, this mistress of the turntables consistently crafts her talen=
ts as a singer and a DJ behind the turntables, Mea pioneers a new place for=

agazine to hail this petite performer "The Madonna of the New Millennium". =
Mea combines live freestyle vocals over a versatile set ranging from tech h=
ouse to hard trance to intelligent breaks. WHISTLER [lovetribe.net=ADSeattl=
e]-Victor Cape aka DJ Whistler is one of Seattle's most beloved hardstyle d=

ovetribe which has grown to be one of the most well-respected event product=
ions in the Pacific Northwest. He recently played the biggest gig of his DJ=

bara, Donald Glaude, Jerry Bonham & DJ Flave at Freaknight 7 thrown by USC.=

Saturday, April 10, 2004 ** Loveworks presents: The Depth Party **

Loveworks, the spark that has grown into an intense seven year inferno comb=
ining house music, art, and cutting edge atmospherics continues it=92s seri=
es of monthly audiosocial experiments with =91 THE DEPTH PARTY =91 on Satur=
day April 10th =9204 at their homebase=97 the 111 Minna Gallery in San Fran=
cisco=92s SOMA District.  This event will be a celebration of the Loveworks=
 sound and of what makes Loveworks one of the longest running house clubs i=
n San Francisco=92s history; featuring resident dj=92s MATT VALENZ and DAVI=
D HARNESS, laying down sonic textures so infectious you may not be able to =
escape the dancefloor !  Manning the gates will be the Loveworks guardian R=
AUL as well as guest services by BIG DAVE.  Your hosts for the evening are =
the inimitable NORI CASTILLO and DIANNA JACOBS who were instrumental in the=
 creation of the legendary TOONTOWN parties as well as CAREFREE DANCING, th=
e original house party at 177 Townsend.   Your other hosts for the evening =
are TALY, JIM & NIKITA.  Also in the early part of the evening, The Lovewor=
ks Classics Caf=E9 hosts a special event itself, teaming up with HOT urban =
clothing shop SUBTERRANEAN to kick off the night at 8pm with a special soir=
ee and fashion show.  Featuring hair by Anthony & Megan ( Glamarama ).  SUB=
TERRANEAN coordinators: Raquel & Amy.  Don=92t miss this night !

san francisco California, USA

Saturday, April 10, 2004 ** B.A.S.S>S.P.A.Z.M!!!! **

WARNING: Exposure to the unusually intense bass frequencies that will occur=
 at this event may cause
a little understood condition sometimes refered to as
"bugging out". Symptoms include but are not limited to:

*Eyes popping out of skull

*inability to control body movements

*ass liberation

If you think you may be unable to accept this possibility, we suggest you s=
tay home and watch tv. But you'll probably come anyway.

BASS BIN OPERATORS:

spukkinfaceship vs. niteshade,
an-ten-nae,megabitch,beast666,white rabbit,
d-syn,gawker

all ages-all night

come early to avoid the krush!!
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1216

Saturday, April 10, 2004 ** (((thump))) Saturday, April 10th, 2004 **

Welcome back the godfather of the Israeli Trance Scean.  Zoo-B returns to S=
an Francisco to enthral the dancefloor with his driving underground trance =
sound.  Israeli artists are known the world over as some of the best trance=
 DJs on the planet and Zoo-B is no exception.

Zoo-B  (((Usta Records, Isreal)))

Dutch (((Thump Radio)))
Michael Liu (((Illumination Records)))
ATUM (((Thump Radio)))

Upstairs:
Sen-Sei & Dj David Coleman (((Kinetic Grooves)))
Dimitris Mykanos (((Pleasure Zone)))

Friday, April 16, 2004 ** Elektrosorcery presents Aries **

Aries subjects are courageous leaders with a genuine concern for those they=
 command, being responsible people, it is rare that they will use their sub=
ordinates to obtain their own objectives as leaders, but occasionally it do=
es happen. They do not make very good followers because they are too "take =
charge". They may be unwilling to obey or submit to directions for which th=
ey can see no reason, or with which they disagree. They are much concerned =
with self, both positively and negatively - self-reliant but also self cent=
ered (sometimes) and concerned with their own personal advancement and phys=
ical satisfaction. Their immense energy makes them aggressive and restless,=
 argumentative occasionally, headstrong, quick tempered, easily offended an=
d capable of holding grudges if they feel themselves affronted.

With Aries DJs: Kid Wicked, SemaJ, Element, Goober, & Jesse Gonzalez.

May Day Trivia:

=95 Traditional May Day celebrations were pre-Christian agricultural festiv=
als. Eventually the significance was lost and the practices survived merely=
 as popular festivities. (Which can also be said about other holidays: Hall=
oween, Christmas, Easter.)

=95 A widespread superstition held that washing the face in the May Day mor=
ning dew would beautify the skin.

=95 In Hawaii, May Day is Lei Day. Everyone gives the gift of a lei to anot=
her, putting it around the receiver's neck and accompanying the gift with t=
he traditional kiss. Observing practices of the islanders for centuries, Le=
i Day began to be observed officially in 1928. Some Hawaiian celebrations a=
re complete with pageants, a Lei Queen and her court.

=95 In 1889, a congress of world Socialist parties held in Paris voted to s=
upport the U.S. labor movement's demand for an 8-hour day. It chose May 1, =
1890, as a day of demonstrations in favor of the 8-hour day. Afterward, May=
 1 became a holiday called Labor Day in many nations. It resembles the Sept=
ember holiday in the U.S. The holiday is especially important in socialist =
and Communist countries--when political demonstrations are held.


http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1241

Friday, May 7, 2004 ** Melon : Josh Wink **

Red Melon is proud to finally be able to showcase one of the biggest succes=
s stories in the underground house movement. Ask yourself how many globally=
 respected, underground artist-producer-DJs have turned-down offers to tour=
 with U2, and you will likely draw a short list. Josh Wink is such an artis=
t -- one who is unassuming, yet enjoys a cult following and who places arti=
stic integrity above all else. Owner of Ovum Recordings and remixer of mega=
-talents such as Sting, Depeche Mode and Ladytron, Josh has made only rare =
appearences in San Francisco, so don't miss out.

Supporting Josh will be Dano, Dj and tech house producer from San Francisco=
=2E  After a long winter touring Australia, New Zealand, and Eastern Europe=
, Dano is back in town working in the studio for a few months.  Dano has th=
ree new releases coming out simultaneously on Silicone Soul's Darkroom Dubs=
 imprint, Honchos Music, and Red Melon.  He will be spinning fresh techy gr=
ooves along with red melon biz partner JZ.  No stranger to the Melon experi=
ence, JZ is responsible for some of the most memorable sets in the seven ye=
ars of parties Red Melon has produced.  It will be just like old times!

If you are serious about your Red Melon parties, this Melon is not to be mi=
ssed! Get there before 11:00pm to take advantage of an earlybird cover char=
ge of $10 at San Francisco's newest venue, Mighty, located at 119 Utah St a=
t 15th Street. Mighty is a beautiful renovated warehouse with a touch of te=
chnology and art and the massive sound system that made Club Townsend a San=
 Francisco favorite. All of that plus cheap drinks too! You can't go wrong.=

Saturday, May 8, 2004 ** (Atmosfere) is Back! **

ATMOSFERE

After a brief hiatus Fatsouls is proud to present a very special Atmosfere =
session

As some of you may know, we have made changes to the event's schedule. Atmo=
sfere is now held intermittently as opposed to its usual monthly schedule.

Following the first two highly successful Deep and Sexy albums, Wave Music =
proudly presents the third installment in the series. This time Matthias "M=
atty" Heilbronn continues the legacy established by Francois K. and Ron Tre=
nt, crafting another masterful mix of sultry soul that keeps the pulse pump=
ing from start to finish.


Join us for the San Francisco Release party in support of the Deep & Sexy 3=
 album on Wave Music.

              Atmosfere

        (A Fatsouls Production)

     Saturday, May 8, 2004

     Club Six - 60 6 Street

     (between Market & Mission @ Jessie)

                with resident DJ Said

         (Performing "To Motherland" Live)

&

  special guest

Matthias "Matty" Heilbronn

(Wave Music, Soulflower Production, NY)

Throughout his illustrious career, Matthias has steadily achieved internati=
onal acclaim for his trademark sophisticated soulful sound: a glorious blen=
d of soulful, jazz-inflected deep house, percussive Afro-Latin rhythms and =
infectious progressive tribal beats.  He has rocked parties and festivals a=
ll over the world with his spellbinding DJ sets and seamless musical journe=
ys, not to mention receiving the #1 of the decade spot by DJ Magazine for h=
is Wave/Chez/Naked compilation CD.

+

Mauricio Aviles

(Naked Music, Loveslap Records)

&

Rasaki Aladokun

(Performing Live)

Rasaki is a miracle percussionist with over 25 years of experience.  He has=
 been a featured artist in the recording of many notable musicians such as =
King Sunny Ade, Stevie Wonder and Babatunde Olatunji to name a few. Don't m=
iss his extraordinary fusion of talking drum, conga, bongo and house music.

         Doors Open / 10pm -4am / 21+  with ID

        Cover Charge $10 before Midnight.

         www.fatsouls.com, www.wavemusic.com,
                       www.clubsix1.com

ave Music - =ADcomes legendary Matty Heilbronn to the decks, for a sultry a=
nd soulful ride worth every drop of sweat.   - XLR8R

 damn special, including as yet unreleased material as well as some you wil=
l already know and love... Great label, great guy!  I really can't fault th=
is.  - M8

in this series is a daunting task, but Matty rides this "Wave" with gusto. =

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] UPLIFT was So Dope!

OK.. I really wanna apoligize 2 Bam... I know i keep promising 2 go 2 Shadowlounge, & Seraphim, sorry I didn't make it out 2 Meow Mix lastnight either, but man... Uplift was fuckin' Awesome!! 

OK... lemme just start w/ a story.. so like my new class is on Tuesday nights now, but my parents, 4 some reason, would like not understand this sudden change in schedule w/ school ('cause I just found out that day as well).  So I pretended 2 go 2 class, but in actuality, I had Mondo hours 2 kill in the City considering I'm usually on Campus by 5:30 & class starts @ 6...

So I went 2 Anu & hung out w/ 1/2 of Jet Trash 'cause the other DJ dude wasn't there... hung out for like an hour... then all of a sudden I decided that walkin' 2 Sub Lounge sounded like a Groovy idea.. hmmmm.. 

After almost an hour of walking & talking to some dogs, I was 2 blocks away from Sub Lounge when i realized I had like all these mondo Muni passes & I coulda took Muni instead of walking.. LoL.. Hello 2day...

OK... Jauncy & Sheztek's tag set was Sick... they opened w/ like New School yummy Break Beats, then I dunno.. somewhere along their set came some old skool sounding stuff, then they busted out like these epic-industrial-type-deep-and-dark-melodic (if that's the term) sounding tracks that fuckin' floored me like crazy & i totally creamed when i was dancing =) YAY

oh oh oh oh.,.. so yeah... after like a year ago almost & getting invited 2 his site when it was still beta.. I fiiiiiiiiiinally met DJ Cronos.. This Dude's Awesome!!  his set was Groovy... ok... i know i'm totally lame w/ the House Genre terms... but yeah man.. he was rockin' the decks w/ this Bad Ass Yummy ?Prog? House.. I mean... he went on like after Koromo who totally started out the night playin Prog House also.. I dunno.. but I was seriously DMOA @ like certain moments of those sets!  

Jason Lee was Dope!!  LoL... he hella shocked me when he busted out House also like right after the Breakbeats right b4 him... but he was Sick!!  His house was kinda more deeper than what they wre spinning upstaairs, but it wasn't like deep house house though like all throughout his set from what i remember... but as Jason like started like getting towards the end of his set... I did notic he played more like oh gosh... Hello 2day.. I just like totally remember the last track when it had the South Park Kids like totally talking & shit... it was hella funny.. wiat.. it was South Park.. right?

Mr. Blueshaman & SirNod went on next down in the basement & oh shit.. their set was sick... I mean.. there was everything in there!!  Psy Trance, Techno, Breakbeats, Acid Trance, Oh My Goodness man... than like BlueShaman's closing song was 1 of my favorite Happy Hardcore Songs like ever!!!Oh Yeah!! LoL.. jk.. I dunno who the artist is.. but it's like this really hard Break Beaty song w/ Yummy vocals!!!  Oh Man.. Thank U 4 that song!!!  Loved it!!

Upstairs.. I guess his DJ alias is Floorcraft, but he was pretty Groovy too w/ his house set.. I mean.. i could keep sayin' that all the upstairs DJs were spinning like Prog Prog Prog, but I don't think it was all that though.. I mean... they all threw in there own twists of diff house genres in thier sets!! Gosh man.. it's hard 2 like not diferenciate when Jack's not there... LoL... I know i did hear some Tech House somewhere, & even some sudo disco house also!! LoL  But like Floorcraft... ohyeeah... I mean... I was actually up there like Groovin' 2 his set alot & I swear man... he so smooth with his tracks I noticed in his set!!  I was totally diggin' it man!

JC closed the night upstairs as totally did this mondo bang up job like always!!  LoL it was fun watching him put a record on, mix it in, then walk around the bar & like talk 2 people... LoL... oh yeah.. some did spin a house song that was in a movie...

OK... so it was fun like peoplewise there also!!! Alot family around which was Mondo Groovy! I mean.. seriously.. it was so hard 4 me 2 stay still 'cause there were so many peope I wanted 2 talk 2, all the while I wanted 2 play The Tazmania Devil game by the DJ booth!  Hello 2day, it was confusing.. but it was fun!

Afterwards the bar closed, I hung out w/ Damien (old school SFR kid), Polaris (old school SFR also), & a few other friends as we like galvanted around the City & ending up @ Damiens pad where i was like spinning Jungle 4 an hour in his decks!! LoL  It was an amazing  night & Wow... it was fun fun :P

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: Another dancer departs the scene this Spring

------=_NextPart_000_00B3_01C41E8D.353C9000
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,=20

I have mixed emotions about this, but I am leaving the rave scene and =
the Bay Area. The reason I am all mixed up is that raving is the only =
scene that I ever understood and participated in as an energetic dancer. =


I missed the disco era (too young at the time) and when new wave got =
popular in the 80s, I enjoyed the electronic beats and I went to clubs. =
But it wasn't like raving.

Something happened to me in the 90s while I lived in Houston. I signed =
up for Hraves (their local list) and jumped right into the warehouse =
parties. Jungle was a growing genre in Houston at the time, but I still =
liked the trance. I went to my favorite club a lot, Hyperia, in the =
downtown district near the ballpark. I went to parties every weekend, =
including one at an indoor amusement park and another at an abandoned =
warehouse. Houston did not have outdoor parties because it is too hot =
and sticky (high humidity).=20

When I moved here in 2000 (because of a job offer), I signed up =
immediately and started grooving with this group. And it has been great =
for me. SFraves is full of talented, bright, friendly, and articulate =
people. If I had a business venture I would hire all of you in a flash =
and we would be hugely successful and change existing corporate =
standards.

Now I find that disillusionment has set in with lack of opportunity and =
diminished standards of living, so we sold our house last night and we =
are hitting the road. I cannot leave until escrow closes and until we =
sell all worldly possessions aside from the important personal things =
and transportation. But as soon as the furniture is gone and the new =
guys get the keys, we are following a lifelong dream of travel.=20

The plan is to see the National Parks of the West, along with some =
national forests, state parks, and monuments, and just get away from it =
all in the process. Hence my departure from raving.=20

However, I will be thinking about all of you, and since I need to stay =
fit, I will probably do some raving at my campsite by dancing around the =
Ring of Fire with CDs and plenty of batteries!

I will be in the Bay Area for at least 20 to 30 days more, but I just =
wanted to post this message without disappearing.=20

Sincerely,=20

Greg Van Pelt=20


------=_NextPart_000_00B3_01C41E8D.353C9000--

On Fri, 9 Apr 2004, Greg Van Pelt wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I have mixed emotions about this, but I am leaving the rave scene and the Bay Area. The reason I am all mixed up is that raving is the only scene that I ever understood and participated in as an energetic dancer.
>
> I missed the disco era (too young at the time) and when new wave got popular in the 80s, I enjoyed the electronic beats and I went to clubs. But it wasn't like raving.
>
> Something happened to me in the 90s while I lived in Houston. I signed up for Hraves (their local list) and jumped right into the warehouse parties. Jungle was a growing genre in Houston at the time, but I still liked the trance. I went to my favorite club a lot, Hyperia, in the downtown district near the ballpark. I went to parties every weekend, including one at an indoor amusement park and another at an abandoned warehouse. Houston did not have outdoor parties because it is too hot and sticky (high humidity).
>
> When I moved here in 2000 (because of a job offer), I signed up immediately and started grooving with this group. And it has been great for me. SFraves is full of talented, bright, friendly, and articulate people. If I had a business venture I would hire all of you in a flash and we would be hugely successful and change existing corporate standards.
>
> Now I find that disillusionment has set in with lack of opportunity and diminished standards of living, so we sold our house last night and we are hitting the road. I cannot leave until escrow closes and until we sell all worldly possessions aside from the important personal things and transportation. But as soon as the furniture is gone and the new guys get the keys, we are following a lifelong dream of travel.
>
> The plan is to see the National Parks of the West, along with some national forests, state parks, and monuments, and just get away from it all in the process. Hence my departure from raving.
>
> However, I will be thinking about all of you, and since I need to stay fit, I will probably do some raving at my campsite by dancing around the Ring of Fire with CDs and plenty of batteries!
