From sfraves-return-111783-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Sat Apr 10 21:30:55 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-111783-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 66644 invoked by uid 1103); 10 Apr 2004 21:30:54 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 66630 invoked from network); 10 Apr 2004 21:30:54 -0000
Message-Id: <6.0.3.0.2.20040410142717.024655c0@mail.speakeasy.net>
X-Sender: apollo@mail.speakeasy.net
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.0.3.0
Date: Sat, 10 Apr 2004 14:30:56 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_11576576==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] More Anti-EDM and Live Music Legislation: Take Action

--=====================_11576576==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


Congress is considering legislation that could hold DJs, bands, bartenders, 
promoters, venue owners and others liable if a patron uses drugs at a 
nightclub or concert. If enacted, music lovers could soon be unable to see 
their favorite DJ or band live.

Congress passed the Illicit Drug Anti-Proliferation Act (also known as the 
RAVE Act) last year, making promoters and venue owners liable for the drug 
offenses of their customers (for more information on this law see 
<http://www.protectlivemusic.org/rave_archive.htm>history of the rave act. 
Now Congress is considering two new bills that threaten to effectively ban 
live music and dancing while throwing innocent people in jail.

<http://www.protectlivemusic.org/rave_act_action.htm>Fight Back
Find out what you can do to help fight against these proposed laws

The <http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/bdquery/z?d108:h.r.02962:>Ecstasy 
Awareness Act (H.R. 2962) would throw anyone in jail who "profits 
monetarily from a rave or similar electronic dance event knowing or having 
reason to know" if some of the event-goers use drugs. Similarly, Section 
305 of the 
<http://thomas.loc.gov/cgi-bin/bdquery/z?d108:h.r.00834:>CLEAN-UP Act (H.R. 
834) makes it a federal crime - punishable by up to nine years in prison - 
to promote "any rave, dance, music, or other entertainment event, that 
takes place under circumstances where the promoter knows or reasonably 
ought to know that a controlled substance will be used or distributed."

This makes no sense. Since the government can't even keep drugs out of our 
federal prisons, everyone has reason to know drugs may be used at their 
event. Every music concert attracts some people who may use or sell drugs. 
These provisions make criminals out of every concert promoter, nightclub 
owner, and stadium or arena owner.

The language of the Ecstasy Awareness Act is so broad that bartenders, 
musicians, and anyone else that in any way profited from an electronic 
music event could be fined or jailed. Section 305 of the CLEAN-UP Act is so 
broad that every musical style could be affected, including rock, Hip-Hop, 
country, and electronic music. Indeed, any property owner (including hotel 
owners, cruise ship owners, and casino owners) could be hurt under the 
CLEAN-UP Act, since it is reasonable to assume that any entertainment event 
that draws a large crowd (especially young people) will draw people who 
will try to use or sell drugs. (It should be noted that Section 305 of the 
CLEAN-UP Act is the only section of the bill that is problematic. Other 
than that section, the CLEAN-UP Act is largely a good bill that provides 
resources to train law-enforcement officers how to dismantle illegal 
methamphetamine laboratories without hurting the environment).

Disturbingly, it does not matter under either the Ecstasy Awareness Act or 
the CLEAN-UP Act if event promoters and property owners take steps to deter 
drug offenses. They can be prosecuted even if they have good security and a 
strict zero-tolerance policy. Nor does it matter if the vast majority of 
people attending the event are law-abiding citizens that do not use drugs. 
These bills criminalize entire events and everyone involved in such events, 
raising very serious free speech and due process issues. Racist or 
homophobic prosecutors could also use the laws to target Hip Hop and R&B 
concerts and gay and lesbian nightclubs.

People should not be punished for the crimes of others, nor should the 
government be frightening law-abiding businesses away from holding legal 
events like rock, country, or Hip Hop concerts. The Drug Policy Alliance 
and its coalition of partners will continue to work to protect the music 
industry, prevent the further criminalization of dance and music events, 
and mobilize opposition to these dangerous laws. We need your help:
<http://www.protectlivemusic.org/rave_act_action.htm>See things you can do 
to fight for your right to dance!



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_11576576==.ALT--

location).

the T-mobile "hot spots" and other wireless technology.

travelers.

until the last minute (if necessary), but I would love to post an occasional
remote message. Or, maybe I could write a "blog" (web-based journal),
something I never tried because I worked so much.

>
> I have mixed emotions about this, but I am leaving the rave scene and the
Bay Area. The reason I am all mixed up is that raving is the only scene that
I ever understood and participated in as an energetic dancer.
>
> I missed the disco era (too young at the time) and when new wave got
popular in the 80s, I enjoyed the electronic beats and I went to clubs. But
it wasn't like raving.
>
> Something happened to me in the 90s while I lived in Houston. I signed up
for Hraves (their local list) and jumped right into the warehouse parties.
Jungle was a growing genre in Houston at the time, but I still liked the
trance. I went to my favorite club a lot, Hyperia, in the downtown district
near the ballpark. I went to parties every weekend, including one at an
indoor amusement park and another at an abandoned warehouse. Houston did not
have outdoor parties because it is too hot and sticky (high humidity).
>
> When I moved here in 2000 (because of a job offer), I signed up
immediately and started grooving with this group. And it has been great for
me. SFraves is full of talented, bright, friendly, and articulate people. If
I had a business venture I would hire all of you in a flash and we would be
hugely successful and change existing corporate standards.
>
> Now I find that disillusionment has set in with lack of opportunity and
diminished standards of living, so we sold our house last night and we are
hitting the road. I cannot leave until escrow closes and until we sell all
worldly possessions aside from the important personal things and
transportation. But as soon as the furniture is gone and the new guys get
the keys, we are following a lifelong dream of travel.
>
> The plan is to see the National Parks of the West, along with some
national forests, state parks, and monuments, and just get away from it all
in the process. Hence my departure from raving.
>
> However, I will be thinking about all of you, and since I need to stay
fit, I will probably do some raving at my campsite by dancing around the
Ring of Fire with CDs and plenty of batteries!
>
> I will be in the Bay Area for at least 20 to 30 days more, but I just
wanted to post this message without disappearing.
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Greg Van Pelt
>
>


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] non fictional work...the spirit of easter season nrr

--0-307071777-1081801647=:78110
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

hello, today we are working on a non-fictional piece meant to uplife the spirit and the soul....we are great fans of non-fiction, however, we enjoy writing fiction more than non-fictional essays...in light of the spiritual season that continues to hover over us, we chose on this day to consider and continue the solemnity of the time of year:
 
what does easter mean to you? to some, it means candy and easter egg hunts. to some, it means going to church with large crowds, and to some, it means participating in a smaller community gathering, but it is always a day of contemplation nontheless. if you are a candy eater, perhaps today is the day to break off from the candy and just sit quietly...quietly in silent contemplation. your belief system need not interfere. you can believe in nothing or no one, but to sit in silence is pretty deadly lonely. thank you. :)

Subject: [sfraves] FYI...NEDMC Registration has begun!

--0-178437262-1081823447=:68495
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

For those interested...
 


Erica Johnson <erica@justsayagency.com> wrote:


st1\:*{behavior:url(#default#ieooui) }
***The National Electronic Dance Music Conference*** 

 

http://www.nedmc.com

 

***New registration fees online***

 

Early registration specials are online and available until April 30th.

 

Regular registration-Reg. $275 Until April 30th- $210

Economy/Student registration-Reg. $150 Until April 30th- $110

 

8x10 Exhibit booth- Reg. $1500 Until April 30th- $1150

8x20 Exhibit booth- Reg. $2250 Until April 30th- $2000

 

We have also included new options for those wanting to attend or participate in the NEDMC. Check out the website for more info.

 

  Please visit http://www.nedmc.com/seminarshtml for information regarding our seminars and panels.

 

  In Washington D.C. on September 3rd through 6th 2004, the National EDM Conference will take place at the Omni Shoreham Hotel. We will be utilizing the entire space of the hotel to bring you the best possible environment to network with others in the EDM industry. We will be hosting all genres, from hip hop to hardcore, from house to industrial. As well, we will also be showcasing the newest technologies for the coming year and beyond, as well as offering seminars and focus groups to help dj's, producers, and gear manufacturer's push the envelope of music production and presentation.

 

  We have chosen D.C. to host this event because it is a central location on the east coast, offering easy access from many spots around the country, as well as being home to one of the nations largest EDM focused communities. We will be working closely with all businesses involved to ensure top notch production on all sides for after hours events, as well as demonstrations of said products. There will be also attendee only events, so be sure to sign up early to gain access to these events, held exclusively in the hotel.

 

  If you are interested in speaking on a panel or having your company host a seminar, please email seminars@nedmc.com

 

  To stay up to date on all the happenings of the NEDMC, including seminar information, hotel and registration discounts, and event information, please visit http://www.nedmc.com/contact.html

 

  For further information on either sponsoring, exhibiting, attending, or hosting an official event, please email info@nedmc.com , or visit our site at http://www.nedmc.com .

 

  If you would like to help out with the NEDMC, please e-mail work@nedmc.com for intern and volunteering opportunites. 

 

  For booking consideration, please send all cd's to: 

NEDMC Booking

4331 Farm House Lane

Farifax, VA 22032

 


http://www.nedmc.com
The National Electronic Dance Music Conference
P.O. Box 3616
Fairfax, VA 22038
O:703-503-1020
F:703-503-1269
info@nedmc.com

 

 

 

 

Erica Johnson

erica@nedmc.com 

www.nedmc.com

443.985.0581

AIM: JustSayErica

--0-674190967-1081890050=:58915

Same here... I keep getting "failed delivery" notices, which means someone on this list is infected with netsky or beagle or some email spoofing worm/virus, which is using my email to attack others. Id recommend everyone run this netsky removal tool if they're not sure if they have it or not..
 
http://securityresponse.symantec.com/avcenter/FxNetsky.exe
 
... keep in mind some AV progs wont find netsky and some others if you're not in safe mode (MS winblows users).
 
Tof

********************************************
San Francisco Late Night needs your help.

Last Call at 4am will bring needed visitors from the surrounding towns
to keep our night life culture alive. Last Call at 4am will shine a
beacon on San Francisco's late night scene that will be seen around
the world. Last Call at 4am means more money, more jobs and more
fun.

And, according to the Traffic Safety Administration, even safer roads 
(see < <http://www.SFLNC.com>> for statistics.)

But, we need you help!

The hearing on the Last Call at 4am is scheduled for Monday April 19th
at 9am in Sacramento.

We need 100 people to be at that hearing. Not all will speak, only a 
few, but we need you.

Yes folks, it could be this simple, 100 people meet at the End Up (401 6th St. at Harrison St.) at 6am on Monday morning (April 19th) for complimentary coffee, Red Bull and Krispy Kremes. Then on to the bus we go. You will be given buttons and badges to wear. Everything will be done for you, but you need to show up.

So far I only have 37 people and I need 100.

I have a bus.

I have coffee and Krispy Kremes.

I have Red Bull.

I need people!

Forward this email everywhere you think folks will respond. Time is 
running out.

REMEMBER! With your support, anything is possible!

Email questions and offers to:terrance@SFLNC.com

Terrance Alan
Chairman
San Francisco Late Night Coalition

From sfraves-return-111809-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed Apr 14 01:04:12 2004

Received: (qmail 7822 invoked by uid 1103); 14 Apr 2004 01:04:11 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 7808 invoked from network); 14 Apr 2004 01:04:11 -0000
X-pair-Authenticated: 24.5.226.120
Message-Id: <6.0.0.22.2.20040413180942.02ebbe38@mail.sarilion.org>
X-Sender: foo2@mail.sarilion.org
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.0.0.22
Date: Tue, 13 Apr 2004 18:13:55 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Sarilion <sarilion@sarilion.org>
In-Reply-To: <20040413210050.60425.qmail@web10903.mail.yahoo.com>
References: <20040413102520.29414.h012.c021.wm@mail.viberation.com.criticalpath.net>
 <20040413210050.60425.qmail@web10903.mail.yahoo.com>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii; format=flowed; x-avg-checked=avg-ok-708026EC
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Masking my email address

they don't have to be on the list, and they're not using your address*.

what's happening is that someone with your email address in their address 
book is infected, and their machine is spewing out email to try and 
spread  the virus.

the mail delivery failure isn't real - the virus writers are using the 
tactic to get you to open to email.  In MS Outlook, opening the mail may be 
all it takes to infect the machine.

* You can prove this be deleting the email address, or changing the 
password - the infected emails will still arrive bearing your email address.


sarilion

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

My guess - more of us honkies spinning than anyone else???

It could also be that lots of people might be from another culture/ethnic 
background, but not look it.

There are lots of Spaniards who look white, but aren't. Plenty of folks from 
South of The Border that have the same issue going on. Shit - I had a 
roomate straight from Chihuahua Mexico, and no one could tell he was Mexican 
until they heard him speak.

Honestly though, I could care less if the DJ is from mars and has twenty 
boobies on his/her head - I just wanna hear good music.

M-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Dj Diversity

you know you'll never be 'open minded' if you keep bringing up the color of
people's skins. The only way to move past racism is to not make it an issue.
Do racism exist? sure. Does you trying to invoke affirmative action on the
dj community do anything to help other's stop judinging based on color? no.
The irony of these 'multi-cultural' people astound me; They are the first
ones to judge based on color.

stay home because the dj is black? Or, Chinese?  Am I still O§by's friend
even though he doesn't look like my twin? Hell ya. DJ Bam rocks me as hard
as Calamity Jane who rocks me as hard as Koroma. As long as I am groovin'
they could be purple for all I care. And if a dj sucks, do you think the
first thing I say is 'man, they must suck 'cause they ain't white'. lol I'm
sure. They could have down syndrome, or be missing an ear, of maybe gay, OMG
;) I don't think me going to see a DJ is directly dependant on what they
look like. But then again I am a white/heterosexual/conservative what do I
know?

Although the one thing I do hate...lol, this is good, is the hot chicks that
spin topless, man oh man, how do you comepte with that? Would ya'll come see
me if I spun topless?

Received: (qmail 78655 invoked from network); 14 Apr 2004 20:47:37 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [64.95.54.69]
X-Originating-Email: [nesound@hotmail.com]
X-Sender: nesound@hotmail.com
From: "Gavin Varitech" <nesound@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Wed, 14 Apr 2004 13:47:34 -0700
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <BAY1-F74wow48GUYiSA0003fa76@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 14 Apr 2004 20:47:35.0219 (UTC) FILETIME=[B717F830:01C42261]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] Dj Diversity

It could be a few things...

1.) What parties you are going to? If you're hitting up all trance/nrg/hhc 
shows you're probably not going to see much diversity.

2.) I feel you and can tell you that it is somewhat unique to the Bay Area. 
Let's not forget that house & techno were both born in Black clubs. And the 
fact is, the deejays and clubbers involved in those pioneering days were 
hardly diverse (when it comes to ethnicity that is). If you travel, you'll 
see the diversity (ethinc, cultural, and otherwise) of both the artists and 
the people on the floor. Especially in the midwest (& Texas), parts of 
Canada (Montreal, Toronto), as well as in New York & the New England area. 
And that's just here in the US. Places like London are on a whole nother' 
level (but how many places in the world are like London?).

It seems to me that in today's Bay Area, kids are segregating themselves 
into what they are "supposed" to be into. So it's not going to be all that 
diverse. They say that the Bay Area is so culturaly diverse, but is it 
really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because there are 
so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really diverse if 
everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?

If you are only talking about the rave/club circut-traveling headliner 
deejay then it might be because certian areas producing these deejays are 
predominantly one ethnicity and/or culture. If you look at the population, 
the globe-trotting deejay world is actually more diverse than many of the 
cities that they come from. As well as the dancefloors they play for.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-Deejay Gavin Varitech
(916) 733-1615 - Bookings/info
(916) 412-3313 - Contact
www.techwesttribe.com

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Detroit Re: [sfraves] Dj Diversity

The funny thing is (sorry I don't have time to read this whole thread but am 
still tossing in my 2 cents anyway) in the Detroit rave scene circa 
1995-2000, the party kids were overwhelmingly white (typically leaving their 
suburban homes to drive the 10-80 miles to Detroit), partying in areas which 
where overwhelmingly black, and the djs were often black as well (often from 
detroit or chicago).

Detroit really is as bad as you think, many burned and/or abandoned house, 
the great white flight decades ago after the riots, etc. - all the more 
apparent when you pack 2000 white kids into a warehouse in a black 
neighborhood, with the only black person in the room is the dj.

The bay area ROCKS!  I could never go back to Michigan for good... too much 
sameness is so BORING.  Another biggest difference - Detroit has some dope 
dancers, but its too competitive - people stand around and nod to techno 
alot - people dance here!

We are all so lucky to live in the Bay Area, to be open-minded, diverse, and 
know that we aren't the freakin' minority in our views... who cares what we 
all look like on the outside, yeah?

On that note, the Detroit Electronic Music Fest is the absolute best time to 
go to Michigan - everyone turns out for it, so much positivity (and 1.5 
million peeps!) - movementfestival.com

Anyone going to the breaks at Shadow Lounge thursday night?  if so say hi!

wow, that's the most i've posted on here in months.

Becky

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: SFR Virus BS!

On Wed, 14 Apr 2004, aK wrote:
> did you want me to just give you copies of ones with sfr addies ? Or also
> ones we think may be related to sfr (like if I had an address that was only
> used for sfr, which was recieveing viruses, but not necessarily from
> recognizable members)?

Just fwd: me the original mail w/ full headers and virus, if it's from
someone who is or was on the SFR list. I probably can't fix anything, but
I can at least figure out what the virus and most common variants are.

> yknow, one weird one. . .is from nrgn@hotmail.com
> the message says---
> ----------------------
> If the message will not displayed automatically,
> follow the link to read the delivered message.
>
> Received message is available at:
> www.hard-grooves.com/inbox/ak/read.php?sessionid-32084 -----------------

That is probably the Netsky virus, maybe this variant:

http://www.trendmicro.com/vinfo/virusencyclo/default5.asp?VName=WORM_NETSKY.P&VSect=T

Here's Microsoft's acknowledgement of the exploit:

http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/MS01-020.mspx

In general, (esp. if you're using Windows) make sure you have proper Virus
detection software, and install patches for known Micro$oft
vulnerabilities.

 -terry

>From: "Gavin Varitech" <nesound@hotmail.com>
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: RE: [sfraves] Dj Diversity
>Date: Wed, 14 Apr 2004 13:47:34 -0700
>
>It could be a few things...
>
>1.) What parties you are going to? If you're hitting up all trance/nrg/hhc 
>shows you're probably not going to see much diversity.
>
>2.) I feel you and can tell you that it is somewhat unique to the Bay Area. 
>Let's not forget that house & techno were both born in Black clubs. And the 
>fact is, the deejays and clubbers involved in those pioneering days were 
>hardly diverse (when it comes to ethnicity that is). If you travel, you'll 
>see the diversity (ethinc, cultural, and otherwise) of both the artists and 
>the people on the floor. Especially in the midwest (& Texas), parts of 
>Canada (Montreal, Toronto), as well as in New York & the New England area. 
>And that's just here in the US. Places like London are on a whole nother' 
>level (but how many places in the world are like London?).
>
>It seems to me that in today's Bay Area, kids are segregating themselves 
>into what they are "supposed" to be into. So it's not going to be all that 
>diverse. They say that the Bay Area is so culturaly diverse, but is it 
>really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because there 
>are so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really diverse if 
>everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?
>
>If you are only talking about the rave/club circut-traveling headliner 
>deejay then it might be because certian areas producing these deejays are 
>predominantly one ethnicity and/or culture. If you look at the population, 
>the globe-trotting deejay world is actually more diverse than many of the 
>cities that they come from. As well as the dancefloors they play for.
>
>

>-Deejay Gavin Varitech

>(916) 412-3313 - Contact

> > >really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because 
>there
> > >are so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really diverse

> > >everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?

Subject: [sfraves] •| MAY DAY! Saturday, May 1st 2004! $5 Presales • ALL AGES • 8pm-4am!  [bsp]

Liquidvinyldjs.com is very proud to present..


• MAY DAY! •
Saturday, May 1st 2004
8:00pm - 4:00am
500 Person Capacity
1 ROOM VIRGIN LOCATION - Centrally located in the Bay Area!
ALL RESPONSIBLE AGES WELCOME!


With MAY DAY!, we would like to celebrate the beginnings of Summer with a 
very intimate 1 room experience! Join us as we kick the summer of just right 
in a

brand new location, close to everyone here in the Bay Area!


DJ's for the night:


|| DJ LUNA-C
[Kniteforce North American Tour || KFA/Kniteforce, UK] - SPECIAL BIRTHDAY 
SET!!
We are very proud to bring DJ LUNA-C to the Bay for his special Birthday 
Set. This will be the last stop on his very exclusive Kniteforce North 
American

Tour, and this night just happens to be on his birthday! He's coming 
prepared to showcase a very special set exclusive to us here in San 
Francisco, which is

sure to absolutely blow you away. If you've seen LUNA-C at any of our past 
events, you know he will completely take the roof off the place and have you

moving, from the first record to the last! Please allow us to wish our good 
friend a very Happy Birthday here in the Bay!

|| CLOUDSKIPPER vs. THE NICE GUYS
[Raw Elements/Kniteforce/Liquidvinyldjs.com vs. Liquidvinyldjs.com/K-12] - 
3X6 INSANITY SET!
In what is sure to be one of the more talked about sets this year, 
Cloudskipper faces off against The Nice Guys. Relatively little is known 
about The Nice

Guys, except, well, they're nice. In any case, be prepared for in your face 
up front hardcore, a lot of unreleased music, as well as onstage antics that 
can

only be described as pure madness!

|| DJ TRONIC
[Resistance Recordings/Liquidvinyldjs.com/CHR]
In preparation for his anticipated European tour, Tronic's set is going to 
be chalked full of brand new hard hittin material! This will be his last 
local

appearance before he heads off to Europe for 2 weeks, so be ready for the 
Hard Beats!

|| MAJERE
[Elektrosorcery, DJMajere.com] - SPECIAL TRANCECORE/FREEFORM SET!
In a rare appearance playing trancecore/freeform, Majere is taking a bit of 
a step back into his roots. Expect a set of fast and hard mind melting 
music,

which can only be appreciated by those ready to move!

|| THE DOCTOR & MC FADER
[Liquidvinyldjs.com/Bayraves.com || Gravitycrew.com/Emceeds]
Quite possibly one of the best DnB/Jungle DJ's in Northern California, The 
Doctor has become a household name. You can catch him almost every weekend 
droppin

those hard hittin tracks all over! In tow is the MC called Fader, in which 
really needs no introduction. These two go together like steak and eggs, 
like

butter on toast, like.. well you get the idea!

|| DJ J-MARR
[Liquidvinyldjs.com/Bayraves.com] - FAREWELL SET!
The man, the myth, the legend. Need we say more? Known from up and down the 
West Coast for not only his music, but also his energetic charisma, J-Marr 
is a

legend in the scene. This will be his last set behind the decks, ending a 
tenure other DJ's can only dream about. Be there to witness J-Marr rocking 
in his

usual manner, for the last time!

|| CARLOS ALFONZO vs. RECLIPSE
[Resistance Recordings/Soop Recordings vs. D&A Music/Bayraves]
The battle of the BBQ Iron Chef Carlos and the Maddest Mad DJ around, this 
will be a treat to all those who appreciated hard techno... and we do mean 
HARD.

These two will come out swingin' with pure dancefloor driven material.. get 
ready to rock!

|| LEON COOK vs. PETER GO-ZANIA!
[Hardscience/Logik Pro Audio]
These two have been rapidly rising among the Hardcore faithful here in the 
Bay, and with their crowd rockin performances and talent behind the decks, 
it's

really no wonder why. Expect a set full of freeform and upfront Hardcore 
material only these guys bring to the table.

|| DJ DMS
[Oakland Bounce/Dream Crew]


>From the same people who brought you HAPPY TOGETHER 1 & 2, OVERLOAD 1, 2, & 
3, SUMMER ROCKIN, and GET UP!. MAY DAY will be an extremely special night to 
us,

where we are celebrating the coming of summer, as well as our good friend 
LUNA-C's birthday. If you've loved the vibe and sharing of the music we've 
had at

past events, this will be no different!!


MAY DAY SOUND PROVIDED BY: HARDSCIENCE
MAY DAY VISUALS & LASERS PROVIDED BY: STIMULIGHTS.COM


VERY LIMITED $5 Presale Tickets will go on sale Wednesday, March 31st at the 
following locations:

SKILLS DJ WORKSHOP  |    BERKELEY   |  510.704.9876
SOLID GROOVES       |  SANTA CLARA  |  408.248.6399
FREQUENCY 8         | SAN FRANCISCO |  415.221.4142
STRAIGHT HITS       |    FREMONT    |  510.745.7843
IN THA MIX          |   SACRAMENTO  |  916.442.0499
ONLINE              |  http://www.groovetickets.com

Once those $5 Presales sell out, they will go to $10. Once those $10 tickets 
sell out, we will have tickets at the door for $15! All of our previous 
events

have sold out, and we don't expect this to be different! Make sure you get a 
presale ticket for guaranteed entry!

Giveaways from most of the DJ's playing! CD's, Vinyl, T-Shirts, maybe even 
some dishes! ;)

If you've enjoyed our events in the past, this will be no different! Don't 
miss out on MAY DAY!! Thank you and we appreciate your support!

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



'Get Your Praise On'

At these new booze-free nightclubs, DJs spin and patrons shake in the name 
of Jesus Christ. No dirty dancing allowed:


http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/4710900/




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_2803340==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] dj Babu, Re: [sfraves] Dj Diversity

That was dj Babu of Dialated Peoples (a sic dj) and he was not talking
about dj culture, he was talking about pop culture in general.

he was saying that djaying is one of the only places where filipinos were
really famous in pop culture as opposed to say movies tv politics etc.

correct me if i'm wrong.

with love,
Jonas, a mexican dj btw

>> > I'm not on the attack here. simply stating an observation and getting
>> > feedback. not whining and pushings.
>> > djchic09

>> >
>> > >From: "Gavin Varitech" <nesound@hotmail.com>

>>trance/nrg/hhc
>> > >shows you're probably not going to see much diversity.

>>Area.
>> > >Let's not forget that house & techno were both born in Black clubs.
>> And
>>the
>> > >fact is, the deejays and clubbers involved in those pioneering days
>>were
>> > >hardly diverse (when it comes to ethnicity that is). If you travel,
>>you'll
>> > >see the diversity (ethinc, cultural, and otherwise) of both the
>> artists
>>and
>> > >the people on the floor. Especially in the midwest (& Texas), parts
>> of
>> > >Canada (Montreal, Toronto), as well as in New York & the New England
>>area.
>> > >And that's just here in the US. Places like London are on a whole
>>nother'
>> > >level (but how many places in the world are like London?).
>> > >

>>themselves
>> > >into what they are "supposed" to be into. So it's not going to be all
>>that
>> > >diverse. They say that the Bay Area is so culturaly diverse, but is
>> it
>> > >really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because
>>there
>> > >are so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really
>> diverse
>>if
>> > >everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?
>> > >
>> > >If you are only talking about the rave/club circut-traveling
>> headliner
>> > >deejay then it might be because certian areas producing these deejays
>>are
>> > >predominantly one ethnicity and/or culture. If you look at the
>>population,
>> > >the globe-trotting deejay world is actually more diverse than many of
>>the
>> > >cities that they come from. As well as the dancefloors they play for.
>> > >

>>From: "Gavin Varitech" <nesound@hotmail.com>
>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>Subject: RE: [sfraves] Dj Diversity
>>Date: Wed, 14 Apr 2004 13:47:34 -0700
>>
>>It could be a few things...
>>
>>1.) What parties you are going to? If you're hitting up all trance/nrg/hhc 
>>shows you're probably not going to see much diversity.
>>
>>2.) I feel you and can tell you that it is somewhat unique to the Bay 
>>Area. Let's not forget that house & techno were both born in Black clubs. 
>>And the fact is, the deejays and clubbers involved in those pioneering 
>>days were hardly diverse (when it comes to ethnicity that is). If you 
>>travel, you'll see the diversity (ethinc, cultural, and otherwise) of both 
>>the artists and the people on the floor. Especially in the midwest (& 
>>Texas), parts of Canada (Montreal, Toronto), as well as in New York & the 
>>New England area. And that's just here in the US. Places like London are 
>>on a whole nother' level (but how many places in the world are like 
>>London?).
>>
>>It seems to me that in today's Bay Area, kids are segregating themselves 
>>into what they are "supposed" to be into. So it's not going to be all that 
>>diverse. They say that the Bay Area is so culturaly diverse, but is it 
>>really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because there 
>>are so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really diverse if 
>>everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?
>>
>>If you are only talking about the rave/club circut-traveling headliner 
>>deejay then it might be because certian areas producing these deejays are 
>>predominantly one ethnicity and/or culture. If you look at the population, 
>>the globe-trotting deejay world is actually more diverse than many of the 
>>cities that they come from. As well as the dancefloors they play for.
>>

>>>From: "Gavin Varitech" <nesound@hotmail.com>
>>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>Subject: RE: [sfraves] Dj Diversity
>>>Date: Wed, 14 Apr 2004 13:47:34 -0700
>>>
>>>It could be a few things...
>>>
>>>1.) What parties you are going to? If you're hitting up all 
>>>trance/nrg/hhc shows you're probably not going to see much diversity.
>>>
>>>2.) I feel you and can tell you that it is somewhat unique to the Bay 
>>>Area. Let's not forget that house & techno were both born in Black clubs. 
>>>And the fact is, the deejays and clubbers involved in those pioneering 
>>>days were hardly diverse (when it comes to ethnicity that is). If you 
>>>travel, you'll see the diversity (ethinc, cultural, and otherwise) of 
>>>both the artists and the people on the floor. Especially in the midwest 
>>>(& Texas), parts of Canada (Montreal, Toronto), as well as in New York & 
>>>the New England area. And that's just here in the US. Places like London 
>>>are on a whole nother' level (but how many places in the world are like 
>>>London?).
>>>
>>>It seems to me that in today's Bay Area, kids are segregating themselves 
>>>into what they are "supposed" to be into. So it's not going to be all 
>>>that diverse. They say that the Bay Area is so culturaly diverse, but is 
>>>it really? Who's actually sharing between many cultures? Just because 
>>>there are so many people here, from all over the globe, is it really 
>>>diverse if everyone (generally) keeps to themselves?
>>>
>>>If you are only talking about the rave/club circut-traveling headliner 
>>>deejay then it might be because certian areas producing these deejays are 
>>>predominantly one ethnicity and/or culture. If you look at the 
>>>population, the globe-trotting deejay world is actually more diverse than 
>>>many of the cities that they come from. As well as the dancefloors they 
>>>play for.
>>>
>>>
>>>-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: SFR Virus BS!


>That is probably the Netsky virus, maybe this variant:
>
>http://www.trendmicro.com/vinfo/virusencyclo/default5.asp?VName=WORM_NETSKY.P&VSect=T
>
>Here's Microsoft's acknowledgement of the exploit:
>
>http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/bulletin/MS01-020.mspx
>
>In general, (esp. if you're using Windows) make sure you have proper Virus
>detection software, and install patches for known Micro$oft
>vulnerabilities.
>
> -terry
>
>  
>
Agreed.  It looks like W32.Netsky.P@mm or Q@mm sending itself to 
everyone in someone's addressbook.

If you don't have virus software and you are running windoze, you can 
check to see if you are infected by doing a search on your C:\ drive for 
"FVProtect.exe."  The virus copies itself to the C:\Windows or C:\WINNT 
directories along with a few others.  If found, run this:

http://securityresponse.symantec.com/avcenter/venc/data/w32.netsky@mm.removal.tool.html

Then buy anti-virus software.  Simple.
-li

>The funny thing is (sorry I don't have time to read this whole thread but 
>am still tossing in my 2 cents anyway) in the Detroit rave scene circa 
>1995-2000, the party kids were overwhelmingly white (typically leaving 
>their suburban homes to drive the 10-80 miles to Detroit), partying in 
>areas which where overwhelmingly black, and the djs were often black as 
>well (often from detroit or chicago).
>
>Detroit really is as bad as you think, many burned and/or abandoned house, 
>the great white flight decades ago after the riots, etc. - all the more 
>apparent when you pack 2000 white kids into a warehouse in a black 
>neighborhood, with the only black person in the room is the dj.
>
>The bay area ROCKS!  I could never go back to Michigan for good... too much 
>sameness is so BORING.  Another biggest difference - Detroit has some dope 
>dancers, but its too competitive - people stand around and nod to techno 
>alot - people dance here!
>
>We are all so lucky to live in the Bay Area, to be open-minded, diverse, 
>and know that we aren't the freakin' minority in our views... who cares 
>what we all look like on the outside, yeah?
>
>On that note, the Detroit Electronic Music Fest is the absolute best time 
>to go to Michigan - everyone turns out for it, so much positivity (and 1.5 
>million peeps!) - movementfestival.com
>
>Anyone going to the breaks at Shadow Lounge thursday night?  if so say hi!

>wow, that's the most i've posted on here in months.

Invasion Begins  April 17th

World, who are engaged in a global war at the time, call a cease-fire to assess 
the alien threat. Shortly after first researching the remains of the ship, a 
shocking discovery was made.. the crew who piloted the starcraft were on

for an invasion. Soon the commission of the SDF-1 project started and shortly 
after the "Project Valkyrie", a variable configuration all-purpose Robotech 
combat system, was introduced . Now it has been nearly 10 years  and the 
Zentraedi have arrived.

>>The funny thing is (sorry I don't have time to read this whole thread but 
>>am still tossing in my 2 cents anyway) in the Detroit rave scene circa 
>>1995-2000, the party kids were overwhelmingly white (typically leaving 
>>their suburban homes to drive the 10-80 miles to Detroit), partying in 
>>areas which where overwhelmingly black, and the djs were often black as 
>>well (often from detroit or chicago).
>>
>>Detroit really is as bad as you think, many burned and/or abandoned house, 
>>the great white flight decades ago after the riots, etc. - all the more 
>>apparent when you pack 2000 white kids into a warehouse in a black 
>>neighborhood, with the only black person in the room is the dj.
>>

>>much sameness is so BORING.  Another biggest difference - Detroit has some 
>>dope dancers, but its too competitive - people stand around and nod to 
>>techno alot - people dance here!
>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Dj Diversity

I have to chime in here. For of you who haven't yet met me, I am half 
white and half black, and I grew up in East Oakland. I don't know if 
it's because of my black half, or because I grew up in a such a diverse 
environment (ethnically, sexually, economically), but I think about 
these things a lot too. I lived in Santa Barbara for 6 years, and I had 
to come back to the Bay Area because I couldn't take the homogeneity of 
SB any longer. Maybe I'm prejudiced, but I do like it when I see someone 
up there who looks different, whatever that might be. I would never 
*not* go see someone because of what they look like, but if I heard of 
jungle party where most or all of the djs were going to be black, for 
example, I would be intrigued and would want to check them out. Hmmm...I 
wonder, if I played up my black half would that get me more gigs? ;-)

Happy

Jack Triumph wrote:

>you know you'll never be 'open minded' if you keep bringing up the color of
>people's skins. The only way to move past racism is to not make it an issue.
>Do racism exist? sure. Does you trying to invoke affirmative action on the
>dj community do anything to help other's stop judinging based on color? no.
>The irony of these 'multi-cultural' people astound me; They are the first
>ones to judge based on color.
>
>Who gives a shit who is playing the records? I mean seriosly am I going to
>stay home because the dj is black? Or, Chinese?  Am I still O§by's friend
>even though he doesn't look like my twin? Hell ya. DJ Bam rocks me as hard
>as Calamity Jane who rocks me as hard as Koroma. As long as I am groovin'
>they could be purple for all I care. And if a dj sucks, do you think the
>first thing I say is 'man, they must suck 'cause they ain't white'. lol I'm
>sure. They could have down syndrome, or be missing an ear, of maybe gay, OMG
>;) I don't think me going to see a DJ is directly dependant on what they
>look like. But then again I am a white/heterosexual/conservative what do I
>know?
>
>Although the one thing I do hate...lol, this is good, is the hot chicks that
>spin topless, man oh man, how do you comepte with that? Would ya'll come see
>me if I spun topless?

I'll admit, I prefer nicely mixed crowds (ethnically and otherwise), but it 
would never be the motivating factor for me goping to a party. The whole 
reason I went to "raves" in the 1st place was due to the largely diverse 
atmosphere.

Subject: [sfraves] .: THE DIRTBOX 2 YEAR : SATURDAY 4/17 : 13+ DJs :.


That's right, we've finally reached two fuckin years of doin the show.
We're celebrating this by rockin out hardcore, special Saturday edition
style.  Peep the lineup (all times EST):

. 06:00pm - Don Vega & Just Charlie
. 07:30pm - Brian Arse
. 09:00pm - Bizar
. 10:00pm - ODJ & Jerel
. 11:00pm - Robot Death Squad (Akasha & Evancipation)
. 12:00am - Hooligan & Shade
. 01:00am - Ransom
. 02:00am - Stamina
. 03:00am - Psykofly
. 04:00am - Afterhours??

We may end up goin mad late, but that'll depend on how crunked we all are
at the end of the night.

Tim Defekt will be out with his vid camera gettin shots of the action, as
well as peeps with cameras, so expect some neat shit up on the site
afterwards, as well as sets from Picklejuice, Stretch, and Dave Nada,
who'll be playing upstairs.

To tune in, simply go to http://dirtboxradio.com/listen.html, or click on
ze linx below:

destroyer.net
128k - http://64.246.60.15:8800/listen.pls

jungletrain.net
64k - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls

webcam - http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

chat - http://jungletrain.net/index.php?page=2&subpage=0&color=2

AIM - DIRTBOXRADIO

It's gonna be a goddamn blast, so y'all should definitely tune in.
Filling in for our slot on JT will be the Essenchal Mekaniks from GA,
biggup to them and SD Shakedown crew for lettin us gank their timeslots on
Saturday.

BOHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

Jackson aka ODJ

Partners in Crime, www.DirtboxRadio.com, Trividual Productions, ALIAS

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: REVIEW: Shadow Lounge....Diversity at it's finest?

------=_NextPart_000_0026_01C4238E.FF3B6FB0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

So OMG, what a diverse and ethnic crowd we had at the 'ol  Shadow lounge =
last night. For those craving the experience of a Bay Area melting pot =
last night was your calling. I showed up at 11 after an interview (to be =
followed up and explained more in a later post) and immediately I a =
tsunami of diversity hit me. There is DJ Bam standing outside welcoming =
all to this event. A brief synopsis of the melting pot that occurred.

1 - There was an Asian dj playing, obviously, Asian-Influenced breaks.
2 - A Nice Japanese man bought me a beer
3 - I saw 2 lesbians dancing
4 - A black, sorry African American, Man served me, but I am not sure =
that counts as it could be construed as the man keeping him down
5 - I think I saw a gay dude, but I didn't want to "pre-judge" him, so I =
never asked
6 - A Samoan was working the door, but see #4
7 - Ossby was there and that has to count for something despite his =
obviously Caucasian tendencies ;)
8 - The toilet paper and towels in the restroom were derived from a =
recycled Tongan tree that has been re-used at least 3 generations to =
date.
9 - And to top it off I parked near Stud, so again, a wealth of =
diversity smacked ol' Jackie in the head.

But you know what sucks, I was sooo busy trying to make sure I was being =
diverse, I totally missed all the choons. :(

(for those that haven't been following this little post, lighten up, I =
am being sarcastic ;) ) jack out.

PS - Bam, can I get a witness?

PPS - Overall great event, and damn if they don't seriously bang out the =
breaks. Good beer too...mmm.
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught
_____________________________________
"I saw an Angel in the Marble,=20
and carved until I set him free"
- Michelangelo

jack@jacktriumph.com
www.jacktriumph.com

Yahoo: Jack_Triumph

Subject: RE: [sfraves] ATP: REVIEW: Shadow Lounge....Diversity at it's finest?

If I may vent for a second (and hijack the thread)....

So my car not only is a big ol' piece of shit, but the tags are dead, and 
until I can get the car working properly again, I can't register it - which 
leaves me more or less sans transportation for the time being. This is the 
main reason I missed out on Shadow Lounge last night (and I am seriously 
peeved cuz I was really looking forward to getting out last night). I'm not 
so stupid that I'm going to go driving illegally, and I didn't want to BART 
down, only to either A. get stick in the city w/o a ride, or B. go down for 
an hour than turn around and go home - that's just a tease.

Does anyone know of any decent and REASONABLY priced places in the East Bay 
to get a car fixed??? I just need 1 of my 4 valves to be un-stuck, and get 
the car ready for emissions. Not a ton of work. I don't even need a full 
valve job - just to un-stick the stuck valve. The car isn't worth having the 
the valves re-machined.

Anyhoo - that's why I wasn't out @ Shadow Lounge.

Just to cover my bases now  - if **ANYONE FROM THE EAST BAY**  is going out 
next week to Shadow Lounge for Xhale, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD PLEASE LET ME RIDE 
WITH YOU!!!! I will pay for bridge toll and a few drinks!!!!!!!

*sigh*

Hopefully I can make it down to Progression tonight - if I don't get out 
this weekend, I'll scream.

:)


Marc-losing-his-mind(O)

So I can barely contain my excitement and must share it with all of you. =
I had mentioned that I came from an interview before I headed to Shadow =
Lounge. The interview was part of the this huge news....I have had 3 of =
my mixset's accepted by ThumpRadio and on April 23/24 Jack is headed =
Nationwide. The interview will obviously be chopped up and edited to be =
played during my mixes...it was to say the least an awesome experience. =
I am so excited and at the end having to do a lot of the station =
identifications was probably the highlight of week, if not 2004. So if =
you are ever in Dallas, of Philly, or Orlando and you hear "This is Jack =
Triumph representing ProgressionSF and when I am in Seattle (or insert =
city here) and I listen to the only station that matter's nine three =
three" ... THAT'S ME!

So sorry to ramble but I am just soo damn happy. So for all you local =
heads you can catch me:

April 24th, Saturday,on Alice/ThumpRadio 97.3 @ Midnight
..I have no idea what mix they are going to play or what parts of the =
interview you will hear, but it will be good. I am thinking about maybe =
throwing a little "listening party" at my house, so if you are =
interested let me know. Maybe like an open deck, beer/sausage thing, but =
I am not sure.

For those who might be traveling, or have relatives elsewhere I will be =
on:
San Diego CA. - 4/23  | Friday | Channel 933  |  1am
Hartford CT. - 4/23 | Kiss 95.7 | 1am

.more to follow but so far, that is the schedule for April...and in May =
I will be on Channel 80 XM Radio all month.=20

Interested in what you might hear? Come check out myself and the rest of =
the progression crew, tonight, with special guest Jeffrey Allen at =
26Mix.
http://www.jacktriumph.com/progression/
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught

from a long list. Thanks for contributing to the national homogenization
of radio, Jack!

email you send with "ATP"? It's kind of redundant, considering we can
all see who sent the email by looking at the "From" field.

thursdays is the epitome of a diverse community.  and hey, we didn't even

down the walls dividing us all and kills all "-isms" that seperate us.

can ya dig it?  i knew you could.

and seriously, thanks to everyone who made it out.  mr. jack triumph, erik 
to tha konkers, osby, becky-ravah-luv and amber, rashida-audio angel, 
spinner, ms. leslie ayers, and all the heads i saw bobbing to the breaks (or 
was it the beer?).

props go out to DJ M.O.D., Doubleday and Influence for taking us from 
progressive to nu skool to dark and dirty beats.  to my homeboy Aaron Jae of 
Evil Breaks.  to Pam and the Shadow Lounge crew.

every thursday.  always breaks. you want to come.

-------------
< Brandon / DJ Bam >

DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
http://www.invibe.com/bam

Download the new mix online!
-------------




>From: "Jack Triumph" <jacktriumph@hotmail.com>
>Reply-To: "Jack Triumph" <jacktriumph@hotmail.com>
>To: "SFRaves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: [sfraves] ATP: REVIEW: Shadow Lounge....Diversity at it's finest?
>Date: Fri, 16 Apr 2004 08:44:14 -0700
>
>So OMG, what a diverse and ethnic crowd we had at the 'ol  Shadow lounge 
>last night. For those craving the experience of a Bay Area melting pot last 
>night was your calling. I showed up at 11 after an interview (to be 
>followed up and explained more in a later post) and immediately I a tsunami 
>of diversity hit me. There is DJ Bam standing outside welcoming all to this 
>event. A brief synopsis of the melting pot that occurred.
>
>1 - There was an Asian dj playing, obviously, Asian-Influenced breaks.
>2 - A Nice Japanese man bought me a beer
>3 - I saw 2 lesbians dancing
>4 - A black, sorry African American, Man served me, but I am not sure that 
>counts as it could be construed as the man keeping him down
>5 - I think I saw a gay dude, but I didn't want to "pre-judge" him, so I 
>never asked
>6 - A Samoan was working the door, but see #4
>7 - Ossby was there and that has to count for something despite his 
>obviously Caucasian tendencies ;)
>8 - The toilet paper and towels in the restroom were derived from a 
>recycled Tongan tree that has been re-used at least 3 generations to date.
>9 - And to top it off I parked near Stud, so again, a wealth of diversity 
>smacked ol' Jackie in the head.
>
>But you know what sucks, I was sooo busy trying to make sure I was being 
>diverse, I totally missed all the choons. :(
>
>(for those that haven't been following this little post, lighten up, I am 
>being sarcastic ;) ) jack out.
>
>PS - Bam, can I get a witness?
>
>PPS - Overall great event, and damn if they don't seriously bang out the 
>breaks. Good beer too...mmm.
>--

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 16 Apr 2004 18:27:46.0337 (UTC) FILETIME=[83C1A910:01C423E0]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] ATP: ?

Alright I have got this before. Let me breakdown ATP for whatever it is
worth; Little history lesson into Jack's mind. When I first started posting
to SFR, there wasn't exactly an instruction manual on Post "prefixes", i.e.
NRR: BSP: SRR:, etc, etc, . That being said one of the first people I
befriended was a Mr. Nick Adams, who some of you may or may not know. I met
Nick via SFR and he rode shotgun with me one night out to a beach rave that
I was playing in Jenner, where I also befriended a gentleman by the name of
Mykrokozm, who doesn't post very much on SFR anymore.

All that being said, Jenner is pretty far, which gave Nick and I quite a bit
of time to get to know one and other. During the drive of course SFR came
up, since that was our initial common bond, and I asked him to explain what
all these different prefixes were. He obliged; at some point we were talking
about mixing and promoting and general EDM whatnots and I said "wouldn't it
be cool if people adopted personal prefixes to help personalize their posts.
We had a good laugh and that would be cool. So ATP was born.

ATP = Another Triumph Post.

So whether you think it is the lamest or coolest thing ever, I dig it. Just
helps me add a little "jackie touch" to my posts. If it bother's you well,
and not to be a d*ck, life's rough and this certainly won't be the hardest
obstacle you will ever have to tackle, lol. Think if it like my own little
emoticon. I encourage everyone to express themselves as they see fit. I
consider myself a creative person and I think language, communication itself
is a great thing. I study Latin, German and just about any other piece of
interesting tidbit I can get my hands on, in regards to how people
communicate their ideas. If you have seen my album titles you will see I
spare no expense ;)

When I first started doing this, Michael Red-Stickman (another great friend
I met on SFR), used to mess with me and change it to: APT, obviously a pun
on Apartment. Actually I am just guessing, I have no idea what he meant by
it, but it was all in good fun.

So you asked, and that is the honest truth. 'nuff said?

PS - I didn't realize I was this important; ya'll are making me blush...
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught
_____________________________________
"I saw an Angel in the Marble,
and carved until I set him free"
- Michelangelo

jack@jacktriumph.com
www.jacktriumph.com

AIM: DJJackTriumph
Yahoo: Jack_Triumph
MSN: jacktriumph@hotmail.com

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: underground basswaves - 04-24-2004

Breaks & Techno

Basswaves
4-24-2004

Heavy pounding basswaves along bayshore are an early warning sign that
underground basswaves are approaching on 4-24-2004.  Swell causing heavy
springtime booty-shaking on bayshore could have its origin in the
underground basswaves.  The party people were very astute when it came to
finding basswaves booty-shaking action.

Underground explorers and guides:

JC
Pauly Vinyl
Jeff Richmond
Konkers
Kabal
El Juan

DJ Davoud
Origami
Red Stickman
Ms Meliss
Harken

Sound: Coldfriction and Soundwaves
Light: Shock Therapy and Crystal Chroma
Artwork, Decoration, Refreshment: Basswaves and Friends

Call 415.820.1546 day of event for directions.
All-night / in-doors

The event capacity is limited to 200 tickets total:
$8 pre-sale via paypal (tickets@basswaves.com)
$10 at the door

www.basswaves.com

Subject: [sfraves] OK.. Thursday Night Random Adventures

OK... so like I ended up like stayin' home a lil' longer than anticipated 'cause i was like suppose 2 B @ school early 2 take some tests, but damn man.. there was this episode of Angel I was getting in2 that i haven't seen b4.. so yeah..

But when i got 2 the Embarcadero Station & made my way up the escaltor... it was trippy man... I heard my name like yelled out loud & it kinda scared me... Oh Shit.. it was Alex Van Dune!!!  Hello 2day... WTF!  So him & I talked 4 like 15 mintues about what's what & all that.. Lol.. then i went 2 school...

Got 2 school & like lab was closed, then somehow I ended up in the class where my old classmates are in now & watch them do oral presents... LoL... 

Anywaze... lab opened up again & liike I went in but was 2 lazy 2 do any tests.. so i left school & walk from China Basin to SOMA... it was a nice walk like talkin' 2 well.. I was talkin' 2 dogs again...

Shadow Lounge was closed still so i ended up like walkin' over 2 Butter. on the way there I really had 2 go pee & I went in2 some random bar, Heeeeeeeello 2DAy... it was this gay bar... LoL... but it was CooL... Some guy offered me a ciggy & said we shuld smoke in the smoking room in the back.. ok.. so i went... then yeah... the back room was actually the naked room LoL.. 'cause there was a naked man smokin' ciggies yeah... Ooooooooooookay

So I went 2 Butter.. OK.. YUMMY BREAK ACTION goin on in there.. LoL... It was fun.. DJ D was there & we kicked it 4 a bit.. then i got a Red Bull from 1 of my fave bartenders @ Butter.. Fun stuff.. we talked 4 a bit & he gave me some dl info about well.. stuff...

Then I went 2 DNA & made ammends w/ 1 of the bouncers who 86ed me like last year 4 bein' 2 hyper.. LoL... But yeah.. it was MEAT @ DNA.. so that was kinda Groovy.. they had like this really Hard Dark Trance music goin on which was fun... & the people there were all Goth... the host of the night was wearin a bloddy apron & there were like Chains hangin from the ceiling & this like "meat" theme.. it was fun!!

Then i went over 2 Shadow Lounge again... still now open.. I bumped in2 Araya while was walkin' 2 the store & we hung out 4 a while... it was fun!!  Went 2 her friends house 4 a bit & it turns out that her friend Matt is moving 2 Japan!!

OK.. finally went back 2 Shadow Lounge & it was open... I mean.. there were these YaYa Clubbie girls who were annoying as fuck there... la la la

But it was fun.. toooooootally fun man...

DJs:

I dunno who was spinning, but BB = Brakbeats, OK??

So BB DJ1 was spinning a nice opening set 2 warm up the night.. He spun alot ummmmm... I wanna say old skool tracks.. but they weren't really, but man.. he totally got off this 1 time doin' some Yummy Scratching!!! =)

BB DJ2 was Awesome.. oh man... he played some harder tracks as his set went on.. YUMMY!! & it was sick!!  There was a brief pause in music 2 sing Happy Birthday 2 someone... Jeff... who I met b4 like a few times I think.. OK.. & the fuckin' BDAY cake was a fuckin' Cheese cake.. YUMM!!

OK.. Now BB DJ3 was fuckn' Sick.. ok... what i liked about his set was that he had some Acid BB goin' on 4 a looong time during his set... WHOA.. then he went strait in2 Future BB after that 2 close... I Loved his closeing track.. & as he was spinning.. his shit got more faster & Man... it was fuckin' Awesome man!!

So like lastnight was BB fun fun... alota people showed up.. Finally after sooo long I saw Jack & it was fun fun catchin' uyp w/ homeboy!! =)  Ms Audio Angel was in the house & it was fun booty bumping w/ her on the flooor.. ok.. Hello 2Day.. Bam & 'Shida had an 80's dance off w/ each other during BB DJ3's set.. it was Dope & heeeeeella funny @ the same time.. I swear man.. never seen Shida dance that hard b4... 

Seriously.. i've never in a long time moved consisteantly like last night on the dance floor.. I was goin' Crazy... the only time I stopped was 2 get some air outside, but i was always on the floor like just moving... i did have some Janet Jackson moments when I was  like daydreaming I was 1 of her dancers while i was danincg... LoL

Then when the night ended... oh yeah.. I "missed" bart again by "accident" lastnight & I as just expectin' 2 kick it the City 'til BART opened... but Mr Bam took me home suprisingly.. it was Dope!!  I mean.. totally unexpected, but mondo appreciated!!! YAY!!  it was Dope... we haaaad sooo much 2 talk about, even more so than all the shit talk we do when we 1st C each other... oooops.... LoL... Didn't mean 2 tell ya'll that.. LMAO

Oh man... such a fun night!  Thanks Bam... oh yeah.. Marc(o).. U owe Bam Gas money 4 taking me home!!!  LoL ;)


Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] bsp:  MASH-UP  :  may 21  :  Odeed vs. Wish  :  breaks in yo' face

ok folks, Evil Breaks is back and we will do it proper this time.  FURIOUS 
went off with 4 rooms of sound.  this time, we bring it back to one room of 
bangin' ass breaks and a proper chill room.  it's time for....

MASH-UP
friday, may 21st
9pm-4am
secure, 250+ capacity san francisco venue
$7 presale, $10 at the door

DJs:
Odeed (moonshine / laba / w.e.)
DJ Wish (w.e. / baltimore)
A:Dubl (Breakthru)
Majere (Elektrosorcery) - Special Breaks Set
Aaron Jae vs. Athena (AaronJae.com/Seekr vs. Gravity Crew)
DJ Bam vs. Nick Nyquil (Invibe/Evil Breaks vs Oneiromancy/Ill Behavior)
M.O.D. (Evil Breaks)

and the Ambient Mafia hosting the chill room:
MC Boomerang
Fidget
Stickyboy
Harken
DJ fieldsoe
Skye
Hallucid


Peep the flyer here:
http://evilbreaks.com/flyers/mash_up_front_small.jpg
http://evilbreaks.com/flyers/mash_up_back.jpg


Odeed - (Moonshine/LABA/W.E.)

Odeed is simply one of the sickest producers and dj's/turntablists around. 
He has had multiple releases on Moonshine Green with fellow producer Bionic, 
and his style of breaks easily distinguish him from other producers. He's 
had many affiliations including Moonshine, C.T.W., Downtown Dwellars, 2 
Covert Capin's, and of course L.A.B.A. One of his most recent performances 
in the Bay (May, 2003) was at 1015 where he opened up for Uberzone, and we 
are proud to bring him back again for a performance not to be missed.

vs

DJ Wish (W.E. - Baltimore, MD)

Originally hailing from Balmtimore, MD dj Wish has made a name for herself 
with her unique style of breaks. She has had many residencies to include, 
The Edge (DC), Tracks (DC), and The Spot (Baltimore). She has also worked 
closely with Shaken Not Stirred Records, Deep Rising Productions, F(x) 
productions, and she has performed at the world famous Buzz (Nation) in 
Washington DC. Odeed and Wish are currently working on a few tracks 
together, and this event is going to be part of their nation wide tour to 
promote their new label W.E. Recordings. I've been told we might get to hear 
some unreleased tracks that are sure to tear up the dance floor.


This event will be a small 250 capacity two room held in San Francisco at a 
new, secure venue, and we'll be bangin out the Breaks from 9pm till 4 am

Presales: $7
Door: $10

Tickets will be available at Skills, F-8, and Solid Grooves shortly and 
online at:
www.Groovetickets.com

More Information:

408.278.5211
www.EvilBreaks.com

< Brandon / DJ Bam >

http://www.invibe.com/bam

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: underground basswaves - 04-24-2004

Well, of course I'm going to tell you yes.  All of us are pretty darn
good DJs.  None of us are super star.  You'll probably hear a handfull
of loose mixes throughout the night.  But the flow will be good.  The music
will be good.  And we're putting a lot of work into making it "Not just
another $10 underground in some warehouse."

If you're not convinced, hit me up off list and I can get you some demos
of some of the DJs.

-Erik

>ok folks, Evil Breaks is back and we will do it proper this time.  FURIOUS 
>went off with 4 rooms of sound.  this time, we bring it back to one room of 
>bangin' ass breaks and a proper chill room.  it's time for....
>
>MASH-UP
>friday, may 21st
>9pm-4am
>secure, 250+ capacity san francisco venue
>$7 presale, $10 at the door
>
>DJs:
>Odeed (moonshine / laba / w.e.)
>DJ Wish (w.e. / baltimore)
>A:Dubl (Breakthru)
>Majere (Elektrosorcery) - Special Breaks Set
>Aaron Jae vs. Athena (AaronJae.com/Seekr vs. Gravity Crew)
>DJ Bam vs. Nick Nyquil (Invibe/Evil Breaks vs Oneiromancy/Ill Behavior)
>M.O.D. (Evil Breaks)

>MC Boomerang
>Fidget
>Stickyboy
>Harken
>DJ fieldsoe
>Skye
>Hallucid
>
>
>Peep the flyer here:
>http://evilbreaks.com/flyers/mash_up_front_small.jpg
>http://evilbreaks.com/flyers/mash_up_back.jpg
>
>
>Odeed - (Moonshine/LABA/W.E.)
>
>Odeed is simply one of the sickest producers and dj's/turntablists around. 
>He has had multiple releases on Moonshine Green with fellow producer 
>Bionic, and his style of breaks easily distinguish him from other 
>producers. He's had many affiliations including Moonshine, C.T.W., Downtown 
>Dwellars, 2 Covert Capin's, and of course L.A.B.A. One of his most recent 
>performances in the Bay (May, 2003) was at 1015 where he opened up for 
>Uberzone, and we are proud to bring him back again for a performance not to 
>be missed.
>
>vs
>
>DJ Wish (W.E. - Baltimore, MD)
>
>Originally hailing from Balmtimore, MD dj Wish has made a name for herself 
>with her unique style of breaks. She has had many residencies to include, 
>The Edge (DC), Tracks (DC), and The Spot (Baltimore). She has also worked 
>closely with Shaken Not Stirred Records, Deep Rising Productions, F(x) 
>productions, and she has performed at the world famous Buzz (Nation) in 
>Washington DC. Odeed and Wish are currently working on a few tracks 
>together, and this event is going to be part of their nation wide tour to 
>promote their new label W.E. Recordings. I've been told we might get to 
>hear some unreleased tracks that are sure to tear up the dance floor.
>
>
>This event will be a small 250 capacity two room held in San Francisco at a 
>new, secure venue, and we'll be bangin out the Breaks from 9pm till 4 am
>
>Presales: $7
>Door: $10
>
>Tickets will be available at Skills, F-8, and Solid Grooves shortly and 
>online at:
>www.Groovetickets.com
>
>More Information:
>
>408.278.5211
>www.EvilBreaks.com
>

I can follow a thread with greater ease. To each their own with what works
best.

Friday, April 16, 2004 ** Progression w/ guest JEFFREY ALLEN **

pro=B7gres=B7sion n.
The process of progressing; progress.
Movement from one member of a continuous series to the next.
A continuous series; a sequence.

Mad LOVE to all those who made our Sunday's a success. As intended we have =
secured a new night, at the same location. Our new monthly event will fall =
on the 3rd Friday's of each month. Our Next Event is April 16th, starting @=
 6:00 pm

Same great resident's, all new guest dj's, and that consistent progressive =
napalm that you've come to enjoy, being dropped without hesitation. We are =
putting out a call for the masses to join our party, a temporal community w=
here an attitude of acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the=
 next chapter in our underground movement, with its roots founded on electr=
onic music and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Friday, April 16, 2004 ** Elektrosorcery presents Aries **

Aries subjects are courageous leaders with a genuine concern for those they=
 command, being responsible people, it is rare that they will use their sub=
ordinates to obtain their own objectives as leaders, but occasionally it do=
es happen. They do not make very good followers because they are too "take =
charge". They may be unwilling to obey or submit to directions for which th=
ey can see no reason, or with which they disagree. They are much concerned =
with self, both positively and negatively - self-reliant but also self cent=
ered (sometimes) and concerned with their own personal advancement and phys=
ical satisfaction. Their immense energy makes them aggressive and restless,=
 argumentative occasionally, headstrong, quick tempered, easily offended an=
d capable of holding grudges if they feel themselves affronted.

With Aries DJs: Kid Wicked, SemaJ, Element, Goober, & Jesse Gonzalez.

A Super Special Seekr Space with: Aaron Jae, Allen, David Bu Hau, Cyrus, Sc=
ottO, & Dr. Kipper.

And an Elektrosorcery Summoning Chamber with: Majere, James Dub, The Doctor=
, Nick Nyquil, Pandacon, & Leon Cook.

Zodiac ritual room by Jeremy S.
$10 tickets at F-8, Skills, and Solid Grooves. $15 at the door.

Friday, April 23, 2004 ** SOMA Sessions: D&B w/DJ FLIGHT + ROHAN **

SOMA Sessions
Drum & Bass Fourth Fridays @ AsiaSF

Friday April 23, 2004

DJ FLIGHT (BBC 1Xtra, Metalheadz - UK)

Nathalie Wright aka DJ Flight's accomplishments speak for themselves; a res=
ident at the legendary Metalheadz Sunday Sessions and at Fabio's Swerve nig=
ht in London, host of her own radio show, "Next Chapter" on BBC's 1Xtra and=
, most recently, a co-producer with Breakage as "Alias" for 31 Records. All=
 this plus a heavy DJ touring schedule showcasing the latest cuts from all =
flavors of upfront D&B adds up to a knockout Bay Area debut.

ROHAN (Bassbin Recordings - Dublin)

At the heart of Ireland's Drum 'n Bass scene lies Bassbin Recordings in Dub=
lin. Co-founded by Rohan and Naphta in 1996, the organization has grown to =
include sublabels, Breakin, Solas and Looney Toonz and is home to such tale=
nts as Beta 2, Zero Tolerance, Equinox and Breakage. SOMA Sessions welcomes=
 the return of the Bassbin don for another rolling set of dubbed-out floor =
smashers.

May Day Trivia:

^=D5 Traditional May Day celebrations were pre-Christian agricultural festi=
vals. Eventually the significance was lost and the practices survived merel=
y as popular festivities. (Which can also be said about other holidays: Hal=
loween, Christmas, Easter.)

^=D5 A widespread superstition held that washing the face in the May Day mo=
rning dew would beautify the skin.

^=D5 In Hawaii, May Day is Lei Day. Everyone gives the gift of a lei to ano=
ther, putting it around the receiver's neck and accompanying the gift with =
the traditional kiss. Observing practices of the islanders for centuries, L=
ei Day began to be observed officially in 1928. Some Hawaiian celebrations =
are complete with pageants, a Lei Queen and her court.

^=D5 In 1889, a congress of world Socialist parties held in Paris voted to =
support the U.S. labor movement's demand for an 8-hour day. It chose May 1,=
 1890, as a day of demonstrations in favor of the 8-hour day. Afterward, Ma=
y 1 became a holiday called Labor Day in many nations. It resembles the Sep=
tember holiday in the U.S. The holiday is especially important in socialist=
 and Communist countries--when political demonstrations are held.


http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D1241

s stories in the underground house movement. Ask yourself how many globally=

t -- one who is unassuming, yet enjoys a cult following and who places arti=
stic integrity above all else. Owner of Ovum Recordings and remixer of mega=

appearences in San Francisco, so don't miss out.

ree new releases coming out simultaneously on Silicone Soul's Darkroom Dubs=

ooves along with red melon biz partner JZ.  No stranger to the Melon experi=

ATMOSFERE

After a brief hiatus Fatsouls is proud to present a very special Atmosfere =
session

As some of you may know, we have made changes to the event's schedule. Atmo=
sfere is now held intermittently as opposed to its usual monthly schedule.

Following the first two highly successful Deep and Sexy albums, Wave Music =
proudly presents the third installment in the series. This time Matthias "M=
atty" Heilbronn continues the legacy established by Francois K. and Ron Tre=
nt, crafting another masterful mix of sultry soul that keeps the pulse pump=
ing from start to finish.


Join us for the San Francisco Release party in support of the Deep & Sexy 3=
 album on Wave Music.

              Atmosfere

        (A Fatsouls Production)

     Saturday, May 8, 2004

     Club Six - 60 6 Street

     (between Market & Mission @ Jessie)

                with resident DJ Said

         (Performing "To Motherland" Live)

&

  special guest

Matthias "Matty" Heilbronn

(Wave Music, Soulflower Production, NY)

Throughout his illustrious career, Matthias has steadily achieved internati=
onal acclaim for his trademark sophisticated soulful sound: a glorious blen=
d of soulful, jazz-inflected deep house, percussive Afro-Latin rhythms and =
infectious progressive tribal beats.  He has rocked parties and festivals a=
ll over the world with his spellbinding DJ sets and seamless musical journe=
ys, not to mention receiving the #1 of the decade spot by DJ Magazine for h=
is Wave/Chez/Naked compilation CD.

+

Mauricio Aviles

(Naked Music, Loveslap Records)

&

Rasaki Aladokun

(Performing Live)

Rasaki is a miracle percussionist with over 25 years of experience.  He has=
 been a featured artist in the recording of many notable musicians such as =
King Sunny Ade, Stevie Wonder and Babatunde Olatunji to name a few. Don't m=
iss his extraordinary fusion of talking drum, conga, bongo and house music.

         Doors Open / 10pm -4am / 21+  with ID

        Cover Charge $10 before Midnight.

         www.fatsouls.com, www.wavemusic.com,
                       www.clubsix1.com

ave Music - =ADcomes legendary Matty Heilbronn to the decks, for a sultry a=
nd soulful ride worth every drop of sweat.   - XLR8R

l already know and love... Great label, great guy!  I really can't fault th=

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] (nrr) who's on ********?

i would like to suggest the program peer guardian.

the program is available @ http://www.methlabs.org/

it's basically a light-weight firewall diesigned specifically for p2p
program users.  it has a block list of ip addresses and ip address ranges of
people such as the RIAA and the MPAA and other organizations who are known
for spreading bogus files and/or are known for sniffing for people who are
sharring specific files to try and go after them and get them in trouble or
what not......

ummm, yeah.... its a great thing to have whether you are using the kazaa
network, the eMule network, Bit Torrent Network, the Soul Seek network, etc,
etc...... basically it is useful for all of them.....

-tim

Subject: [sfraves] [bsp] weekend happenings


For the 21+ crowd there's HuggerMugger tongiht ... a club I help do that's
been banging a great little techno monthly for a few sessions now.  Free,
located at Lit (6th and Mission), cozy yet strange vibe, dark dance floor.
9pm-2am.  http://tech-on.com/huggermugger.html

Sunday things get really silly, I'm entering my first laptop battle at
Club6.  It's totally open format, so expect to hear techno, ambient,
dubbed out goodness, glitch hop, noisecore, experiments launched sideways
at your head or whatever keeps you going for the next round from a bunch
of Sf's laptop totin' freaks.  16 contestants go single elimination to
determine whose cuisine reigns supreme.  Club 6 - 21+ $5 9pm-2am.
http://sf-laptopbattle.org/

hope to see you there!
andyw

Experience... THAISOUL 

With very special guest JASK (Soulfuric, Thaisoul) 

Also with RUBEN MANCIAS and JORGE TEREZ 

** We present this extended version of Devotion in support of San Francisco Late Night Coalition's effort to rally support for Mark Leno's proposed bill extending last call to 4am in San Francisco. SFLNC will be chartering a bus that will leave at 6:30am (after the party) from the EndUp to Sacramento where the Assembly will be voting on this bill. We urge you to check out www.sflnc.org for more information!!

>will be good. And we're putting a lot of work into making it "Not just
>another $10 underground in some warehouse."
>
>If you're not convinced, hit me up off list and I can get you some demos
>of some of the DJs.
>
>-Erik

hey whats up

I saw on the news earlier today, an sf supervisor talking about new =
legislation for producers of one night events.

It came up after the death of that one youg guy at that ymca party like =
3 mos ago. I believe it's named after the young man who died.

she said that one time event producers will have to have complete =
background checks, before any events. They're doing this to protect =
people from shady event producers. Also the leg. plans to heavily =
penalize producers who have events in which violence breaks out. . .=20
I wonder how massive events would be effected, since I ALWAYS see fights =
at those parties, and theres pretty much always some irresponsible =
person going home in an ambulance.

I thought it was interesting. . .

is the SFLNC doing anything about it (do they even know about it) ?=20
Certainly it's much much more important than helping drinkers drink more =
alcohol. . .

I know some clubs a couple years back, like 1015, had to turn in lists =
of events, dj's, promoters and such to the SF coppers for =
review/acceptance/denial. . .that was argued at the time as being unfair =
to the promoters/etc . .  I would think that this leg. would effect all =
one night events in sf's future, possibly make it difficult/impossible =
for normal people to get events together.

. . .=20

: )

take care all

arycK
